image:image.image:title: Captive
image:image.image:caption:
Encore civilization delineates the abstract luxury of happiness. In conscience pick up the luscious language of love from the avid age of advertising. From here belches a lament of a fledgling spirit in pursuit of a diseased demiurge. The story of a desolate fugitive soul on a surreal trip is 'Captive'.
Captive' has been selected for 14th International Short & Independent Film Festival Bangladesh.

image:image.image:title: To Catch the Muse
image:image.image:caption: An uninspired writer plots to catch his muse to make her help him finish his book.

image:image.image:title: One Window Will Suffice
image:image.image:caption: Narges and her mother are living in an apartment in Tehran. Narges wants a modern lifestyle while her mother lives as a traditional woman. This issue raises many conflicts and problems between them creating a distance in their relationship. Narges is suffering from depression and sexual obsession. She hides her relationship with her boyfriend from her mother. Her psychological crises, entwined with feelings of guilt and depression, leads her into a dangerous emotional situation.

image:image.image:title: Volition
image:image.image:caption: In this world, we are given many gifts, and opportunities to utilize these gifts. Some people get lucky in their search for greatness while others allow fear to sabotage them. What if you were given a second chance? Would you take that chance and thrive or would you choose to ignore it? Fate doesn't control our journey, we are all given a choice. This is one woman's opportunity for transformation, truth and discovery into the power of free will.

image:image.image:title: The Lunatic Fringe
image:image.image:caption: An alien entity who has the ability to inhabit the bodies of others navigates through the tricky minefield of human relationships with the help of its earthbound "handler".

image:image.image:title: Hi, Karen
image:image.image:caption: A fast talking young man's life comes to a head over four phone calls in a walk in the park.

image:image.image:title: Project P.R.O.M
image:image.image:caption: Project P.R.O.M. is going to be the “American Pie” of the next generation! Imagine getting dumped three weeks before the senior prom, getting pushed into a last minute date that turns out to be a disaster, and having to share the whole experience with your younger sister that was invited by one of your friends. That’s exactly what happens to Tommy Richards in Project P.R.O.M.. When Tommy’s night becomes unbearable, when the unthinkable happens, he snaps and sets out on a personal journey that results in danger, laughter, and the night of his life! Will Tommy be able to vindicate himself and save his reputation, or will he never be able to show his face in town again?

image:image.image:title: Red Ribbons
image:image.image:caption: A young boy's passion for film leads to an outlet for his grief over the loss of his mother.

image:image.image:title: Sing Swan Song
image:image.image:caption: The protagonist, Ulysses Tarnowski, is an up-and-coming performing artist living in Greenwich Village in the early 60’s. Ulysses himself is in his late 20’s, and moved to New York after growing up in Providence, Rhode Island. He was raised by his single mother, Margaret, a Holocaust survivor from Poland. Growing up, Ulysses knew nothing of his father aside from the fact that he was a married Merchant Marine when Ulysses’ mother became pregnant at age 16; a year before Ulysses left for New York, he discovered a photograph of his mother and a sailor, along with a letter addressed to Margaret from someone named ‘John Abraham’, presumably the young man in the photo and Ulysses’ father. It is worth noting that this story is not intended to take the side of anyone in particular - it just so happens to be something of a ‘bird’s eye view’ over Ulysses. The intent of the story is to start a conversation, and hopefully develop a distinct perception for the individual viewer - to me, that’s how life works. Nobody is 100% right or wrong; we’re all have our own unique perceptions and biases that are shaped by our individual human experiences. The great thing about telling this story is that it exists purely to provoke thought, even at the most basic of levels. The conflict of the story lies between Ulysses, and everyone else’s reaction to his art.

image:image.image:title: Kalil Trailer
image:image.image:caption: Bounty hunters entice a local Afghan man to come with them to the city to donate a kidney.

image:image.image:title: Nahweh: The Possessed
image:image.image:caption: In this screenplay, we find that not everyone is immuned to evil. As a matter of truth, the evil of this world can possess anything not already possessed by the good.

image:image.image:title: A Stirring Reminder
image:image.image:caption: Norman comes from a colorful family. As he takes us on a journey through their past endeavors, we see that even the simplest of circumstances can turn out deadly. This is what Norman is counting on as he finally takes his chance in hopes of following in their footsteps and becoming...a murderer!
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Transatlantic cruise
image:image.image:caption: transatlantic voyage of the Portuguese ship N.R.P. Sagres lasting a total of 97 days in order to be the home of Portugal at the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro 2016, stops in City of Praia (Cape Verde), Recife, Salvador da Bahia, Rio de Janeiro and Mindel

image:image.image:title: ??Lost & Gain
image:image.image:caption: This movie is originally produced by high school students, aiming at expanding Chinese culture and promoting cultural exchanges between China and other countries. More importantly, it reminds people of the idea “Happiness lies in contentment” making the audience pondering the significance of “lost and gain”. Lost And Gain is a short narrative film. It tells a story of Zheng Hai in his 90s. 60 years ago (2016), the then overseas Chinese Zheng worked hard and he was quite successful in his career. Unfortunately, Zheng was diagnosed with cancer due to the workload. At the result, Zheng decided to go back to his hometown-Beijing-where he had not returned for so many years. In Houhai, a lake in the middle area of Beijing where had preserved so much historical culture, Zheng saw the place where he once lived during his childhood was as beautiful as before. It was so heart-warming to reunite with his family and friends. It was so charming to see people there living a life happily. Because of the disease, Zheng struggled with the idea of “life or death” in agony. With his deep contemplation, Zheng eventually came to realize the true meaning in the saying of “happiness lies in contentment” and the philosophy of “lost and gain”. Finally, he resolutely quit his job in the US and returned to his hometown. Thus Zheng has been living happily until now.

image:image.image:title: No Good Deed, Goes Unpunished
image:image.image:caption: In an attempt to cure his baby daughters disease, the opportunity to provide the world with an endless supply of medical marijuana or cash in on Millions presents itself to a scientist, who learns the hard way, no good deed goes unpunished.

image:image.image:title: WING MAN
image:image.image:caption: Calvin Ryan gave up on his dreams to focus his attention on raising his new born son, neglecting his personal life in the process. 10 years later, Calvin still single, decides to give love a shot BUT a scandal puts Calvin in Hot Water and his budding relationship on the brink. Calvin's left with one shot to save his budding relationship, to pull it off he needs a Wing Man. Who better than his 10 year old son.

image:image.image:title: Back To Victoria
image:image.image:caption: The film reflects the misconceptions and resulting mistrust of Islam by westerners. Actions of individual Muslims can be misinterpreted. Two friends are preparing for an important day. Both are praying with reading from the Quran. Both men take their leave from the respective partners and journey to the target destination, London’s Victoria railway station. It seems evident, from their behaviour, that they maybe intent to commit an act of terror. The first one appears highly stressed, becoming more agitated and physically and psychologically unwell. At the end of the film we will discover if they achieve their mission.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Cut & Confidences
image:image.image:caption:
There are those appointments where one goes backwards ... but, to his hairdresser. Where a head change can mean a life change; where, under the scissors, every customer comes to reveal its worst as its best secrets. Sometimes tender, sometimes sordid, sometimes funny, always exciting to hear!
Web series of 6 episodes. Luc Vincent, owner of the eponymous hairdresser, becomes the confidant of his clients.

image:image.image:title: Group Session With Satan
image:image.image:caption: Four patients of a psychiatrist recount their equally rapid rises and falls in fortune thanks to four very different yet eerily similar embodiments of Satan.

image:image.image:title: THE MONICA CARE AFFAIR
image:image.image:caption:
The Monica Care Affair will be told in ten chapters.
With Monica, day or night, you never get bored!
Who is Monica?
Beatrice Normand Tessier – alias MonicaCare is a former bank robber converted in the sale of cosmetics. Still under the close supervision of her probation officer, she must show their credentials. However, her agent is not fooled. Rather, she seems convinced that she bamboozles and Sophie Desmarais – the officer – determined to see through the game of this extravagant woman.
Angel black day Monica became a blonde demon night. The Queen, this is her! There is no king on her chessboard. Beatrice becomes Monica.

image:image.image:title: Double Face
image:image.image:caption: Bruno is obsessed with discovering the nature of death. The recent inexplicable disappearance of his mother disturbs him and starts to discover the reason for the end of life without looking at the means.

image:image.image:title: MYSTERYINK
image:image.image:caption: This “Final Destination” meets tattoos, ths trilogy about killer ink that details blueprints to its’ victim’s deaths. Dr. V. and Maria create the ink and open the first shop which details the stories of a kingpin, a drug dealer, and a serial killer together leads to a showdown that can only spell death. The second story they move the shop where they run into a surfer, a dirty cop, and a model, and the last shop follows a card shark, drug lord, and stripper. People grow darker with the ink or change their lives around because what happens in this mystery will make people tremble as your first tattoo could be their last…

image:image.image:title: Flea Bit
image:image.image:caption: Murray Hoyle is a college-town drug dealer and bookie, relying on his own ingenuity and a network of well-off students desperate for an adrenaline rush to create bettable events and profit off their outcomes. He discovers his greatest spectacle yet in the unlikeliest of places: the 2016 Republican primary. Murray uses the political circus of name calling and finger pointing to lure in a crowd of young bettors, exploiting their weaknesses and using them as a market for an even more profitable product: cocaine. He works hard to ignore the fact that he is addicted to his own merchandise, gambling in his role of bookie by giving odds that teeter on the edge of sanity, and hoping that the payoff will satisfy his narcotic sweet tooth for just one more week; when Murray's suppliers come to make good on his debts, however, he finds that his precarious balancing act comes with deadly consequences.

image:image.image:title: GATESEVEN
image:image.image:caption: INSPIRED FROM A TRUE STORY - A haunted church that's been the site for gruesome murders and missing persons for years, invites the devil himself to come to earth unless he can be stopped by a professor of the supernatural and smart ass detective. People go to a haunted cemetery amidst an abandoned church overlooking an endless field. Gateseven used to be a regular town in the early 1900s until one day people begin to disappear. When the townspeople searched for answers they find the town priest and his assistant making a human sacrifice. After a thorough search, they discover bodies underneath the church of all the missing people and more. They decide to hang the priest and his assistant in the church and burn the place to the ground. A few weeks later after all has returned to normal, the church somehow reappears more ominous and creepy than ever as things get worse than before. Everyone but a few move out as Gateseven becomes a ghost town, literally. Today kids go looking for a thrill, but end up missing or worse as detective Kastle Khan is called in to find out the mysteries of this place. Not knowing much of this kind of stuff, he searches for an expert in the supernatural field and finds the lovely, Dr. Katherine Hernandez, a professor on the matter. Together they delve into a mystery over their heads as Licone and his two wives, the only house and people to live at the town offer no help, only more mystery. Kastle learns about Katherine's past with this town and being one of the few to make it out of the field alive. All for a deeper purpose as we meet the Devil himself who is using Gateseven as his entrance to earth. Now he needs only a pure body for his voyage and woman for his breeding. He uses Licone as his servant to lure Kastle and Katherine into Gateseven for a lucrative reunion. Kastle and Katherine are the only ones who can stop the Devil's master plan, but also complete it. We learn that after his failure here at Gateseven, there are plenty of other gateways for the plan to succeed.

image:image.image:title: La Vie En Noir
image:image.image:caption: The path of a dancer trying to find out her place in the Universe, while her doubts and thoughts are meditated by the Cosmos.

image:image.image:title: What No One Sees
image:image.image:caption: A journey through the sights and sounds in the life of an abused victim. A story where the scene has happened but the sound is delayed.

image:image.image:title: Origins
image:image.image:caption: An intergalactic war between the vampiric Kieran's, the intellectual Harkarian's, their aquatic protectors the Atlantians and one human Earthling. Leading the invasion is the terrifying but tragic villian Dragola who longs to rid his people of their curse. Ultimately his attempts are thwarted by his own minions and the resistance led by the fearless Atlantian warrior Cleito.

image:image.image:title: My Tempest
image:image.image:caption: A Grandfather tries to reconcile with his son through his granddaughter.

image:image.image:title: Even After Death
image:image.image:caption: Derrick and Anne are a happy couple, but their relationship hits a rock when Derrick dies. But that's not where this couple's journey ends. Without Derrick accepting his own death, it makes things that much harder for Ann.

image:image.image:title: The Journey Of Riya Ep 1
image:image.image:caption: The Journey of Riya follows a dark elf bounty hunter, on a quest to find a legendary keep, as she travels the length and breadth of a world as strange as the one she left.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: ROOM 142
image:image.image:caption: Abigail wakes up in a hospital room and has no memory how she got there.

image:image.image:title: Tell me why you obsess me
image:image.image:caption: Man, woman; black, white; straight, gay... We are all the sames constantly fighting between our dark side and the light in us

image:image.image:title: Special Cases Unit
image:image.image:caption: A team of FBI agents try to work hard at the office, but they don´t get along very well.

image:image.image:title: Blood Trigger
image:image.image:caption: Female assassin April Righetti, nicknamed "The Tarantula" due to her penchant for killing her targets like a spider, desperately wants out of the business. She envisions an opportunity at a new life with her boyfriend -- until he becomes her latest ordered target. It is a decision that triggers a bloody and surprising end result. April has to protect her unborn child, learn how to create a family she has never known and, ultimately, take down the company that has sworn to kill her if she is ever going to find true peace.

image:image.image:title: Wake Traci
image:image.image:caption: English songbird Traci Callen finds herself alone but happy in the great state of Texas after a bad breakup in England. When she finally thinks her life is getting back on track, her past comes calling in the form of an obsessed, deranged and humiliated ex-boyfriend.

image:image.image:title: PELTS
image:image.image:caption: A group of snowboarders are haunted at a deserted ski lodge by a cursed Indian on a eternal quest for new skin to cover his body.

image:image.image:title: The Groundsmen
image:image.image:caption: Searching for gas to refuel their stranded dirt bike, two brothers discover a mansion hidden in the forest.

image:image.image:title: Tannhauser in the Venusberg
image:image.image:caption: After accidentally discovering the Venusberg, Tannhauser, a sexually repressed German poet-knight, stumbles through a series of misunderstandings with its inhabitants and is erroneously put on trial for sex crimes.

image:image.image:title: Game in the Garden
image:image.image:caption: A Christian and a Muslim get into an altercation over a spot in a public park, while an entomologist passively observes the scene unfold, which progressively becomes more and more violent.

image:image.image:title: P.S. I Love You
image:image.image:caption: Two girls run a blog with hidden identity as they try to help young people with their love problems.

image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: The Overpass
image:image.image:caption: Just when you thought it was safe to drink yourself to death.

image:image.image:title: Soul Bones
image:image.image:caption: A southern man preparing for doomsday forms a unique relationship with an African American boy that moves in to the neighborhood.

image:image.image:title: In 25 words or less
image:image.image:caption: 1942. Anna and Irmgard, mother and daughter, have been separated by persecution and war. The mother stayed back, in Germany, hoping, in vain, to preserve what was left of the life that once was. The daughter fled to Britain, hoping to save her own life and the future she is carrying. Now, in the eve of a new life coming to the world, the two of them can only communicate through the 25 words the Red Cross messages permit. But the feelings and memories always have the power to go deeper than that.

image:image.image:title: Moon
image:image.image:caption: Man's first step on the moon.

image:image.image:title: The Goldenhill Fortune
image:image.image:caption: Two brothers, Wilber and Reginald Goldenhill, are notified one day that their father, who left them when they were very young, has passed away. The father's long time friend and lawyer, Irwin Webb, comes and arranges a meeting with the brothers. He explains that when their father left them, he went on to become a very wealthy man. He has a very large inheritance to leave them. The lawyer plays a video of the deceased father giving the details. Here's where the catch comes in. In order to receive their inheritance, the brothers must fulfill their fathers last wish. The lawyer has a list of experiences their father had always wanted to share with his boys, but never did. They must experience them now, using the lawyer as the surrogate father. Irwin knew their father best, and Irwin is the one who makes the final call on whether the experiences are fulfilled or not. Once the list is complete, the Irwin will finalize the transfer of the estate and the boys will be rich beyond their wildest dreams. The screenplay won Best Comedy Script at the 2016 West Field Screenwriting Awards and was a finalist in the 2015 Creative World Awards and the 2015 Zed Fest Film Festival. The screenplay was also accepted into the 2016 Beverly Hills Film Festival, 2015 Hollywood Sky Film Festival and was a Screenplay 2nd Runner Up in the 2015 TMFF Film Festival.

image:image.image:title: The peacock
image:image.image:caption: According to Taoist perspective on life, humans are controlled by their dreams, but these dreams are indeed ridiculous and moving in circle repeatedly. The film shows human being's ideal construction and state of mind--delicacy, absurdity, anxiety, and confusion. It also involves the debate over peacock's tail evolution in order to seek for the meaning of life I mixed my memories about school life and mind of states in my childhood into imagination, and deconstructed the ways to constructing dreams.

image:image.image:caption: This is an episode length script for the pilot LAPS: Los Angeles Pet Squad. Written by Chandler Bolt and Fred Fox Jr. (Happy Days, Family Matters, Joanie Loves Chachi etc.)

image:image.image:caption: A youth from South Sudan and a boy of the Boston projects face hardship after the loss of their mothers.

image:image.image:title: Primal/Primal Business
image:image.image:caption: Two theater workers fail to realize their manager has closed the theater, devolving them into a primal state.

image:image.image:title: Trump: 2019
image:image.image:caption: This is a satirical look at our future now that Trump is president.

image:image.image:title: BustED
image:image.image:caption: BUSTED is short film written along the lines of films such as Obsessed and Fatal Attraction. The film revolves around the misogyny of a young man against his fiancé. The two lovers have been together for a long time but the unsuspecting girlfriend had no idea that he has been engaged in multiple affairs. His fiancé is often away for multiple days for her job which gives the boyfriend ample for his secret liaisons. However, one day when he comes home to what he expects to be another one of his happy trysts he is meet by what quickly becomes they nightmare of every cheating lovers mind.

image:image.image:title: Good Luck Duck
image:image.image:caption: Kelly is a down on her luck girl who can't seem to do anything right. One day when she's running late for her test, a knock at her door changes her life. She finds a rubber duck, who when dropped in water comes to life and becomes her closest friend. The duck changes her life and she changes his.

image:image.image:title: Mutual coffin
image:image.image:caption: A Film By: Hassan Mokhtari from Iran

image:image.image:title: Orange
image:image.image:caption: “Orange” is a poetic and experimental short film which portrays the conflicts, taboos, fears and traditions of Iranian young generation facing modernity. "Orange” starts with POV shots that almost have the same durations. Until the fifth scene, they are either silent, or have sound without image. In addition to storytelling by using the elements of cinema such as: sound and motion picture, film gives a different concept to these elements and shows how form and content can’t be separated in a simple way.

image:image.image:title: MURDER.COM
image:image.image:caption: Screenwriter, John Cole,is disconnecting from his family. He can't stop watching the hottest new Web site of the 90's, DebbieCam.com Debbie Winter,alone,blonde and beautiful,puts her life literally online with live digital pictures uploading to a web page every two minutes. But Cole isn't the only one who wants her-there's another.

image:image.image:title: A Sweet Dream
image:image.image:caption: A bitter-sweet allegorical look at the desires of little girl who wants the world to see her talents shine through the difficulties of her life. Written, animated and directed by Tooba Rezaei

image:image.image:title: Sweet Gin and Cold Wine
image:image.image:caption: Surrounded by temptations of the world of Western consumer culture, Amin and Hoda are in constant struggle to free their relationship from the shackles of traditional moral values and sexual taboos. A fight, a few drinks too many, and Amin finds himself in a new relationship - with a storefront mannequin. Unlike Hoda, the new girl is a game for anything. And she doesn’t talk as much. A whimsical portrait of a young generation at a crossroads.

image:image.image:title: THE MARCH ON WASHINGTON D.C. 1963
image:image.image:caption: A Jazz Tribute to MLK Jr. and all the others who March on Washington D.C. in 1963 The production feature Mother Theresa and Mahatma Gandhi...

image:image.image:title: COUNTRY MUSIC IS IN MY BLOOD
image:image.image:caption: A reporter for the African International Press come out west to interview a Country Western singer.

image:image.image:title: Fi
image:image.image:caption:
Know that the Atman is the rider in the chariot, and the body is the chariot, Know that the Buddhi (intelligence, ability to reason) is the charioteer, and Manas (mind) is the reins.
The senses are called the horses, the objects of the senses are their paths, Formed out of the union of the Atman, the senses and the mind, him they call the "enjoyer.

image:image.image:title: The Meat Thing
image:image.image:caption: Scientist, Dr. Meat Thing, prepares the perfect meal... A little too perfect.

image:image.image:title: The Northern Rhapsody
image:image.image:caption: Maya Derenkovska is a young Ukrainian photographer. After being raped, she addresses herself to the police to report her offender, but soon realizes that none wants to be bothered with such a “trivial”, domestic incident, while the country is in an unproclaimed state of war. Maya is a freelancer in charge of a reportage regarding “magic places” in Kyiv for a local anthropological magazine. These urban hills are desolate wastelands, where the only legacy of the ancient stories is the popular memory. But Maya has the gift to evoke the legends of the past with her imagination and to make them live again. While working on her reportage, she finds out that she is pregnant. The harsh reality and her vivid imagination intertwine, as Maya has to face the decision whether keep her baby or not.

image:image.image:title: Here's Jane
image:image.image:caption: An Original Short Comedy Created By JoLane Lentz

image:image.image:title: KING
image:image.image:caption: KINGis a film that is a concatenation of breath exercises that I film at 8 a.m. every day. This 23 minute film encompasses about half a year of doing this exercise and focusing on the Bible, specifically the First Book of KINGS. the animation is made from oriental lacquer scene boxes, some of them ancient and some of them new. The main percussion instrument involved is actually the frames for the top two shelves of a conversation table, made of gold colored metal, that probably had glass n it at some time,that I acquired when it was thrown over a top floor balcony of the building where I now live and have my small studio/office space. I grabbed the object out of the air before it hit my head and kept it and now use it as a musical instrument. The other percussion instrument is a hand made aboriginal drum, which can show the flow of water with time, of life and sequences of nature, because it has two sides that are used like tidal flows of oceans. Prayers for peace.

image:image.image:title: The Shelter (Official Trailer)
image:image.image:caption: Official trailer of a documentary feature named "The Shelter" (In outskirts of Rasht city in IRAN, a woman has established a shelter for curing and supporting wild and domestic animals. She has done this with the help of her family and friends).

image:image.image:title: Run Like a Girl
image:image.image:caption: Kati is about to run a marathon, the only problem is that women aren't allowed to in 1967.

image:image.image:title: Eyes in Qaah
image:image.image:caption: This feature Documentary follows the life of two young girls. Katia and Fatima had lived in one of the refugee camps inside Syria near the Turkish border, known as “Qaah” over a period of one year. The two girls had their own singing band in this camp. Furthermore, they were known for their beautiful voice and they were inseparable. Through the eyes and vocals of Katia and Fatima, their heartbreaking story narrates the agony of the Syrians who were forced to leave, and the new way of live these internally displaced had to endure. Katia had a dream of becoming a journalist in order to raise awareness about the Syrian uprising, and the grave human rights violations that are being perpetrated against the Syrian children and their families. they had left their hometown escaping airstrikes to Qaah camp, only to find more blood and massacres. Katia’s dream was struck by Syrian regime air force while in school inside the camp. Consequently, Katia was injured, transferred to a safe hospital across the border to Turkey, and later was killed. Unfortunately, Fatima lost her best friend, her singing partner, and the other half of her soul. Fatima had to undergo a traumatic experience, starting from fleeing their home, to shelling school in the camp, and being separated from her companion.

image:image.image:title: Per qualche nota di sapore / For some notes of flavour
FATALIST
image:image.image:caption: Four people are sitting on a table and discussing about destiny , until an incognito approaches and proves everything wrong . Suddenly, the nature of people on the table gets another dimension .

A long night young refugee Ghais waits for his deportation and in panic he takes a fatal decision. A black comedy.

image:image.image:title: The Pit
image:image.image:caption: American medic is injured in combat. Due to his survival in No man's land he is forced to seek shelter in the pit. But he's not alone in there...

image:image.image:title: Rosalyn
image:image.image:caption: What would you do if you lost the love of your life? Would you move on with your life? Or let life move on without you? Rosalyn is about what a man would do to keep seeing the love of his life, even if it is destroying him.

image:image.image:title: Living with Autism
image:image.image:caption: This film explores Ian who has Autism and the effect it has on him and his family. This unique insight offers the audience a refreshing look at disability and how the person with it can have such a positive effect on people who work with them or they meet.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: The Lake
image:image.image:caption: The Lake, short film, presents the story of a young woman, Tania, who lives with her father. Due to the lack of money she chooses to work in a brothel, where she is a prostitute and a stripper. Her dream, ever since she was a child, is to become a ballerina, a dream that follows her throughout the movie.

image:image.image:title: Empty
image:image.image:caption: Empty takes place one day in a middle-class apartment. It tells the story of Julia, a girl prevented from watching a movie on TV because her mother thinks it is too violent. They argue, and Julia is sent to her room for punishment. Julia thinks it's unfair that her younger brother can watch the movie, but she cannot. That is the cause of all their conflict. While grounded in her room that afternoon, Julia discovers that violence is not only on the small screen, but also in real life.

image:image.image:title: Los Angeles
image:image.image:caption: Filmed in Los Angeles and contains art in film movement.

image:image.image:title: Don't Ever Tell Music Video
image:image.image:caption: Official Music Video for "Don't Ever Tell." a short film to bring awareness, and to bring an edge of your seat reality to the world in the hopes of making people think about what is happening to us as a people and as a world where humanity and love need to be the central theme and brought back to the hearts of many. The story of local teens and adults in their lives, intertwined with stories from around the globe adding their own experiences, twists, and turns into this journey of love, friendship, adversities and loss; all leading to what? A Fairy tale ending? Will the outcome be inspiring, or will it be one of anger and hate? Only Mankind can determine this...and the journey of this film wrapped up in reality...will humanity and love win? Can they still...in today's times? Watch the movie and find out! This is the Short Film's Official Music Video; Film is currently in Post Production with Rick Bounds Director, and Jennifer Anderson-Bounds/Producer and owner of Forbidden Tear's Productions.

image:image.image:title: Capital Advice
image:image.image:caption: DJ Gwen takes over the Delaware airwaves every night from 12-5am. But when that advice gets taken literally, her world (and entire radio station) get turned upside down.

Wearing a hat like a young woman in a Renoir's painting, but dressed as a rowing champion from the shoulders to the waist or a sexy woman in her see-through skirt, she faces the viewer as if he or she was sitting in front of her in the boat. The viewer becoming the male gaze...

image:image.image:title: 1-800-Jackets
image:image.image:caption: "1-800-JACKETS" isn't just a fast-paced, stylistic, action-packed, fun-filled, playground-joyride. It's also a huge milestone in our progressive experience as filmmakers and creatives. Whether it's as a director, producer, writer, editor, actor, ect., we love to learn to make better and better movies. A group of young, aspiring filmmakers and creatives collected $650, rounded up some committed crew/talent, acquired a Sony A7SII camera, and got to work on their first "featurette" film. All of production was operated, shot, and edited in Lafayette, Louisiana - with an entirely local and diverse cast and crew.

image:image.image:title: Shock House-Short Version
image:image.image:caption:
Uploaded on Sep 11, 2011
"Spirit Inspectors" was a third rate documentary ghost hunting show attempting to answer one of the three great mysteries of life: where did we come from, why are we here and where are we going? Only ghosts could answer those questions and ambitious Ophelia Vane was determined to find one. They searched in the haunted Desert Inn at Yeehaw Junction and through the dark corridors of the Cuban Club of Ybor City but when Bobbi, suggested the infamous "Shock House" it seemed like the real deal. But no one who ever entered the weird house had ever returned. The ghost hunters were determined to uncover its secret even if it proved to be fatal for them all.

Background music from the father of the world stop motion-Wladyslaw Starewicz's two works?Les Contes de l'horloge Magique(1924)and Le roman de Renard(1930) (PS: Music copyright is 50years).This work is a tribute to the great master who was researching animations diligently in that black and white film age. Because of them, we can stand on the shoulders of giants to see the world.

image:image.image:title: Third Person Singular
image:image.image:caption: O?uz is the only one working for the night shift of the suicide call center. During his whole life, he could not take his own decisions and eventually he got stuck in a routine, meaningless cycle of life. He does not have any friend, any family member as well as a girlfriend. Even though he has been telling to the people that the life worth living, there are still a lot of things to experience, he does not believe any single word. One day, he came to a point that he could not bear any more. He decided to commit suicide. With this event, his character was split into two. With the victory of his dominant side, he experienced the most extraordinary night of his life, ever. Nevertheless, this night will never end.

image:image.image:title: The Box
image:image.image:caption:
A Short film about a unexpected box at the door. Who dropped it off? Whats inside? Why did it come here?
Director Biography
Young filmmaker, Joshua has created many videos from music videos to weddings. 'The Box' will be his first short film he has created as a filmmaker.
He has worked and learned along side award winning filmmaker Daniel Alexander, producing videos and ideas for future films.
'The Box' has been Joshua's most recent and only film to date which has been submitted to many film festivals. He constantly has continuous, creative idea's wrote down which are in production.
As well as Joshua wanting to become a professional filmmaker for his career, he also loves to do it as a hobby. He is very excited and eager to release more films to the public in the near future.
Director Statement
'The Box' which is a suspenseful thriller, with a run time of 4:34 minutes long, is a film about a women who has a strange box arrive at her door. She has no knowledge to whats inside, with a date on 'The Box', only time will tell whats sealed within.
Actress, Charlotte Wisdom performed very well as it's my first time working with her. She tackled and executed everything I asked of her with no hesitation.
The look I gave the film was a dull and eerie feel which I also wanted the viewer to feel enticed while watching. The sound effects, suspense music in the film and facial expressions made by Charlotte made me feel like I trapped a certain feeling. This feeling is perfect for the kind of film I was looking for with mystery. A lot of fast cuts were added to show different days to speed up the pace. Towards the end I slowed the cuts down with longer scenes to get the mind thinking into what is going on.

image:image.image:title: Efímera
image:image.image:caption: Peregrín's first beauty film is “Efímera" (Ephemeral), a personal project about the unknown and the imperfect beauty and a wonderful reflection on the passing of time, a metaphor of the ephemeral nature of beauty and life. Focusing on the varied interconnected artistic looks of a female model, Efímera is a metaphor for the four ages of human beings. Concepts such as life and death are treated symbolically in this project helping Paco Peregrín to reflect on life´s fleeting solitude. Thanks to its very dramatic, powerful and artistic aesthetic, Efímera makes explicit reference to the quick passage of time but it is also a positive film about diversity and freedom that encourages us to enjoy and live life intensely without fears.

image:image.image:title: The Kneeling Man
image:image.image:caption:
Early in October of this year (2016), I saw a small item in a local paper in Taos, New Mexico, USA. It was about a man seen weeping, and kneeling as if in prayer, at a bus stop. This video is my attempt to explore that story. I am not certain whether it is a very sad story, or an inspirational one...
Or a tale that should terrify us all...revealing our moral insufficiencies, and portending an all too probable judgement.

image:image.image:title: Mimos
image:image.image:caption:
This is a biopic narrative film about Tarak Dutta, or Tarak Da as he is fondly called, who is a mime artist. He is one of the most prolific exponents of his art in this country who performed in the 70s and 80s in Calcutta, Raipur and Cuttak with masters of theatre like Habib Tanvir.
He arrived in Mumbai with big dreams, only to find that the city of dreams is disillusioned with his art form. He realized that Mime is not recognized, not talked about, not dreamt for, and certainly not a means to earn his daily bread in this city of opportunities.
Consequently, he worked in tea stalls, earned a few pennies doing construction labor, slept on roads, struggled barefoot; as the artist in him fell apart each day, like plaster wears off an old, unkempt house.
Today, he lives with his wife in a small 50 square feet apartment in Malvani. A paralytic attack in 2014 has compromised his movements, but he still dreams of the stage, for that is where he belongs.

image:image.image:title: Moonie and the Spider Queen-15 min
image:image.image:caption:
Published on Jun 11, 2015
Two bored space cargo men, Perry and Torry, run into the find of the millennium, a gal who can live in outer space without any life support. Because she lives on radiation, she wears very little clothing and rides through space an astercycle. They invite her aboard their ship but before they are able to transport her to Earth, she takes off to rescue her two sisters, who are being held captive by the terrifying Spider Queen. They take off after her to Phobia's planet. Sexy, exciting. This is a short, non-nudity version of the full adult version on moonieandthespiderqueen.com.

image:image.image:title: Delicate Skeleton * Music Video( part of Venus in Chains 100 ) DSI band
image:image.image:caption: The music video "Delicate Skeleton" by the band DSI is part of the multi media project named Venus in Chains 100 for love, peace, unity and world global awareness. This video thru music points out that we are all Delicate Skeletons. In this world, it appears we are all Delicate Skeletons,filled with alot of energy , feelings and emotions. It is to show that we all should take a moment to ponder life and how we can make it a better place in this world. As Delicate Skeletons we are constructed in the same way, under our skin, are bones *skeleton structure . The skeleton is not prejudice to color, size, religion or creed. Love and understanding is the answer.

image:image.image:title: Berry and Dolly: Mushroom's cap
image:image.image:caption: Berry, the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many pretty adventures while making new friends and seeking out knowledge about the world around them. While Berry, Dolly and their friends were roaming in the forest, they noticed a sad mushroom without a cap. Each of the friends decided to bring a cap from home to make him happy.

image:image.image:title: Spheres

image:image.image:title: The Forest paper
image:image.image:caption: This animation it all about bird who want to build her nest with straw,but he get lost in to the world that is made of paper, everybody in the city tends to focus on technologies and forget to care about our mother-nature.it cause disaster like flooding. This 3D animation symbolizes the lives of people in the city nowadays, which most of them that are likely to depend on materialism and that causes them to ignore their duty, which is to protect and support the existing of our natural resources.The main purpose of this project is to present the idea of how our mother nature could with the being harm through the use of paper.

image:image.image:title: The Choice
image:image.image:caption: An Experimental short documentary about three young Georgian people. Nika, Anano and Gigi had a psychological problem, after rehabilitation they try to fit society and become its part as individuals. The images in the film tell us not the story but the state through which they got through and the state in which they are now. Discovering their inner peace, trying to find their interests, transferring their dark spots into the light, in order to get free, that’s all about them.

image:image.image:title: District Up!
image:image.image:caption: The Plaza District, Film Row, and Western Avenue. Each of these Oklahoma City districts may have a unique history and aesthetic, but they also have something in common: over the past few years they all have experienced a revival with the creation of regular events that bring businesses, neighbors, and “outsiders” together. District Up! is a feature-length documentary that shares stories and advice on district revitalization throughout Oklahoma City from the people who helped create positive change in their communities and want to inspire others to do the same.

But he has to face many difficulties in the itinerary. Will the boy pass the test?

image:image.image:title: Mississippy Missippi Tu-Polo
image:image.image:caption:
(Comedy, 86 minutes, color)
"Why write...when you can be a Writer?"
Victor d'Entrement is the quintessential young indie author--which is to say he is no longer young, "indie" because there is nothing else to call him, and not writing one damn thing. But he has a title for his masterpiece--and the more he does not write it, the more audaciously assured he becomes in his brilliance and in his inevitable posterity in the realm of American letters.
MISSISSIPPY MISSIPPI TU-POLO, the new comedy from writer/director Pablo D'Stair (Hully Gully: a new American romance) is a skewering love letter to the soul (and ego) of the unknown artist.
(featuring the music of NO, The Sad Little Stars, and Left By Snakes)

image:image.image:title: Science Fiction
image:image.image:caption:
Comedy (65 min; B&W)
Five unknown, unread, and well-past-their-prime science fiction authors grapple with obscurity, infinity, and obsolescence (...and whether robots should legitimately be allowed to enter dance competitions). Filmed in the DOGME 95 spirit, SCIENCE FICTION is an existential comedy from writer/director Pablo D'Stair (HULLY GULLY: a new American romance; Mississippy Missippi Tu-Polo)

image:image.image:title: Reasons?
image:image.image:caption:
“Reasons?” is a drama motion picture that deals with circumstances that everyday people have to face in their life. With the new stance against smoking in the last decade, “Reasons?” will help show why quitting smoking is a wise decision for the average human being.
Four childhood friends decide to try smoking after watching their parents smoking in the living room. Fast forward twenty years, the group is still friends, but now they face the challenge of quitting after years of smoking, each choosing to quit for a different reason. Now faced with the challenges of fighting their dependence on nicotine, will they each have the power to overcome what faces them, or will they let their addiction rule their life?

image:image.image:title: The Cave of Masks
image:image.image:caption: Based on the true story of Liviu Cornel Babes, „The Cave of Masks”, tries to depict some of the events that caused the artist to be one of the first romanians to publicly protest against the constrictions of the communist regime. From simple events of his life as a family man and as an artist, to his encounters with the Secret Police, the movie showcases a tragic story that was nearly forgotten in time.

image:image.image:title: Refugees
image:image.image:caption: Refugees is a 360 documentary about the ongoing humanitarian crisis. Thousands have left their homes in search for a better future, and in their search they encounter dangerous obstacles. We went to Lesbos, Greece, where migrants take the leap from Turkey, putting their lives at risk, and captured some of the most intense moments in thrilling virtual reality.

The exchange of post its continues for a few days until...

image:image.image:title: ONE LIFE AT THE TIME: VARANASI
image:image.image:caption: Mousa, a young man of twenty four, lives already half his life in Varanasi. Grown up in the slums of Delhi he was forced to live with his dad in the holiest city of India. Why? Simply because his mum and grandmother could not afford to have him anymore. With the small salary that his father owned being a ceremony assistant, Mousa started guiding tourist around in order to survive. On a lucky day he will get two dollars. Although India is getting wealthier when viewing upon the economic growth, the poverty level remains immense and millions of people continue living poor and destitute according to the statistic (Chandy and Amp; Gertz 2011). The impact of this staggering poverty is mostly seen in cities such as Varanasi, the largest city of India’s poorest state Uttar Pradesh. Huge and crowed places where there are simply more people than possibilities. A possibility for Mousa to build up a living would be to open a shop, according to him. It would give him a sustainable income on which he could build his life. Dreaming to have a roof above his head and maybe even a family one day, I can simply not resist sharing the possibilities of my world with him. With only threehunderd dollar Mousa could open his shop; a simple gesture from the Western world that changes a life time. Why not help him?

A journey illuminated by the black sun, you do not know when it starts, how and when it will end. A black sun because the days have lost their color. Black seems to have entered into you upsetting life.

image:image.image:title: Red Thread
image:image.image:caption: The film ‘Red Thread’ is an animated documentary which is about Taiwanese history and identity. ‘Red thread’ is a metaphor throughout the whole film as a direction to guide the main character to find what is his identity. The red thread will only appear when the main character feels lost. The books ‘Orphan of Asia’ and ‘Potsdam Section Chief ’ were written by Wu, Zhuoliu, which inspired me to write my story and think about Taiwanese identity during different certain situations. I could see Taiwanese were struggling about being a Chinese, Japanese, Mainlander, Islander or pursuing western culture. I combined the true voices with my narrative story to elaborate real feeling to the audience. The goal of my film is that I hope Taiwanese would be willing to understand deeply of our own culture and be proud of being a Taiwanese. For others, I hope they will know more about what is Taiwan and have interest in Taiwanese history and culture.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: TRuE WaVe

Alex, the merciless leader , humiliates Nick in front of everybody. Nick became a victim of their bullying, but an unexpected event may change things when Nick has the choice to save Alex's life or get revenge from his aggressor.

image:image.image:title: The Murmuring Woods
image:image.image:caption:
The Murmuring Woods :: Horror Short Ita sub Eng
Here the short horror movie The Murmuring Woods. The Murmuring Woods (2016), a film by Francesco Spingola, written by Mathias Rat, original score composed by Vittorio Vitale. Language: Italian, English (subtitles) Genre: Horror/Thriller Mirko and Agata, on their anniversary, decide to spend a week-end in the mountains, but during the night a murmur disturbs their sleeping. A murmur out of this world... Mirko e Agata, per festeggiare il loro anniversario, decidono di passare un week-end in montagna. Un mormorio estenuante accompagnato dal vento disturba però il sonno dei due, durante la notte. Un mormorio che non è di questo mondo... ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Written by: Mathias Rat Screenplay: Mathias Rat Photography: Mathias Rat Original Score Composer: Vittorio Vitale With: Antonio Buonocore, Manuela Greco, Giulio Riente, Marcello Oliani, Vanessa Sollazzo, Attilio Pacello, Siria Chiappetta Cinematographers: Francesco Spingola, Maria Francesca Silvestri, Mathias Rat Drone Operator: Calabriaerea.it Audio: Mathias Rat, Giuseppe Aloise Audio Mixing: Emanuele Spingola MUA: Manuela Greco, Erika Selva Executive Producer: Six Dimension Studio Colorist: Francesco Spingola Photography: Mathias Rat Editing: Francesco Spingola A film by: Francesco Spingola Location: Pollino National Park, Verbicaro (CS) Special thanks to: Benvenuto Mobili, Contrada Scalo Ferroviario, 20, Grisolia (CS) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gear: Nikon D5300, Nikkor 18-140mm f3.5-5.6 G ED VR lens, TARION TR-S120 120cm Dolly slider, Manfrotto MT293A4 290 + MVH500AH, Manfrotto MKCOMPACTACN-RD Kit, Yongnuo YN300 Led Light Panel

image:image.image:title: AGNUS DEI
image:image.image:caption: A young man Peter, who is around thirties, lives a desperate life with his mother Maria and her husband Stojan in one village of Serbia. Peter is born in Kosova from a forbidden love between his mother Maria and the young Albanian man, but for this he is not aware Is the period of time when the relations between Serbs and Albanians are inimical, exactly is the time of the beginning of war. Peter is forced by his mother and the others to go to the war. He intends to escape the war and goes to the West. He is mobilized forcefully in one paramilitary unit in Kosova’s war. In one action prepared as a revenge, he kills his father Dini whom he never had the chance to meet. Being not able to bear the arbitrary crimes, Peter, deserts from the army. He takes Dini’s daughter Maria and together they escape to the mountains. During their dangerous trip they are followed from both sides of enemies, Serbs and Albanians. Peter and Maria fell in love. They reach to come back in Peter’s home in Serbia. As soon as they returnee home, Peter realizes that he had killed his biologic father and he had fall in love with his sister. Not being able to stand this spiritual condition he commits a suicide.

image:image.image:title: ChatRoulette

image:image.image:title: SERES
image:image.image:caption: SERES is a different concept of a different time, where the past coexists with the future. A mystery arises where the instinctive and rational, the conscious and the unconscious, the music and the dance, are embodied in two beings. This encounter resonates in its environment, merging with it. Here, the interpretation is open: Is it the movement of the bodies that creates the music or is it the music that causes the movement? Is it the music that represents the nature that surrounds it, or is it the nature that makes the music emerge? The questions arise in a poem that turns on itself in an essentialism full of metaphors.

image:image.image:title: The Awakening

image:image.image:title: Dirty Roses
image:image.image:caption: "Dirty Roses" is a humanitarian docudrama and deals with the power of the soul of the disabled persons and individuals or families who came from the Arab world in Greece as war or economic or political refugees. Two extreme marginalized groups with the most helpless victims, the one of the countries of the third world with racial and ethnic minorities, and the second one is often socially degraded. Their common field is the hope, their love to dream and their struggle to live in freedom, the triptych of the motto "that which does not kill us makes us stronger"! The heroes of the short film, Nana the Greek handicapped girl, Hassan the red roses' seller and Mirage an Iranian refugee, are the real characters and not professional actors. Several Afghani people who live with their children in a Greek camp appear in the film. Director: Petra Terzi (aka Stone) Writer: Petra Terzi (aka Stone) Stars: Maria-Christina Tzavara, Mirage, Hassan, Leonidas Zoakos Director of Photography: Nektarios Souldatos Camera: Nektarios Souldatos, Alexander Sikalias Editor: Alexander Sikalias Sound Design: Alexander Sikalias Script: Lia Myridaki Film Stills Photography: Toula Akrivou Efi Nichoriti made the adaptation of the monologue from Robert Schneider's theatrical play, "Dirt".

image:image.image:title: Munchies
image:image.image:caption: Synopsis: Zombie Lee has an outrageous hunger that won’t be silenced by food alone. With his growing need to feed increasing, misjudgment and disaster arise in the kitchen, until a simple solution is found. And his rumbling is quenched. ‘Munchies’ is a stop motion animation, which depicts the struggles of a hungry zombie who is trying to cook a meal. I wanted to convey the idea that the hungrier you are the harder it is to concentrate and the easier it is to mess up. I aimed for my film to be humorous, but also a little unnerving to the viewer. I have included a couple of uncanny moments to remind the audience that he is dead but still human at times.

image:image.image:title: Breathe: Battle With Cystic Fibrosis
image:image.image:caption:
Before my beautiful wife Kari passed, we made a short film about living with Cystic Fibrosis. This piece is by far the most important and meaningful of anything I have ever made. Working with my beautiful wife was always a blessing. Please join the cause to cure this terrible disease.
For my Little Miss. Kari Karr Bjornstad (1990 - 2015) ------------------------------
Cystic Fibrosis Awareness.
Over 70,000 people are affected with Cystic Fibrosis. It is a life threatening disease that does not yet have a cure. Donations from people like you have led to lengthening the lifespan of people with CF - with more getting to experience adulthood.
Learn more about how you can help at www.cff.org
#cysticfibrosis #cf #65roses #breathe
Generator ^ First Floor © 2011 FrenchKiss / Mom+Pop.

image:image.image:title: RIVVRS: CONQUER (A Music Video for Cystic Fibrosis Awareness)
image:image.image:caption:
I was humbled when asked to create the Official Music Video for RIVVRS' song CONQUER off his new album Unfamiliar Skin. I was even more humbled that it would serve as a dedication to my beautiful wife Kari, whom passed away from Cystic Fibrosis August 2015.
This project means so much to me in so many ways, and it fills me with so much emotion. I shed a lot of tears (both happy and sad) creating this video - as it features the last footage we ever filmed together. It was quite an adventure making this, but every time I see her face on the screen I immediately feel at home. When I first heard this song, I instantly thought of Kari and how it exemplified her spirit and her courage. It made me think of how she fought for her life every single day with Cystic Fibrosis, and how she never let the disease defeat her. She never let it define her. She would always fight and never back down. This song perfectly depicts her unwavering strength and courage to never give up, and to never let life’s challenges keep her down.
Everyone has something in their lives that is a challenge to them - something they need to conquer. Kari fought every one of her challenges head on. And no matter how hard things got, she always conquered them. This is a wonderful and powerful song that I think can be applied to everyone. I'm grateful to have been asked to be a part of this journey. Kari is my greatest love, my best friend, my biggest inspiration, and my muse. I hope everyone has the fight and determination Kari had, and no matter what happens, continues to fight, dream, breathe, believe, and ultimately - Conquer.
Thank you for watching and best wishes, Bradley Bjornstad

image:image.image:title: Dvor on Una - We are not for sale
image:image.image:caption: In Dvor on Una, on the Croatian side, and in Novi Grad, on the side of Bosnia and Herzegovina, for 15 years now people are afraid that there will be a yellow cloud of radioactivity above their little piece of heaven. In fact, that is the fear of all the people who live in the Una river basin, which is protected by the Law, people who live in the area of “Una National Park”, or just simply that is the fear of all the people that appreciate and love clean water, clean air and something that is beautiful. Everyone except the government of Republic of Croatia, who made the decision to start building, on this very place, the nuclear, toxic, radioactive dump for the waste from “Krško” nuclear power plant.

image:image.image:title: WHAT WEEE ARE
image:image.image:caption: WHAT WEEE ARE is an ongoing multifaceted socio-cultural multimedia project searching the deeper meanings of the world. A quest through waste and feelings and the richness of the earth, trying to untangle the intricacy of human, so called, society. Questions rooted deep inside ourselves which have been forgotten, traded in for a superficial world of dull bureaucracy, sexy images, cheap thrills and high tech. But what we really are is yet beyond our knowledge and despite all the civilization that has been built in the name of progress and growth, society is falling to pieces leaving nothing more than a toxic wasteland. As the Phoenix arose from its own ashes, will humanity also rise from its own waste? This everlasting cosmogony is represented in WHAT WEEE ARE a collection of sculptures in which electronic waste is turned into disturbing insects, a means to deeper thoughts.

image:image.image:title: Between Love & hate

image:image.image:title: A Day With A Slum Dweller
image:image.image:caption: Abdul Aziz, a brave heart, who is well known among the mass people as a Freedom fighter of the Liberation War of Bangladesh. He had a colorful life at his youth. He was a service holder would work as a clerk in a suburb in the British period and he was paid 150 taka. He didn't get pension cause during the partition in 1947, British ruler went from the subcontinent and new Government took place and rejected all prayers belong to British government. A Centuries-old poor man Abdul Aziz came from a suburb to Dhaka few years ago and took shelter in a slum in the capital of Bangladesh. He has a daughter and a son. He lives with his daughter as because his son left him after being newly married. This incident made him hurt and sometimes when his son would try to give him 100 or 200 bugs as the pocket money, he just ignored to take. His self-respect made his son’s money simply worthless. Now he is passing very cumbersome life. But everybody resided in the slum and neighborhood loves him, his wisdom and simplicity though he didn’t get even a bit from his own blood. But, Still he wishes to survive on earth for better life. This documentary focuses on the rise and fall of life of Abdul Aziz.

image:image.image:title: SOLIDÃO - SOLITUDE (Short Film DRAMA) 2016
image:image.image:caption: This is a short film that approaches the social concern of elderly isolation and solitude, many times due to pure neglect from their families. It´s a fiction work that calls out the emotional struggles and insecurities that they are left to face alone, and so the purpose of this film is to show their side of the story and the slow motion of their life hanging on the expectations of seeing their families again.

image:image.image:title: Be With The Mountains
image:image.image:caption: Fifties of last century, leprosy was prevalent in Guangnan County, Yunnan Province. At that time due to poor medical conditions, patient treatment are not very good, most were expelled from the village. In order to avoid the spread of the disease, the local government moved the patients to Luosongdi village in Guangnan County to treat , and isolated. Eighties, the village has not contagious patient, then lift the quarantine. I happened to know this history and felt curious about the special experience of the recovered villagers and their now days living conditions. In January 2015, I and a few friends decided to go off the Luosongdi Village to further understanding.

image:image.image:title: Pistols At Dawn - Please Report Anything Auspicious To A Member Of Staff
image:image.image:caption:
The London based band “Pistols At Dawn” recorded the protest song “Please Report Anything Auspicious To A Member Of Staff“ against the rise of the far right and xenophobia in answer to the Brexit referendum in June 2016. The title refers to the cherry-picking of 'worthy' immigrants, and also points to an Orwellian dystopia. The music video for the song was designed, animated and produced by Christian Hörlesberger in Vienna.
The production took about 6 weeks in August and September 2016; the video was released on November-14-2016 on YouTube.
The music video gets along without any edits. An animated cartoon version of Nigel Farage, former leader of the UKIP, walks along a road. He spreads empty promises; then he starts to sing the song. Gradually other cartoon versions of right-wing populists join (Heinz-Christian Strache, Marine Le Pen, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin). They sing the choruses together. During the video the environment gets darker and monotonously. At the end we find ourselves in a war zone.
The video was brought to life with Adobe Character Animator. The software allows someone to animate Characters by using the webcam, touchpad and keyboard. It is still in development and is being tested.
The band from London and the filmmaker from Vienna met at Radar Music Videos. On this internet platform for low budget music videos record labels and bands can put briefs online. Directors can pitch ideas and treatments for these briefs. The record labels and bands can choose one treatment and commission the filmmaker with the production of the video.

image:image.image:title: MAUKA (THE CHANCE)

Amidst the growing number of Criminals, prolonged trials and inadequate facilities in prisons – what does a Criminal think ? Does he ever get a moment of repentance in his life ? Has he still got a chance to become a human being ? This short film explores these possibilities.

image:image.image:title: A MODERN LYNCHING
image:image.image:caption: For my 8th grade English class, I needed to do a video based on things discussed on the Speak Truth To Power website about Human Rights. I decided I wanted to do it on police brutality and comparing it to another dark time in American history, lynching. After listening to several songs that dealt with the subject matter, I chose to use two songs that I felt best illustrated my feelings. They are STRANGE FRUIT by Billie Holiday and BE FREE by J. Cole. I actually obtained the rights to these songs after the license holders viewed the material. I also placed a Viewer Discretion Advised card at the opening to warn anyone who might be offended by the material. I hope it will open up dialogue and encourage people to think.

image:image.image:title: The 'Right' Glass
image:image.image:caption:
We4You in association with BnR Films present Mutli Award Winning Silent Short Film "The 'Right' Glass" on the occasion of Universal Children's Day (20th November 2016) as a tribute to all the children in this globe.
Written & Directed by multi-award winning writer-director Biswanath Rath, this social ad-film is based on the theme: Child Rights. "The ‘Right’ Glass" reminds every one of the inviolable human rights that each and every child is born with and the responsibility that each of us, as a member of family, community and society has in ensuring that no child is denied his or her basic rights.
Genre: Drama. Presented by - We 4 You Charitable Trust (Bhubaneswar based NGO). Studio - BnR Films.
Since its premiere, it has received the below two awards and has got screened in the below International Film Festivals (Total - 33): :
1) 'Best Fiction' in Srishti Short Film Festival - 2015 (Bhubaneswar) 2) 'Children Choice Award' in Kallola Short Film Festival - 2015 (Award received from Governor of Odisha Mr. S.C.Jamir)

image:image.image:title: The Hunting Forest
image:image.image:caption:
This is my individual project for the course of Digital Animation Studio at Department of Digital Arts, Pratt Institute. I finished it in March 2016.
I took charge of all the production processes in this project.
The inspiration of this animated short film came from a chatting with my friend. In the modern society of information, people can easily get information from the internet. This makes us do less communications with each other face to face, and spend more and more time on our cellphones, laptops and computers. Except the adults, there is a serious phenomenon that most of children don't want to go outside to communicate with others, either, although they are at an energetic age that is suppose to led them to go outside to explore. They prefer stay at home to play video games. What's the world inside the mind of a child who always play with himself/herself? How the reflections of the real world look like in their mind?
In this film, I created an exciting, mysterious and dangerous world inside a boy's brain. Let's enjoy the hunting game with him in the forest of mind.

image:image.image:title: PARAMETRIC - An iPhone Movie
image:image.image:caption:
EXCLUSIVE Behind the scenes and VFX Breakdowns - https://youtu.be/hc7s_t7jXQ0
"BEST MOBILE MOVIE AWARD" - 2015 Image Arts Festival 2015 Mo-Film Competition- University Of Kelaniya, Sri Lanka.
"PEOPLE'S AWARD" - 2015 Mobile Film Festival - Paris France
"Official Selection", Mobgraphia Mobile Film Festival "Official Selection", International Mobile Film Festival
.............................................
Check all production details here - http://www.lsmworks.com/films/Parametric
PARAMETRIC PRODUCTION DETAILS -
Director - Amila C. Kumarasinghe DP - Dumindra Nathash peiris Screenplay - Dananjaya madushanka BTS Photographer - Milinda Weerasekara Visual Effects And Post Production - Amila C. Kumarasinghe Audio Mixed and Mastered / End Title Music - Pasan Liyanage Poornima Gunasekara - Translation Dulith K. Pathirage - Corrections
Production / Post Productions - LIVEHEARTS STUDIOS & MEDIA WORKS Sri Lanka (www.lsmworks.com)
We have used iPhone 6plus 128GB model with fiLMIC Pro to shoot 100% of this movie. And used "Zhiyun-tech Z1 Smooth" gimbal for the smooth handheld shots. All done in available light and used only a reflector for some shots.
STORY Robin. The last man on earth. He is following all the ruins on a land covered with dust and poisons. He is searching water, searching something to eat, but nowhere to survive. Mankind destroyed all the living things and they have killed themselves for years and years slowly.
Now there is no earth, or there is no one for you to help when you realized the things you have done to mother earth. And she replied you back. It's time to say good-bye to mother earth.
Because Robin has no shelter or no drinkable water or no way to be alive. His last breath will mix into the spammed and polluted air.
If you rebirth again by a miracle, you may can look backward to rectify and correct your wrongful acts you have done to mother earth. But mother earth will not give you a second chance.
You may rebirth and look back to correct your faults, its too late. Save earth.
Because she protects you. But, Save her before she takes your life.
END
Plot - The endless needs of the mankind caused disruption. Disruption that destroys nature ignoring the fact that humans are a part of nature. Thus, as nature destroys... so will the mankind. Take a step back...think for a moment...if you are the last man to stand on earth...how will you ensure your survival? Will you be satisfied to live in a desert full of thorns? Even if you realize your mistakes at this point, there is no turning back. dreaming of a greener earth is possible, but...will this dream come true, if you ignore the causes of the climate changes?
Enjoy the movie.

image:image.image:title: Smooth Fade and Rough Cut (or The Dreamer of Unknown Humanity)
image:image.image:caption: Micah dreams of a girl, Amber, whom he has never met nor seen before. The next morning, he meets her on Facebook as a “suggested friend.” She tells him that her boyfriend, Adam, has been cheating on her. Adam meets up with his lover in the woods one day, and Micah ambushes them.

image:image.image:title: Vishneva, Belarus Soviet Union Poland
image:image.image:caption: Vishneva, Belarus Soviet Union Poland is grounded in the oral history testimony of a Holocaust survivor and has been deconstructed by the interviewee’s son. Unlike most oral histories that focus on the words of the interviewee, Vishneva uses silent images from the interview superimposed with typed memories that describe the unspoken pain borne by father and son through more than half a century.

image:image.image:title: A good bloke
image:image.image:caption: Two guys discover they are on opposite sides of two groups who are at war with one another.

image:image.image:title: I Recorded a Murder!
image:image.image:caption: A filmmaker who is trying to finish his short film records a murder by accident that everyone believes was a suicide. He and the witness of the crime will seek the truth but the murderer is on to their plan and is one step ahead of them.

image:image.image:title: CANVAS
image:image.image:caption: ‘Canvas’ is a short film, set in the current time period; about a young boy trying to live his life in his own terms. He does not wish to follow the age-old norms created by the society; he does not wish to live a mundane life. He wishes to be different and he is not afraid of the consequences. His dream to be a musician is mightier than all the hardships that he has to face. He tries to run away from the society, he suddenly discover a road where the trees seem to be alive, where the people welcomed him with colors; as if celebrating his newly earned independence. His passion, in the film, is represented by a woman who dares to look different. He returns to reality when his eyes open yet the surreal world seem to be calling him. The choice is between reality and surrealism. He chooses the latter.

image:image.image:title: Flowereyes
image:image.image:caption: A man, haunted by a past love, sells white noise machines door-to-door hoping to escape the girl with flowers for eyes.

image:image.image:title: Animated Short Film: Eventide
image:image.image:caption:
|
Our Graduation film about a story of a young boy looking for his long lost mom and a mom longing for the child that she lost. |
Find us at: https://www.facebook.com/teameventide/ |

image:image.image:title: A Day In Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve - A Lifescape To Experience
image:image.image:caption: The Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve is an International Biosphere in the western Ghats and Nilgiri hills range of south India. This Documentary shows the life in Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve from Dawn to Dusk. We invite you to travel with us in this experience through the wonderful Lifescape of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve.

image:image.image:title: INT. BAR - NIGHT
image:image.image:caption: A writer finds himself with difficulties to write a script when he finds out that his girlfriend is cheating on him, so he speaks to her through his scripts challenging the thin line between fact and fiction.

image:image.image:title: Listen (Working Title)
image:image.image:caption:
Thank you for considering my screenplay. I hope you like what you read, and help me fund my project. I'm an independent artist, so every bit of encouragement, monetary and otherwise, helps me go a long way!
"Listen" explores how perceptive and intuitive people are towards others who silently suffer from one or more forms of mental illness. The style of the script is close to how I operate in life - lace anything serious with some comedy, which feeds my non-confrontational nature. I think we've made great strides in conversations around issues like mental health, but it's still an uphill battle for some people. I intend to continue the great conversation we're having about this and encourage people to listen. Sometimes, we need to go beyond medicines, labels and an accurate diagnosis. We need people to listen. And help us validate that it's not "all in our heads".

image:image.image:title: Heddie Murphy: Back In Hollywood - Webisode
image:image.image:caption: Comedy -- Retired movie star Heddie Murphy, is enjoying his life out of the spotlight. That is, until his manager pops up at his house and tries to convince Heddie to get back in show business. Will Heddie return to Hollywood and make movies or will he continue to stay retired?

image:image.image:title: Is Astrology Science or Nonsense?
image:image.image:caption: Is Astrology science or Nonsense? Let me show you the science backing of Astrology, and how it affected our lives.

image:image.image:title: LIFE IN KODACHROME
image:image.image:caption: LIFE IN KODACHROME is the story of Carey Carpenter, an accomplished high-school senior who struggles to change the career path chosen for him in order to pursue his dream of racing hot rods. In October 1957, Carey is at the drive-in with his best friends waiting for a movie to begin when the newsreel footage announces that the Russians have just launched Sputnik 1 into orbit. It is the Dawn of the Space Age. And it couldn't be a better time for those living in Southern California and working for one of the big three – Lockheed, Northrop, and Douglas – unless of course your passion is to design and build hot rod cars amongst the likes of Ed "Big Daddy" Roth, George Barris, and Von Dutch.

image:image.image:title: Obsolescence
image:image.image:caption: A countless number of cameras and televisions in need of repair go through Miguel and David’s repair shops every day, with increasingly more complicated work needed. Following the path of these objects, we get to know these characters’ daily routine, whose life story evolve in the just as that of the things they’ve been repairing for decades. Objects that go unused and go from hand to hand every day, conquered by a diverse number of trades that give them new a new value to what is no longer usable for many people; until finally reaching a place where only fragments of each camera and television have their last chance.

image:image.image:title: Dreams come true
image:image.image:caption: Art and culture is all we can leave as a vivid memory.

image:image.image:title: Track
image:image.image:caption: Ways of schools in Talesh city mountains.

image:image.image:title: Class
image:image.image:caption: Classrooms in Talesh city mountains.

image:image.image:title: THE YOU I SEE
image:image.image:caption: A 7 minute dance for camera work created in response to the recent devastating deaths of Alton Sterling, Philando Castile, and Dallas Police Officers Lorne Ahrens, Michael Smith, Michael Krol, Patrick Zamarripa, and Brent Thompson, THE YOU I SEE explores the contrast between two people viewing each other through the removed standpoint of a camera lens and two people experiencing one another through the intimate act of contact improvisation. Proximity, focus, music, and timing are utilized throughout the film to highlight and challenge the use of stereotypes and biases when interacting with those around us.

image:image.image:title: FEW THINGS WE KNOW ABOUT EARTHQUAKE
image:image.image:caption: This film starts with a simple question "What do you know about earthquake?" But it eventually leads us to an existential journey filled with questions which have hardly any answer

image:image.image:caption: Wang Zhentao is a new Deputy Director at the “610 Office,” a government organization in China with the sole purpose of persecuting and eradicating members of Falun Gong. A sudden car accident that cripples Wang prompts a self-examination of his family, work and life, leading to the greatest decision of his lifetime.

image:image.image:title: Auckward Love
image:image.image:caption: Auckward Love gets drunk and does things nobody is proud of… Uh huh; Our girls are back and more auckward than ever. Season Two sees Alice determined to get on top, Vicky forming an affinity for rubber, Grace's heart put to the test and Zoe pulling the fingers at everyone she can. Join the girls again as they take Auckland by the balls and launch themselves head first into love, lust and everything in between. From Auckland, New Zealand and starring Holly Shervey, Jess Sayer, Luci Hare and Jess Holly Bates, Auckward Love breaks every boundary as it takes us back to what it’s really like living in the world of 20-something love. Full series 1 & 2 here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCElC3zN9dZx48bwq6ta0j5A
