image:image.image:title: Vessel
image:image.image:caption:
In the near future, your memories are uploaded instantly to the cloud. Sam Hatch (Nate Loftin) makes a living hacking into those memories, for a price. When Sam meets with a mysterious new client, Max (Jennifer French) he agrees to hack into her own blocked memories. But as he begins digging into her past, things go horribly wrong, forcing Sam to run for his life!
Starring Nate Loftin and Jennifer French
Written and Directed by Tyler Hickman & Brennan Scott
Cinematography by Darren Hummel
Music by Pierre Vaucher
Produced by Scott Burton of Forever Is Tomorrow Productions, LLC

image:image.image:title: The Hunter of Giants Trees
image:image.image:caption: A boy playing in the yard of his house discovers a buried chest revealing a secret, the more than five hundred years men sold the largest trees of the earth to the most powerful kings one day it all stopped and never heard of hunters trees, all that remained was that ark with an old map . The boy with the help of his friend Bug -eating fox goes hunting the giants trees , which he believed to be trapped in the sky. So begins this adventure , where a boy and his friends seek to rescue the Giant Trees.

Village leader sends few men to steal the boat at night from the river bank but they kill Haridhan when he comes to save his boat.

Sinopsis
¿Alguna vez se han preguntado dónde van a parar la gran cantidad de residuos que generamos todos los días? ¿Sabían que todos los días cada una de las personas que vive en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires y en el Conurbano Bonaerense arroja un kilo de basura? En este cortometraje documental ponemos en evidencia la gran masa de basura que genera la producción y el consumo desmedido, y nosotros ¿Qué hacemos al respecto?

image:image.image:title: GRIFFIN
image:image.image:caption: “Griffin” is a socially-relevant, coming of age story set in Del Ray; the soulful heartbeat of the city of Alexandria, Virginia. It follows four friends through their journey from adolescence to adulthood and the hurdles they must overcome along the way. Written as a narrative, you see how this realistic portrayal of life in Del Ray unfolds from the perspective of Griffin - one of the four best friends. He reflects on the challenges he and his friends face in their community, their coping mechanisms, and the consequences and triumphs of their actions along the way. Jeff, Tim, Sean, and Griffin learn the importance of loyalty and friendship. As they unknowingly become father figures to each other, the question quickly becomes can they overcome the boundaries of a town that’s pushing them down before it’s too late?

(español) Víctor Andrés Santander es un ejecutivo joven, 29 años, prolijo y bien educado, de las mejores escuelas y las mejores lenguas, es un muchacho bien portado que se levanta de la mesa dejando el plato porque hay otra que lo lava, que está convencido que a él, ser así, no le afecta ni un sentido, no tiene amores, tiene mujeres, no compra condones, paga por sexo, ni limpia, ni lava, ni plancha, tiene mucama, es un hombre de mundo que un día cualquiera empieza a alucinar a diariamente con las víctimas de su placer, entre otras cosas secuestra mujeres para doparlas y venderlas, porque se cotizan mejor que los bonos de deuda.
(inglés) Victor Andres Santander is a young executive, 29 years old, well educated, from the best schools and the best languages, is a well-behaved boy who rises leaving the plate in the table because there is another who clean it. He is convinced that be like this is the only way to him. He doesn’t have love or women, not buy condoms, pay for sex, for clean, wash, iron and have a maid. He is a man of the world that one day begins to hallucinate daily with the victims of his pleasure, among other things kidnaps women for drugging and sell them, because better than bonds traded debt.

image:image.image:title: DISRUPT
image:image.image:caption:
With 1 in 27 rapes reported, and the conviction rate for reported cases at between 8 and 14 percent, it is clear that South Africa is facing a crisis.
After Rhodes University silenced the Chapter 2.12 campaign (which drew attention to rape culture on university campuses), students felt like their concerns were not heard.
Tired of not being listened to, students decide to take matters into their own hands and compile a list of alleged rapists on campus. The list goes viral, and this sparks two weeks of protests and disruption including barricading the university, protesting topless to make a point, and police firing rubber bullets at and arresting students.
Ultimately, the University obtains an interdict against the protesting students. While students have made their voices heard, this profound disruption of the status quo is brought to a halt, for now.

image:image.image:title: Did Trump Win Fulfilled End Day Prophecy?
image:image.image:caption: Did a August 12, 2016 Crop Circle correctly predicted a Trump Victory? Or was the message hidden in Nostradamus 400 year old prophecy. Either way, you will be surprised on what is decoded.

image:image.image:title: Deep End (Official Selection to IndieWise Virtual Festival)
Check-Up
image:image.image:caption: Minute-long animated short about a doctor's patient having an existential crisis.

image:image.image:title: HE SAID SHE SAID
image:image.image:caption: John and Anna have been married for 10 years. How? Not sure. But that's just part of the joke in this slap-stick comedy that plays on the psychosis of the many personalities that are drawn to Hollywood and the entertainment industry from all corners of the world and all walks of life. John is a shlubby Jew from New York who moved to LA in hopes to be a producer while Anna, who moved to LA from Sydney, Australia is an actress. In reality, John is a computer programmer and Anna is a waitress. Their marriage is filled with debauchery and infidelity yet for reasons unknown they've stuck together through thick and thin. However, in recent years, they are starting to hit even rougher waters. They decide its time for therapy. That's where Doc comes in. Does he have a PhD? Probably not. Is he suitable to be giving life advice? My guess is "no." But he's the best chance they've got. A former musician, Doc had a wild time in his twenties. But now he's in his mid thirties and strapped with a wife and kid of his own and is already tired of his monotonous life. But he has to pay the bills some how, and music didn't do the trick. So he falls back on his bachelors in Psychology and opens up marriage councilors office. Through trying to help this helpless couple through their dysfunctional marriage our Doc's own internal demons are exposed and brought to the surface over the course of our therapy sessions. In the end he throws away all attempts at a traditional method of therapy and and uses a form of negotiations to appease both sides of this marriage. In the end everyone prevails, and the Doc is left beaten and exhausted, but happy he succeeded in saving yet another marriage in the city of Los Angeles.

image:image.image:title: Rhodes Learns from the Things
image:image.image:caption: The teacher tells Rhodes and the other children that all people are the same, later he hears the things in the class talking and tells them what he just learned. In the end he gets confused at home when he finds out from his father that people don't eat the same amounts of food. He decides he has to let his teacher know about this discovery.

image:image.image:title: NAKAYIMA(The Evil Doll)

image:image.image:title: ROHAC
image:image.image:caption: 13 year old Keith Rohac's life is already ruff. His newly divorced mom is dating a man, with no respect. It does not help when he end's up kidnapping her a short time period later. Keith's thoughts of him are proven true, as he must find a way to save his mother. Keith's life is forever changed, as he looks to the secrets of his past to help support him in locating her. And theres no way of Keith to do this, without shedding a little bit of blood.

image:image.image:caption: TOTAKAHINI is not just a short fiction its a reality , its all about education system and our student life, and its a surreal experimental film,

image:image.image:caption: See how you can get your USA college degree without leaving home. This is how she managed to graduate college at 17 but finished high school at 18.

image:image.image:title: Pierre's Particular Parlor of Pretentious Inventions
image:image.image:caption:
When Pierre Jr. is left alone at his family's particular parlor, he must figure out how to run this strange place by himself.
Pierre's Particular Parlor of Pretentious Inventions(Pierre's, for short) is an experimental student short film I made as a part of my high school senior portfolio project. Pierre's was a project that was a bold and brave move for me, given how out of my normal style it was. It was also a pipe dream of a project, so the fact that it exists means so much to me. Pierre's is a film that will forever hold a special place in my heart, and I hope it holds that place in all of yours as well.

image:image.image:title: REZilience
image:image.image:caption:
Serpent Lake Reserve has been forgotten. This indigenous community in Canada's far north experiences a catastrophe that will decimate 90% of the population. A military experiment gone horribly wrong exposes centuries of genocide and corruption and unleashes a seemingly unstoppable evil.
This 10 minute film is the opening scene for a larger feature that will be filmed in the summer of 2017.

image:image.image:title: The Last Flame
image:image.image:caption: A man discovers that the past can be a merciless ghost. The memories turned into nightmares , a place where death walks with caution. Can love be stronger than death? It can resist until last flame survive ?

image:image.image:title: Strayed Outta Compton
image:image.image:caption: An evening of wine and cheese takes a turn for the awkward after 3 yuppie couples decide to watch Straight Outta Compton.

image:image.image:title: His Dying Wish
image:image.image:caption: Janet Harper thinks her life is perfect when tragedy strikes. Her husband of 26 years, Walt, dies suddenly and she is left to pick up the pieces of her life. Janet soon finds out that in order to get her inheritance she must share half and live in the same house with Walt’s long-term mistress, Meagan, for seven days or lose everything. She must make the decision to lose the precious memories that she and Walt built or comply with His Dying Wish.

image:image.image:title: Heart of San Francisco
image:image.image:caption:
Through the eyes of a tourist, you get to see San Francisco from a different angle. It is A city famous for its beauty as well as its graffiti. It is a city famous for the beautiful Golden Gate bridge, but it is also a city where the gap between the rich and poor is too great to bridge over. Even at the bottom of the last recession in 2009, San Francisco has had 138,300 households with over 1 million in assets. Housing prices may have been lifted back to the pre-recession high, but there are still people who struggle to live under the shadow of the skyrocketing housing prices. To some who live there, San Francisco is a just a city someone else calls home.
In a city where even a million dollars can’t buy you a median priced home, there are only a few things you can have for free - the California sunshine, the fog over Golden Gate, and the free show at Pier 39. Let’s meet someone who was abandoned at birth, adopted at age 10, ran away from home at age 15, and lived and performed on the street but got himself through college. He is the man who is able to put a smile on everyone’s face.
Lynx may not have much, but he has enough to share. Other than the thanks and the occasional tip, his best reward is to see smiles on everyone’s faces. It is a luxury he did not have while growing up, but instead of mourning for what he lost, he decided to give back what was taken from him. You don’t have to be a millionarie to be happy, just like you don’t need to have money to be rich. Lynx showed us that success is not measured by the size of your bank account, but how much love fills from the heart.

image:image.image:title: Beyond the limits
image:image.image:caption:
Password : shortfilmcorner
SynopsisUn jeune réalisateur nommé Enzo désire réaliser son premier court métrage. Malgré un site de crowdfunding ouvert, et une forte communication, son projet reste au point mort, faute de financement. Suite à un énième refus, Enzo va s’interroger. Faut il coucher pour réussir?

With no plan or idea of what to create, he must beat the clock and search deep within himself to find meaning in his creation.

The Homeless Homeless Advocate Eric Sheptock scouts the city looking for affordable housing only to end up with the deal of his lifetime offered by his new roommate "Better (Not) Believe" Steve.

image:image.image:title: Burn
image:image.image:caption:
After being hunted for his life for days, Ben must now figure out the mysterious person who wants him dead. The answer will change his life forever.
Burn is a student-made short film that I made for my high school senior portfolio project. It was my first ever short film, with roughly three months of preproduction work put into it, two days of production, and two months of post production. I hope you enjoy this story that means so much to my heart.

image:image.image:title: Looking Back Merrifield (2016)
image:image.image:caption: *Semi-Finalist Los Angeles CineFest & Honorable Mention in Drama for Fault Line. * A young man (Alexander 19) cherishes his relationship with his girlfriend Madison more than anything in the world. He's come to a point in his life where hes become very reclusive. He goes to the hill where he and madi first went out and talks to her about why he's in the situation he`s in. After the conversation he makes a decision to chase his dreams &move forward. Through conversation you find out that Madison isn't there, she's actually passed away a year ago.

image:image.image:title: Two Rivers
image:image.image:caption:
Two Rivers is a story about the destructive relationship between Dirke (Mark Borchardt) and Emma (Melonie Gartner). Dirke is a troubled individual who can’t hold down a job. Haunted by his own demons and coupled with an explosive temper, Dirke is a force to be reckoned with.
Dirke’s uncontrollable attitude also spills into his relationship with Emma, a long-suffering woman. Dirke’s abusive way leaves her cold and broken. Emma neither has anything left to give to their relationship nor any place nor means to escape her situation. She fears and resents Dirke. Her feelings don’t go unnoticed – Dirke can feel Emma is slipping away from him. The thought that he cannot control her feelings makes him out of control all the more.
Two Rivers represents two bodies of water that can’t be merged. It’s Dirke and Emma’s Mesopotamia. A tale of tainted love that has gone past the point of no return.

image:image.image:title: Mordred (official feature film trailer)
image:image.image:caption:
Like what you see? please check out our PostProduction fund at Indiegogo: https://igg.me/at/mordredcomplete to help us get the film finished. (any winnings from this will also be used for the same fund!) “Mordred”, is a gritty Arthurian drama, telling the legends from the point of view of Arthur’s much vilified illegitimate son, set in the 6th Century, drawing heavily from very early sources, including the Annales Cambriae, the Welsh Triads, the Mabinogion, and local legends in Devon & Cornwall, as well as more recent medieval sources. This drama is set in the 530s, against the backdrop of the Saxon invasions, heavily influenced by Celtic legends, Druidic traditions, and the earliest tales of Arthur, and his followers.
The South Devon Players Theatre & Film Company, are a team who have run in South Devon, England, since 2005-6. Founded to create theatre shows based on history and legends, we have more recently expanded into film as well,
ABOUT US www.southdevonplayers.com Facebook & Twitter: @sdevonplayers Instagram: sdevonplayers1 email sdevonplayers@gmail.com Youtube: southdevonplayers

Four kids: Chad, Becca, Jazz & Cassie, invent a helmet that can transport anyone into another person's dreams and fantasies. However, their just for fun invention is shaken when the glamour school beauty bully Wendy and her hench women along with her right hand girly man, Ethan, cause trouble for the inventing bunch by leaking it into the media and press! All the while trying to help their teacher out with planning and documenting her sister's wedding and son's birthday parties on the same day! Within this family fun flick the inventing bunch reconnect with a long lost loved one, run from the paparazzi, rebuild Dreamworld, their inventions name, and try to take down Wendy and her band of "mean girls" while also dealing with potential and some unwanted romance along the way!

Surabhi Redkar, Film Critic "Bravo il regista Simeon Lumgair a cogliere lo stato d`animo e i pensieri di entrambi i personaggi e a trasmetterli agli spettatori...Un buon lavoro da guardare con piacere." Dr. Daniele Buzzurro, Film Critic "I really enjoyed this short by Simeon Lumgair. Watch Éluder." image:image.image:title: Racing Through The Forest
image:image.image:caption:
A documentary film produced by renowned racecar driver Rick Knoop and filmmaker Dean Kirkland entitled, “Racing Through the Forest – The History of the 1950-56 Pebble Beach Road Races”.
The documentary was filmed over approximately three years and includes 50 interviews of legendary names in road racing such as Fred Knoop, Mick Marston, Bill Pollack, Jim Hall and Phil Remington. It chronicles the events from the first through the last Pebble Beach Road Races, which included legends like Carroll Shelby, Phil Hill and Bill Pollock in 1956.
“What began as a tribute to my father, Fred Knoop, has evolved into a celebration of one of the world’s greatest road races,” said Knoop. “We’re thrilled to share this incredible story with audiences at the Pebble Beach Concours. It is a privilege to have the opportunity to explore this incredible history, especially just feet from the road where the men and machines did battle. I’m honored that some of those featured in the film have committed to attend.”
"We're pleased to host the premiere screening of ‘Racing Through the Forest’, which focuses on the Pebble Beach Road Races and enthusiasts who started and participated in these sporting yet fierce competitions,” said Sandra Button, Chairman of the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance. "We all owe a great debt to these enthusiasts. I'm certain that much of the collector car world today would not exist without them. And there would be many fewer ways to see and celebrate great cars and the people affiliated with them."
Inspired by the memoirs of the Del Monte Forest Road Race history, the Pebble Beach Concours and Pebble Beach Company teamed up with K&K Productions to preview the documentary for a select audience. Blending interviews with racers and incredible footage of the events, the film recalls the glories of this oft forgotten race with a video archive of its history.

image:image.image:title: "Evil From The Outset?" Trailer/Titles
image:image.image:caption:
In the beginning he was abandoned by his father Dick Arbitrage Jr., set adrift in a basket like the baby Moses of biblical lore, and later taken in by senior fellows of a prominent neoconservative think tank. What kind of upbringing was this to be for the young lad? Many who knew Edmund Emil Harbinger from his younger days saw a confused boy, surrounded by money, opulence and privilege, yet subject to extremely doctrinaire care-givers and daily readings from Ayn Rand’s “Atlas Shrugged.” This documentary carefully examines the formative stuff that various third-person testimonials identify as key ingredients in the making of a monster.
Edmund Harbinger fatally shot both of his neoconservative care-givers with a certain nonchalance, later telling police that he wanted to know what it felt like “to make a killing.” These tragic events led to his interment in the St. Affluenza Psychiatric Hospital for the elite insane. There the 15 year old Harbinger ingratiated himself to the psychiatric staff who dealt with all manner of “market-driven mental maladies.” He became a trusted assistant, and after a mere five years in the hospital Harbinger, now six feet nine inches tall and close to three hundred pounds, was released.
Subsequently a string of C.E.O.s and hedge fund managers were brutally slain, culminating with the murder of Harbinger’s birth father Dick Arbitrage Jr. Thankfully for all concerned Dick’s badly murdered head was swiftly placed into cryonic freeze, in hopes that one day he may be revived and his hedge fund managing resumed. This documentary poses the classic nature versus nurture question: was Harbinger the product of his upbringing within the secret confines of the neoconservative “American Heritage Institute?” Or indeed, was this serial killer, dubbed by the media “the C.E.O. Butcher,” simply “Evil From The Outset?”
Opinions are divided. Robert T. Morrow, the intrepid reporter from the “Sagaponack Sentinel” who worked the case, is convinced that Harbinger “would have given anything to be a normal person.” Likewise Dr. Lawrence McPhail, a Psychiatrist from St. Affluenza who befriended the young Harbinger, stated that there was “no part of him that was happy with what he wound up doing.” Contrary to this Detectives Dickerson and Stroker described Harbinger as a “sociopathic asshole” and a “loser shit head.” Finally, after all is said and done, it is up to the judgment of our “true-crime” documentary audience to decide if Harbinger was indeed “evil from the outset!”

image:image.image:title: Roots of Oblivion official Trailer
image:image.image:caption: Roots of Oblivion is the story of several survivors of the lahar of Armero in Colombia cause by a volcanic eruption in November of 1985. The government knew about it and did nothing to evacuate the community. As a result of this neglect, 25.000 people died. Now 30 years later, the survivors deal with the consequences that this event has had on their lives. The inexorable passage of time as their personal tragedies evidence diluted into oblivion in an indifferent and irresponsible country without memory or respect. 30 years later, the remains of the city are reclaimed by Mother Nature,consumed and intertwined by caucho roots signifying exactly what we lost.

image:image.image:title: WHAT DAY IS TODAY? | Que dia é hoje?
image:image.image:caption: Animated documentary short film made by the youth of the Portuguese city of Montemor-o- Novo. Over a two month period, these youngsters took a trip down memory lane to collect the testimonies of an older generation who witnessed 40 years of dictatorship and another 40 of fable-like democracy only to find out that the struggle for basic human rights has become, over the years, a delusion fueled by controls over currency and high consumption rates that numb and manipulate today’s society.

image:image.image:title: HOT SEAT
image:image.image:caption:
‘HOT SEAT’ is a website which humiliates child porn photographers. It is run by Marie and Lara, These girls have become so absorbed in how many views they are getting on each video they share, that they have lost sense as to what is right and wrong.
Marie and Lara are two intelligent and beautiful 15 year old best friends, they run an online page called ‘Hot Seat’. These two girls go to Joseph’s house, one of many child pornographic photographer ‘s they have targeted. Joseph claims he can make young girls “famous”. Marie and Lara play along and pretend they want to be “photographed” by him to become “famous” when in reality they are there to humiliate him like he does to many girl’s every day. They put themselves in danger everyday by taking off their own clothes in order to get their targets under their thumbs and to gain views on their video’s.

image:image.image:title: 12 Rounds For The Loaded (2013)
image:image.image:caption:
WARNING: Contains extremely obscene and offensive material. Not suitable for any ages. View at your own risk.
Distributed by UNGOVERNABLE FILMS (ungovernablefilms.com)
BLOODY HAMMER FILMS STRIKES AGAIN! Gore, sadism, sex, violence, gruesome exploitation at its finest! Bloody Hammer Films' entry for the 2013 48 Hour Film Festival just didn't seem right at its 7 minute version... so we made it 18 minutes instead! That's 11 more minutes of NUDITY, BLOOD, GUTS, PAIN, BONDAGE, VOMIT, BOOBS, FIRE, AND GUNS!
Set in an unnamed town in an unknown part of the country, outlaw biker Logan O'Brien brings his son with him on a "business trip" of an ambiguous nature. What was meant to be a father-son trip soon turns into a bloodbath when the saloon they travel to turns out to be bait for unsuspecting wanderers who are tortured sadistically and killed by the bar staff! What happens next? Only the complete maniacs at Bloody Hammer Films know... until you watch it!
ungovernablefilms.com facebook.com/ungovernablefilms
Copyright 2013 Paul M McAlarney, Ungovernable Films.

image:image.image:title: Gay Jesus (2015)
image:image.image:caption:
ungovernablefilms.com facebook.com/ungovernablefilms twitter.com/ungovernableflm
Jesus' homoerotic final days are relived on the silver screen, where lust, jealousy, and homophobia are revealed to be the real motives behind his execution!
Gay Jesus is Paul M McAlarney and Ungovernable Films' answer to the homophobic attitudes running rampant in large sectors of the Christian Church. With gratuitous nudity, gore, and sex, offensive and tasteless dialogue, and all your favorite mythological characters from the Bible, Gay Jesus will have you pitching a tent next time you're at Sunday Mass!
This has been an Ungovernable Film
©2015 Paul M McAlarney & Ungovernable Films. All Rights Reserved.

image:image.image:title: A Box Came To Brooklyn
image:image.image:caption: It’s a quiet Sunday morning in an up-and-coming Brooklyn neighborhood. Naïve man-child Johnny stumbles upon an anonymous box in the middle of his dead-end block. The other residents of Schenectady Street gather to nervously investigate. What’s in it, and who left it? Good-natured Steve struggles to be the voice of reason as local loudmouth Charlie fans the flames of post-9/11 paranoia. Speculation turns to accusation as prejudices and crackpot theories turn neighbor against neighbor. Is Johnny’s farfetched story about the box correct, or is there an even more fiendish plot behind it all?

image:image.image:title: Story is in Tails
image:image.image:caption: Life of a celebrity named Mirza is in news for wrong reasons as a guy claims himself to be his illegitmate son. The guy find a photograph of his childhood after his mother's dead in which Mirza is standing holding him in his arms along with his mother in the Burkha. The guy share the photo with the media as a proof and the photo further goes viral and becomes a point of discussion on the news channel. The story revolves around the plot of illegitimate child and life . The 7 min drama shows that every story has a different sides of the story. Cast : Sira, Anmol Jain & Shubham Gupta DOP : Thameem Ansari Music : Sudhanshu Saxena Editor : Guruprasad Narnad Director : Shubham Gupta Story & Screenplay : Shubham Gupta Dubbing : SpaceBot Studio Bangalore, India

image:image.image:title: Complex
image:image.image:caption: It's an intriguing dark trippy story about higher Consciousness where a lone but intelligent guy starts thinking about the voice which comes from his inside and often guides him in his decision making. His way of thinking makes him to start his research on life and in the process he meets a Mysterious man who helps him. He has a conversation with this person and to his surprise this man also helps him in solving his equation of life, which further leads to his conclusion/realisation about life and forces him to think about his existence. PS - It is a work of Metaphysics, Science, Mathematics, Fiction and Addiction all together. Watch it with patience, it might just lead to your awakening. Cheers! Writer & Director : Shubham Gupta Producer : Anunay Gupta Music : Aditya Tiwari DOP : Thameem Ansari 1st Cameraman : Rahul 2nd Cameraman : Anas VFX & Colorist: Guruprasad N. Cast : Thameem Ansari, Shubham Gupta & Sanjana Sharma Editor : Shubham Gupta Dubbing Studio : SpaceBot, Bangalore, India

image:image.image:title: Agnus Dei
image:image.image:caption: A young man Peter, who is around thirties, lives a desperate life with his mother Maria and her husband Stojan in one village of Serbia. Peter is born in Kosova from a forbidden love between his mother Maria and the young Albanian man, but for this he is not aware Is the period of time when the relations between Serbs and Albanians are inimical, exactly is the time of the beginning of war. Peter is forced by his mother and the others to go to the war. He intends to escape the war and goes to the West. He is mobilized forcefully in one paramilitary unit in Kosova’s war. In one action prepared as a revenge, he kills his father Dini whom he never had the chance to meet. Being not able to bear the arbitrary crimes, Peter, deserts from the army. He takes Dini’s daughter Maria and together they escape to the mountains. During their dangerous trip they are followed from both sides of enemies, Serbs and Albanians. Peter and Maria fell in love. They reach to come back in Peter’s home in Serbia. As soon as they returnee home, Peter realizes that he had killed his biologic father and he had fall in love with his sister. Not being able to stand this spiritual condition he commits a suicide.

image:image.image:title: Deadline (Original Version)
image:image.image:caption:
From the writer and director of The Floridian Heat, comes a thriller with killer ambitions. Deadline follows the story of a college student named Ariel, who gets shunned out by her classmates for creating a script within a genre that's outside the standard course objectives. She's then forced to pick a different genre, and chooses to create a story around the thriller genre. With little time on her hands to come up with ideas, she decides that killing her classmates will help her craft the story she plans to make. Deadline is a smart, funny, and suspenseful twist on the thriller genre while painting a loving homage to classic cinema.
Deadline is a non-profit short feature made at The University of Tampa for COM 460 Senior Seminar Film/Digital Production

image:image.image:title: Visible - Not Visible
image:image.image:caption:
Time-lapse movie made in a room converted into a camera obscura.
03:43 min
The images are everywhere, and nature is the greatest artist. Photography is strongly connected to nature, we can say it comes from nature. photography contains an element of magic, particularly the pinhole photography. Camera obscura phenomenon occurs spontaneously in nature, it creates the most realistic projections, and using them you can get the most interesting illusions. Nature controls the process of seeing, through manipulating light and shadow. From the one side, i am giving tribute to nature by allowing her creation mobile projection and documenting them, on the other hand, I try to change the course of things and take control over the process of view. Using the white and black paint, I once hide and another time shows the projections of nature. I try to show the magical aspect of nature and using white paint create my own color moving picture of reality. Freely changing angle, focus, I overstretching and resizing, using paints I give it a new framework. I am playing with nature.

image:image.image:title: The Real Dreams
image:image.image:caption: The film consists of time-lapse images taken in different spaces converted into camera obscura. These are: the iglo, hunting pulpit, cave, tent, boat and caravan. Just like in the rest of my projects based on the action of camera obscura phenomenon, I try to show the magical aspect of photography. It occurs spontaneously in nature and is omnipresent. Just inside the closed, darkened space you need to create a small hole to be able to admire, moving projections of reality. External view of the world designed inverted inside the room, so two spaces merge into one extraordinary image. I selected the spaces which are partly the shelters. When I am hide inside, at the same time i am an observer of the outside world and i am the background to the projection of nature. It is, in a sense, work about me, about my deep connection with nature. While inside the space, in which full is amazing play of light, it feels like in a magic world. It is very unusual that the images, although they are overstretched and reversed, still remain realistic, and when I connect with them, I feel safe as in a dream.

image:image.image:title: Trailer - Tantarayya (The Plastic Soldiers)
image:image.image:caption:
About two soldiers were ordered by their commanders into the jungle do Patrol, amid the sound traveling hordes who were talking about the attack on the headquarters of the Army. Bahar (23 years) immediately entered into a pile of dry leaves and followed Udin (21 years) who participated also entered into a pile of dry leaves in addition to soldiers Bahar.
After hiding in the dry leaves, Bahar and Udin heared all the discourse about the gang that wanted to attack on army’s Barrack. Bahar slowly out of a pile of dry leaves and followed by Udin. Bahar even glance towards Udin signaled by raising an eyebrow, with their retreat was slowly creeping out of its hiding place and stood back up, he settles - sneaked in the side away from the hordes.
While walking, they mutually praised each other, amid talked Bahar said that he will face the commanders. Udin suddenly stalled while thinking, surprised, and confused. Then Udin said, "Then you will be promoted?" Starting from the Udin sentence conflict arises amid their trip. Bahar and Udin continued to argue and defend their ego - respectively, had lost their corps spirit and solidarity, due to their high ego still argue and eventually fight each other to attack, hit, up rolled around to the edge of the cliff.
Udin accidentally pushed off a cliff fall Bahar, fortunately there is a root that can save Bahar from falling into the abyss. Bahar calling for help, Udin panicked, confused and torn between wanting to help Bahar or convey information about the attack of the mob. Udin still confused between the two options, he also pursued a depressed because of the attack, and Bahar still kept calling for help.

image:image.image:caption: A retail working, family man struggles to repress his urges of murdering and eating his family. Tommy works at TV World, a dead-end, retail store to keep a roof over a family that he despises to his inner core. His adulterating wife, dead beat son and know-it-all daughter have become too much for Tommy to take as he resorts to his alter-ego that exists somewhere in the dark, twisted abyss that is Tommy's mind. Most of us can control the switch that prevents us from making irrational, regretful decisions; the question is, can Tommy?
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: HEART: Flatline to Finish Line
image:image.image:caption:
One in three people will suffer from heart disease in their lifetime, but only one in a million will thrive from it. HEART: Flatline to Finish Line® is the raw and emotional journey of six individuals from hospital beds to the finish line of one of the world’s most grueling endurance events, the IRONMAN® triathlon.
Director David Watkins flatlined on the operating table- his heart stopped for 5 minutes. For an otherwise healthy man in his thirties, a congenital heart defect nearly proved fatal. After being revived and surviving a subsequent stroke, he became determined to do something with his second lease on life.
Heart surgery is an all too common event. Before long David was meeting people from around the world with similar stories. All had something to prove. This is the story of 6 survivors daring to take on an improbable feat and prove to the world they still have the heart to overcome any obstacle that gets in their way.
This feature-length documentary will take you on a journey of despair and triumph, of sacrifice and glory. Featuring original music by indie darling Cloud Cult, and interviews with some of the biggest names in endurance sport and cardiology, it will inspire you to examine your own life and encourage you to fill it full of HEART.

In his van Pablo drives to different locations around Sydney area, from an abandoned construction site to an amazing sunrise at Manly Beach. Filmed in slow motion, with an unique perception, searching the lines is a combination of sport, nature and lifestyle. Cinematography and editing by Kleber Estorilio - digitalkmedia.com Music: Nirvana - Something In The Way (Biscope Boot) Equipment: Sony Fs7/S-log2/ Canon prime's lenses 14MM, 24-70MM and 70-200MM Videocraft courtesy - videocraft.com.au

image:image.image:title: Purplehed - Burn Like the Sun (Performance Edit)
image:image.image:caption:
Performance Edit of Purplehed’s second single released on 27th July 2016 Purplehed - Burn Like the Sun (Performance Edit) Presenting a Contemporary Dance piece on an Inspirational and motivational upbeat pop song by Purplehed. (Remembering Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam on his first death anniversary.)
Synopsis of Music Video: Music Video explores contemporary dance depicting two chained characters that represent the nature of struggle and the pain people go through. The journey of breaking these chains is powered by karma and the ecstasy is portrayed through the joyous dance movements where body, mind & soul set you free.

image:image.image:title: Purplehed - Feel The Passion (Official Video)
image:image.image:caption:
Official music video of Purplehed’s first single released on 24th July, 2015 Purplehed - Feel The Passion (Official Video)
Synopsis of Music Video: “Journey of transforming passion into career.” The song interweaves realistic stories of four diverse characters, each of whom are in the quest of realizing their hopes and ambitions. A musician comes across a girl who is a photographer. He tries to catch her attention by sending cards with messages that are part of a riddle. The series of cards brings them closer and in the end the girl figures out the riddle. A Corporate guy, with a passion for dancing, meets a dance teacher and ends up following his passion by learning from her. All of them have got one thing in common: their passion, their desire to follow their respective aspirations.

image:image.image:title: Purplehed - Burn Like The Sun (Official Video)
image:image.image:caption:
Official music video of Purplehed’s second single released on 24th January 2016 Purplehed Burn Like The Sun (Official Video) Remembering Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam (a tribute to the former President of India) Presenting an Inspirational and motivational upbeat Pop song by Purplehed.
Synopsis of Music Video: A young man who is contemplating on Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, heads out for a run. In his mind he visualizes the struggles of two chained imaginary characters that represent Men and Women around. He comes across various people. His mind gives him illusions of an imaginary chain that represents barriers around people, he comes across. The imaginary characters in his mind continue to depict the nature of struggle and the pain people go through. The turmoil in his head keeps on increasing and the person keeps running faster and faster till he gets visions of these people breaking their chains. The journey of breaking these chains is powered by education and karma. Once the shackles are broken, the guy feels liberated and is set to find an ecstasy that he never thought was attainable in destiny. This ecstasy is portrayed through the joyous dance movements of imaginary characters in his mind and his uninhibited run. His body, mind & soul have let go of all chains.
Lyrics: You and I, are torn apart Desire, burns in our hearts Walls of fear, cage our dreams We'll break these walls, just you and me Aooooooo, Aoooooooo .....
Away from bars away from chains Away from lives lived in vain Where we will be set free to break all trends and just be
Lets fly away Let's go make our escape Let's dream dream dream Our dreams transcend
Alive and awake, We'll rise and shine today And burn like the sun We'll light the dark away
Way up high, the nerves diffuse There's no ground, to feel the blues Beyond the fear, dreams fly free We'll make them last, just you and me Aaooooooo, Aaoooooo.
We feel no fear, we feel no pain We take the fall we rise again Till we ride an ecstasy Ecstasy we want we need
We'll find a perfect place Where troubles fade away Lets dream dream dream Our dreams transcend
Alive and awake,
We'll rise and shine today And burn like the sun, We will light the Dark Away Burn like the sun Burn like the sun
Karmanye Vadhikaraste, Ma phaleshou kada chana Ma Karma Phala Hetur Bhur, matey Sangostva Akarmani (Sanskrit ?loka)
Burn like the sun (Repeat) Light the dark away
Sanskrit ?loka from the Bhagwad Gita – chapter 2 verse 47 – English Translation: “You can work for it, it is your right but you can not claim your right on the fruits. The fruits of action should not be your motive nor should you be attached to inaction."

image:image.image:title: INKSIDE trailer
image:image.image:caption:
Oro is falling from the sky into a desert world... All around him, dark shapes are raising from everywhere and are turning into supernatural creatures and into samurais. A terrible fight is about to begin between the warriors and the creatures that look like diabolical octopuses. And then the dark shapes are becoming brightly colored creatures, psychedelic octopuses that are moving restlessly and excitedly, but then menacingly.
As if totally indifferent to what happens around him, Oro is rambling into this chaotic background, from scenes of fear to scenes of contemplation . Can he get out of here ? Are these strange octopuses really a threat ?
What if Oro was himself the creator of this world ?

This is a short film on Environmental sustainability , produced by Sri Joydip Ashram in association with Yes Bank which is the official selection of Indiewise International Film Festival 2016 on how together we can create a sustainable world.

image:image.image:title: Cowgirl
image:image.image:caption:
I love cows and have worked and lived with them a fair bit. I stumbled on this friendly herd in Spring of this year, when I was on the outskirts of town in search of a visiting yearling moose in the vicinity. After our moose neighbour moved on in June, I visited with these guys- trying to get some nice footage of a beautiful subject, but also just to spend time with this lovely group. They've been most gracious, greeting me and hanging out even though all I brought them was me. I've greatly enjoyed the time they've allowed me to spend in their company thus far. So much so that, one rather hot day quite recently, I walked from the outskirts of one end of town to the outskirts on their end of town to see them. Great to see the new arrival and I expect there will be more- I'll be back, you guys. :)
https://filmfreeway.com/project/841413

image:image.image:title: Leera

One evening accidentally Leo hears an interesting unfamiliar song performed by a girl who lives next floor and decides to “borrow” it…

These are The (Almost) Famous.

image:image.image:title: True Friends Original Cut
image:image.image:caption: Same story like the Alternative but different scenes

image:image.image:title: True Friends Alternative with no transitions or jump cuts
image:image.image:caption:
This is the alternative or a different version of my 3rd directional venture. The first half is a bit different from the previous version while the 2nd half stays the same. The story is influenced by a scene from the Romantic Drama Malayalam movie Niram. A 1999 movie directed by Kamal. It stars Baby Shalini(adult in the film) and Kunchacko Boban. I liked that scene really much because it showed a message to me and maybe to everyone. I wrote the story in a way I can show that scene again showing the true message of True Friends! I think everyone who has seen Niram might be able to tell which scene it is. Hope all of you will enjoy this. Please Ignore and excuse my puffy or tired face, I was under a tight schedule due to college. Also, it was hard to have the entire cast in one day since they are also busy with their things. No wonder why casting directors and managers are there for! I wish I could make this a bit longer but due to time limit no! not happening!
Remember Friendship is a blessing it doesn't matter what nationality, gender, or what religion you are, It is a great gift from God and it is a beautiful experience for us human beings as long as it is with good people.

image:image.image:title: Knight shift
image:image.image:caption: Corporate employee who decides to work over night in order to complete his pending work. Since its a weekend all employee's log out and leave early , he is the only person working in the entire building. He gets engrossed to his work but as time passes he starts experiencing paranormal activities, even though he is a brave man , he gradually starts to panic and decides to escape , however he has no where to go and he is trapped in the building. Did he manage to escape alive ? or was the building really haunted ? or was he get stuck between his dream and reality? or did he time travel ?

image:image.image:title: Love Happened (Teaser Trailer)
image:image.image:caption: John is a seemingly average young man going through the breakup of an average relationship. Little does he know that he is part of a mainstream romantic-comedy screenplay being made by a stubborn and talentless writer. Not wanting to take part in the story presented to him, John tries to live his own life despite the writer's attempts to get his characters back into the original plot.

image:image.image:title: When It rains
image:image.image:caption: This bengali Film is about our ordinary life story. Sometimes life faces abrupt stresses. It seems every sphere stands as a predator, even nature. Sometimes we feel as if we are in the zenith point of our life cycle. but It doesn't stay for long. When it wipes off the front glass of our vision ... it makes it wider and blissful. That's the fathom of life. Sometimes it comes with an added sweetener.

image:image.image:title: Stay Still
image:image.image:caption: A young photographer, Evelyn, develops an obsession as she glides through the streets of London, stalking and processing the qualities of her subject; a young man. Having found him in a photography gallery that she works at, Evelyn tries to think and conjure up ways that she can interact with him and in due process lure him back to her apartment. Her task is made easier when he begins to show an interest in her peculiar nature.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: "Dick And Jack" Official Trailer
image:image.image:caption:
Dick And Jack" - It is our fathers who show us how to navigate the world. Joe Kennedy the father of Jack pushed his son into the presidency he himself could not attain. And Frank Nixon, the father of Dick, taught his son to hate which in politics is a form of navigation.
Dick and Jack takes place before JFK’s election in 1960 while Nixon was Vice-President and the two were still friends. The film concludes with Kennedy as President who no longer seeks his father’s help. Needing to shape others, Joe replaces Frank as Dick’s father. Nixon wisely learns under the tutelage of his new father how to temper his hate and achieve the presidency in 1968.

Both pretend to have a relationship for the Television ratings when they both know they can’t breathe together the same air. One day something unfortunate happens to Martin which forces Gustavo (Martins Homeless Doppelganger played by Puertas) to take his place not knowing anything about the life of fame. WHY The Comedy only on Mountain View’s MVTV Channel.

image:image.image:title: Extra
image:image.image:caption: Communicating a motivational message through abstraction, “Extra”, portrays the difference between ‘ordinary’ and ‘extraordinary’ people. With the use of neon paint and UV black lights as an expressive media, the experimental film depicts the notion of fighting fear, pain, opinions, etc...Resultantly, overcoming all obstacles classifies one as ‘extraordinary’ and not ‘ordinary.’

image:image.image:title: Divine: Featuring Nicole Bergere & Grace Colucci - Episode 1: "Home"
image:image.image:caption: Nicole Bergere & Grace Colucci have spent their lives as artists, performers, gourmet cooks, and entrepreneurs. In their 7th decade they ran Nicole's Divine Crackers, where they create wonderful culinary creations sold all over the world. This web series follows the divine lives of these extraordinary women. Episode 1: Nicole and Grace take us on a tour of their house, which is a work of art in itself, and talk about their early days in New York and Chicago.

image:image.image:title: Imminent
image:image.image:caption: “Imminent” is a short experimental narrative, that gives a futuristic scenario about the ‘Human Communication’. The film predicts how our present; where everything is becoming digital and the virtual presence/communication is dominating our lives, and slowly becoming more important than the real life communication; is going to shape our future. Jamal lives in the year 2389, where everyone is connected through a virtual world, and he has never experienced real ‘face-to-face’ communication with anyone. Therefor, he gets to a point where he cant live like that anymore, and decides to commit suicide virtually, leaving a suicide note behind.

image:image.image:title: BONNE ROUTE, BONNE CHASSE, BON APPÉTIT (GOOD TRIP, GOOD HUNT, GOOD APPETITE)
image:image.image:caption:
In the period of 3 months all game cadaver noticed on the way was photographed. Drastically after-toned with the noises of killer plays, the brutality of the pictures is exaggerated. The last traffic victim, a recently died Red-legges Partridge *, was picked up, prepared as freshly hunted and consumed afterwards. By the transformation this cadaver into a delicate-eat becomes the unbelievable ignoring of the life clearly, which daily takes place on all roads. The video shows also the strange instilled differentiation between hunted, thus to the consumption killed and from traffic crushed animals.
*Red-legges Partridge Alectoris rufa: is a gamebird the pheasant family Phasianidae / Galliformes
Idea and production, as well as preparation, photo, camera, cut and sound: Roland Fuhrmann Kitchen: Hélène and Denis Driffort
Animal list: Field hare, Nutria, Hedgehog, Marten, Veil owl, Toad, Blackbird, Deer, Squirrel, Fox, Red-legged Partridge, Emerald lizard, Common Kestrel

image:image.image:title: Sounds from darkness
image:image.image:caption: Axèle is a former pop-rock singer whose career has ground to a halt. Her only of hope for greatness lies with the young singers she and her trusty sound engineer, Ivan, now manage. During a recording session, Axèle is disappointed with the performance of her newest protégé, Lila. The situation becomes more and more tense. The supernatural slowly worms its way into this fraught atmosphere, sewing division among the three characters by distorting their perception of reality.

image:image.image:title: JUAN Y LA NUBE
image:image.image:caption: Juan is a child who doesn?t have any friends. La Nube is a cloud who doesn?t have any cloud friends. They find each other and become friends. However, Juan grows up and gets lost in the grey adult world.

image:image.image:title: Tasmina: The Horse Girl
image:image.image:caption: Tasmina, an eleven years old girl of a remote village in Northern Bangladesh is known as ‘Horse Girl’ in her neighborhood. Where more than sixty percent of the girls are married off before their 15th birthday, Tasmina aspires to ride horse and join horse races at least for another five years. In this rural society outdoor games are not allowed for the ‘grown up’ women and horse race is unthinkable. Thanks to Tasmina’s parents, they think that she could play the game for two more years. Earlier Tasmina used to join the races riding other people’s horse. She won several competitions but didn’t get the prize money or the awards. Owner of the horse took away everything, giving her a little amount. Her father bought a small horse for her. But this tiny little horse can’t cope with the big racing horses and she can’t fight back with all her elder male competitors.

image:image.image:title: Falling Apart Teaser Trailer

image:image.image:title: Fish Out of Water
image:image.image:caption: **WINNER of an Award of Merit for Film Short, Direction, Cinematography and Editing from The Best Shorts Competition 2015: bestshorts.net/?page_id=1807 ** **OFFICIAL SELECTION at the Direct Short and Documentary Film Festival: dsdffest.com/#!official-selection-list-1online-screeni/c4dn ** **OFFICIAL SELECTION: London Shows International Film Festival 2015- lshff.com/winsel/Selections/selnov15.php ** **OFFICIAL SELECTION: Ottawa International Short Film Festival 2016- ficmo.com/en/programming.html ** ** OFFICIAL SELECTION: Top Shorts Online Film Festival- topshorts.net/#!fish-out-of-water/c1f8s ** A father takes his son fishing in order to make him a man, using fishing as a right of passage. The film symbolically deals with notions of masculinity, both what the gender role of heteronormative masculinity entails, and why violence seems rooted in this binary notion of manhood. This film was shot on the Blackmagic Cinema Camera 2.5K. It was made as the end of the year project for the Filmmaking II course and Concordia University's Mel Hoppenheim School of Cinema.

image:image.image:title: Meat
image:image.image:caption: ***WINNER: Award of Recognition for Experimental Short Film from the Best Shorts Competition- bestshorts.net/?page_id=2013*** Meat is an experimental short that illuminates how the patriarchal society we live in manipulates and controls women through advertising and consumer culture. This film was shot on the Canon Rebel EOS T2i.

image:image.image:title: Hatch
image:image.image:caption: Hatch depicts a young girl, torn by a big decision, as she gets ready for the day. Hatch was shot on the RED Dragon.

image:image.image:title: A flaming universe
image:image.image:caption: A disoriented character, lost in a universe, which appears to be like an abandoned wasteland - where it is impossible to break out of the recurring, dream-like sequences.

image:image.image:title: The realm of lucid fears

image:image.image:title: Blue City - The Three Kings

image:image.image:title: The Trouble With Rain Official Trailer
image:image.image:caption: Miller (Erik Nelson) just misses his train to Chattanooga one steamy afternoon. While waiting on the next train he meets three strangers – Eric (Adam Sanner), Constance (Valerie Jane Parker) and Violet (Inge Uys). Will these four young professionals become friends, lovers; or will they simply go their separate ways and never see each other again? Like Schrodinger’s Cat, all of the possible outcomes of this chance encounter are equally real, but only one will come to pass. Or will it? The story line is non-linear (almost a Twilight Zone-esque kind of feel) that moves back and forth in time over a six year period. These four strangers who meet by happenstance at a train station, are ‘called back’ to the train station to relive that initial meeting, where slightly different actions result in sometimes drastically altered futures. The decisions they make, the words they speak and the actions they take during this initial meeting dictate how their future relationships play out. The ‘moral of the story’ (if you will) is that all of our actions, even the smallest, have consequences – for good or for ill.

image:image.image:title: The Girl In The Mirror
image:image.image:caption: Natasha (Szabina Nagy) is an ordinary high school student. One day after school, she takes a short cut to her home trough the forest, but she is not aware that somebody following her... In the meantime Natasha's mother, Merilen (Ildiko Peli) give birth to a baby girl, while Natasha is being tortured. The kidnappers after murdered Natasha, buries her mutilated body in the nearby forest. After many years later but the murder yet to be solved, her sister Sabina (Nikoletta Szepesi) who is not aware of her sister's doomed past, became a fully grow woman. Her high school friends invite her to a trip to the county, but on the way they suffer a car accident. Sabina end up in the hospital with minor injuries, and soon she begin to see haunted images, flashbacks from a terrible murder. Despite her condition, Sabina and her friends continue their trip, and at dusk they arrive at a Hostel, where their nightmare's begin...

image:image.image:title: The Scars We Bare Final Trailer
Historie Pana Chrystusa / Stories of Mr. Christ
image:image.image:caption:
The story of “a true artist without professional patronage” had been created for many years and in many places. The first stage took place in 1999-2000, when the audio version of the finished text was produced. The material was then repeatedly processed and edited. Finally the picture was produced, as planned from the very beginning. The text has been created in Vienna, the soundtrack in Szczecin, the video in Berlin.
The project is the result of work by a group whose members have never met together in full. Bartosz Wójcik is the author of the idea and of the text. The creations of Piotr Klimek, responsible for the soundtrack, and Micha? Kosakowski, who made the video are, however, original in their nature.

image:image.image:title: LONELY
image:image.image:caption:
Inside your mind, there's no place to hide...
Official selection - Catalyst Communities - UK (2015). Official selection - Fliqio (2016). Official selection - Ozark Shorts - USA (2016). Official selection - 12MFF - Norway (2016) and 3rd place "Experimental short film of the month". Official selection - MOCINA UFJF (2016). Official selection - IndieWise (2016).
From director B.N.L and MSP, in association with "Chocolate e Pimenta Blog", starring Beatriz Leonardo e Jhonatan Leonardo, with original compositions by Ross Bugden, experience "LONELY" #NOW (available with English subtitles for all mobile devices too)!
If you enjoy it, make sure to like and share with everybody!
Synopsis: Haunted by her deepest nightmares, Jane is determined to find the way out... no matter what it takes.
Concept: "LONELY", an experimental short film, follows a fictional story based on our daily reality, which presents us (subjectively) some of the deepest thoughts a depressed person may face inside his/her own mind while struggles to overcome this serious mental issue, that affects people from all over the world, and without special care and social awareness sometimes may lead to tragical consequences.

image:image.image:title: The Last Tram
image:image.image:caption: The last tram of the day enters the terminus at midnight, every night. Its only passengers are a toy salesman, a beggar woman, and an extremely handsome, well-dressed gentleman. He carries a distinctive briefcase with golden coin-shaped patterns. Every night, the mysterious gentleman visits a woman; a woman gaudy in her dress sense, frivolous in her manner and conspicuously foolish. The man opens his enigmatic briefcase in front of the woman, takes out a pouch full of gold coins and shakes them. He also opens a blue diary and reads out passages. The desperate woman disrobes herself and flings her saree at the man. Before the crack of dawn, the man departs. He returns the next night, taking the same tram. He traverses the same narrow bylanes to reach the same woman. He shakes the pouch full of coins again. When the woman reaches out to ask for the coins, the man gives her a pair of binoculars. She wants to discover a new, more colourful world by looking into the binoculars. The man, however, leaves her for another woman. Like he did with the previous woman, he opens his briefcase to shake the pouch full of coins and offer the binoculars. This woman rejects the proffered binoculars and demands the coins. The man gives them to her. His illusions are all but broken. He understands that all that appeals to this woman are the coins and not him, the person. He remembers the previous woman, who, knowing that she will not get anything out of it, still loved him earnestly. He wants to go back to her, but it is too late, he has been ensnared by the trap he laid out himself. Hiding his face behind dark blue glasses, he gets on to the the last tram. The smoky tram navigates a dream-like landscape. Behind it, dressed like a bride, runs the foolish woman. The idiot girl, runs after the last tram in a fruitless quest for the infinite.

image:image.image:title: The Visitor Horror Short Film Trailer
image:image.image:caption:
A young woman, Hanna, comes home to her apartment for the evening. After a rather foreboding conversation with one of her friends involving recent disappearances in the area, and an old Native American boarding school that was burned down, she settles in to a seemingly hum-drum close of day, and eventually goes to bed.
Her slumbers don’t last long however, and she wakes after a terrifying dream. Things take a horrifying turn for the worse as it becomes more apparent that someone – or something – has crept into her apartment. Visit the website: http://visitor-film.com.

image:image.image:title: Trailer SERES - dance film (2016)
image:image.image:caption: SERES is a different concept of a different time, where the past coexists with the future. A mystery arises where the instinctive and rational, the conscious and the unconscious, the music and the dance, are embodied in two beings. This encounter resonates in its environment, merging with it. Here, the interpretation is open: Is it the movement of the bodies that creates the music or is it the music that causes the movement? Is it the music that represents the nature that surrounds it, or is it the nature that makes the music emerge? The questions arise in a poem that turns on itself in an essentialism full of metaphors.

image:image.image:title: Banana Pearl
image:image.image:caption:
Long Log line: After failing to deliver an apparently un-crackable code, Deejay and his computer-whiz acid casualty mate Lenny end up on the run from Champagne Charlie, a ruthless gangster known for her quirky methods of coercion. This is a fast-paced slice of Brit-gangster mayhem in which things aren't always what they seem.
Short Synopsis - 123 words Made on a shoe string budget by up-and-coming Brighton based filmmaker Ben Simon, Banana Pearl feels like a much higher budget short. Featuring performances from Saffron Sprackling, front women of 90's Brit-pop band Republica and Toby Osmond (Kaufman's Game), this is a race against time tale of 2 friends trying to break an apparently un-crackable code for Champaign Charlie (played by Saffron) a ruthless local gangster. If Deejay can keep Lenny, his computer-whiz, acid casualty mate off the Banana Pearl (a new strain of super strong Marijuana) and focus on cracking the code, they can both avoid finding out how Champagne Charlie earned her nickname. Boasting a pumping soundtrack, this is a fast-paced slice of Brit-gangster mayhem in which things aren't always what they seem.

image:image.image:title: A Dancer who gave up
image:image.image:caption: UNESCO's Intangible Heritage Program recognizes dance as an essential source of identity, deeply rooted in the past. Unfortunately, the fluid, undocumented form of many traditional dance forms makes them particularly vulnerable in situations of rapid change and socio-political upheaval.More of it , most of the dancers who are the living form of carrying this heritage and cultural expression gave up due up to the lack of resources which arises of changing employment condition , livelihood pressure and falling down in employability. This is a story of one such dancer from a small town of Bengal , who gave up dancing due to financial pressure.

image:image.image:title: The Ungovernable Force (2016) OFFICIAL TRAILER
image:image.image:caption:
***If you are a film critic or operate a film review website/blog and would like to see the entire film for review, please email ungovernablefilms@gmail.com. The same goes for any other inquiries. Enjoy!
"The Ungovernable Force" takes the raw gross-out b-horror humor of "Street Trash" and fuses it with the subculture-exploiting theme of "Suburbia"; add to that the very tangible plot line of bums (not unlike those in "Street Trash") teaming up with punks (not unlike those in "Suburbia") to fight a sadistic sheriff running for mayor on the American Fascist Party platform. Just when you thought "All cops are bastards" and other overused punk cliches couldn't possibly be used any more liberally, "The Ungovernable Force" comes tumbling off the big silver screen with abundant and unnecessary nudity, violence, shock, gore, obscenity, profanity, controversy, taboo, drugs, sex, cop-killing, punk rock fun! With a killer soundtrack and unforgettable appearances from punk and b-horror legends [Tony Moran (John Carpenter's "Halloween"), Bill Weeden (Troma's "Sgt. Kabukiman"), Lloyd Kaufman, Debbie Rochon (1990's "Scream Queen of the Decade"), Apache Ramos ("The Warriors"), Nic Cramer (Award-Winning Porn Director), Nick Cash (999), Steve Ignorant (CRASS), Shend (The Cravats), Steve Lake (Zounds), Zillah Minx (Rubella Ballet), Mensi (Angelic Upstarts)], "The Ungovernable Force" takes every taboo and offensive element of society and forces it down the audience's throat, all while spoon-feeding the tortured audience a splendid tale of heartbreak, romance, and a coming-of-age drama between close friends, set against a punk and bum backdrop!

image:image.image:title: Grampy
image:image.image:caption:
A documentary filmmaker follows her grandfather to Liverpool as he re-discovers his tragic post-war childhood. Grampy reveals things at the age of 77 that he has never told anyone in his entire life. 'A lot of people have no idea what goes on behind closed doors... I just felt, at my time of life, the time had come to say something about it. Weather its important to anyone or not... I don't know. But those who are interested will know...what happened.'
Grampy, (Eric Galvani) was evacuated from Liverpool at the age of 5 during WW2. Having already lost his mother, he was taken from the rest of his family and moved around the countryside. However, the worst was yet to come. A poverty-stricken post war Liverpool was waiting for him at the end of the war, and so were his bitter stepmother and volatile father. The youngest of 8 children, Eric faced a hungry childhood which might take his whole life to come to terms with. 'The adults who were supposed to act in my interest... I would say to them, Look at me and speak to me, as if I'm a fellow human being...not turn your back and ignore me as you might do a dog that's running round on the floor.'
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: the FAB3
image:image.image:caption:
Hikari, Ayumu, and Reina are three children who have been living in self-constructed castles of the heart. Surrounded by walls, not letting anyone in, and not leaving themselves, the worlds were supposed to be complete. But they are pulled together by invisible threads, becoming entwined, and are lead to another world. With music from Iceland's Sigur Rós, this is a child ensemble drama portraying children's lies from the perspective of children.
The three inside their castles are slowly drawn together by invisible threads.
The girl who was pretending to be unable to see becomes able to, the boy who was pretending to be able to see confesses that he can't, and the girl who was convinced she could see realizes that she can't.
Guided by threads, at the destination they finally arrive at is...

We try to explore the forest to discover that it holds a world of consumerist obsessions; an obsession with slimness, long hair, consumption and a sickening desire to hoard whatever is in our paths even if we don't need.

image:image.image:title: The Hopping Dead
image:image.image:caption:
SYNOPSIS: Two thieves break into a Chinese business only to stumble upon the terror that is the Chinese jiang shi, a corpse reanimated as a vampire by Chinese black magic that, because of rigor mortis, chases after its victims by hopping.
DIRECTOR'S STATEMENT: There is more to Asian culture than just kung fu. There is also… hopping vampires. I have loved the idea of hopping vampires ever since I saw the quintessential jiang shi movie “Mr. Vampire” as a child. With this film, I wanted to bring my own jiang shi story to life while paying tribute the two filmmakers who have influenced me the most: the legendary Sammo Hung and the Master of Terror John Carpenter. And like I told my last wife, I says, “Honey, I never drive faster than I can see. Besides that, it’s all in the reflexes.”

The film borrows from the 1990s New York aesthetic as a tribute to the director. The film shows you bondage like you’ve never seen before - combining straps, chokers and harnesses with softer and safer materials. People past by, but no one paid attention to him. He was alone and survived in his own way with humbly contribution.
Different life was separated from the two sides of the window. Who could explain it in one word?

image:image.image:title: Wound Wound Round
image:image.image:caption:
'The circle of the return to birth can only remain open, but this is a chance, a sign of life, and a wound.' -Derrida
'There is an ancient wound we all carry, we wind it round ourselves like a...' -BK
'Wound Wound Round' is an excerpt from '26 Suicides'.
26 Suicides is a 27 chapter, non-narrative new media art work.
**26 Suicides was initially designed to use surround sound and multi channel video to deliver an enveloping, synesthetic experience. 26 Suicides is currently being remixed as a virtual reality art experience.**
It is the personal and intimate testimony of BK's synesthetic life.
Watch them if you are not afraid of dangerous modern art.
See more here: www.26suicides.com
Sound and visuals by BK. All rights reserved, all rights waived.
Tools used: Cinema 4d, X-Particles, After Effects, Digital Performer

image:image.image:title: Five Nights of Waking Dreams
image:image.image:caption:
Produced By:
KraZy KiDD TeLepRDucTionS Created from an original concept by:
David B. Cartwright and Steve Kusaba
Soundtrack Composed By:
Steve Kusaba
Featuring :
Alex Ferris and Anarchestra
Featuring the Poetry of: Daniel Moore
Five Nights of Waking Dreams is a pseudo psychedelic tight rope walk over fire. Teetering between the thin parameters between reality and illusion bringing viewers to the intersecting spaces where the parameters that define our perception of both continuous states of our minds existence blurring the lines between dream and reality, heaven and hell, pain and pleasure, through a period of Five Nights of Waking Dreams.
The film invites you to experience the world through the mental perspective of a neurological condition that effects the circadian rhythm and causes the most severe pain known to modern medicine. A prolonged cycle of sleep deprivation and pain trapped in a rotation between heaven and hell, dead clarity and hallucination.
The accompanying, mesmerizing, baroque rock sounds of the prolific composer of “Centrifugal Satz Clock” (the worlds largest musical collection ever) Steve Kusaba adds layers and dimensions to this visceral, prolific, experience.

image:image.image:title: Dream Depriver
image:image.image:caption: Dream Depriver is a 3D animated film, constituted of suspension and nonlinear narrative. The main character has sustained trauma from being bullied,which forces him to steal someone's dream,produced potion to suppress trauma , but actually it dose not help. As the main character faces a kid,who also incurs a traumatic event from being bullied,which lets the main character have contradictory feeling . They,finally,help each other root out trauma because of empathy.

Curtis and his best friends, Rex the dog, and his Canuck-Man action figure, come up with a plan to turn things around. But considering the title of this short, their odds of success are low. 'The Day Santa Didn't Come' is a story of dearly dysfunctional family life in small-town Canada, and the little guy's struggle to overcome it all.

image:image.image:title: WALL
image:image.image:caption: This is an evolutionary story happened on ordinary street. The sight from the bottom can only see a huge foot wearing somethings nice , stepping on the poor for fun , giving leftover for handouts occasionally. "Class" is a necessary element to maintain a society, but the positions of superior implement their own power without the perspective of vulnerable people. The step doesn't seems high but with huge differences. Perhaps in somewhere not been seen, the distance between some people and this world is formed with accumulated hatred and become a huge invisible wall.

image:image.image:title: Daughter of the King
image:image.image:caption: Daughter of the King follows Ashley Miller (Debra van Gaalen) as she rebuilds herself after a drug filled episode trying to live a normal life. An outstanding debt gets her pulled back into the underworld that is ruled by Haydar (Florin Marksteiner), a ruthless man that forces her into slavery. She becomes his property. Ashley is forced to prostitute and deal drugs hoping to regain her freedom. The abuse that comes from all sides and in all forms crushes her to the ground making her believe she's worthless. In the darkest moments Nadia (Kelsea Meredith), her close friend, descends in her life like an angel bringing her back to the light and setting her free.

image:image.image:title: The World of Prosperity
image:image.image:caption:
The World of Prosperity is an experiment to construct architecture which disguises evil as good. It is the projection of an architectural wolf in sheep´s clothing.
The project investigates the current sins of capitalism such as the fortification of the urban landscape, omnipresent surveillance, gentrification and eviction of the socially-disadvantaged from public space, and excessive use of euphemisms in the architectural language.
These characteristics are extrapolated into a dystopian near-future scenario within post-crises London, the world´s financial hub.
The story´s thematic object - the cyborg pigeon - embodies the role of passive surveillance and acts as a corrective agent within the public space. It symbolises resilient capitalist dynamics, which strive to achieve higher efficiency while remaining disguised.
The ambiguity stretches throughout the project. Colourful visuals combine with engaging language to create an impression of a Disneyland-like promotional ad. This is contrasted with the sinister references scattered throughout the animation.
The World of Prosperity is an investigation of the ambiguity of architecture in pseudo-post-capitalist society.

image:image.image:title: El corazón delator
image:image.image:caption: Cortometraje producido por CreActivos y Pa´que vos veáis Producciones en el campamento de verano "Teatro, Cámara, Acción," donde un grupo de jóvenes de la ciudad de Tijuana tomaron la obra literaria "El Corazón Delator" de Edgar Allan Poe para hacer una adaptación propia y crear este homenaje a Lotte Reiniger usando la técnica de cine de siluetas. El resutado es un cortometraje animado 100% por jóvenes participantes quienes demostraron que no sólo les encanta leer, sino que a partir de las imágenes generadas en su imagnación pueden crear personajes, escenografías y con las nuevas técnologias de su lado sacar su lado más CreActivo y generar nuevos contenidos de calidad. Demostrando que desde pequeños somos capaces de hacer cosas grandes.

image:image.image:caption: An average kid named Street (Cesar The Cipher Munoz) gets the chance of a lifetime when Khalil (Ricardo PRO Rodriguez) an infamous business owner offers him a job that would change his life. The job of the first male assassin in an all female agency. As he becomes the best, he makes enemies within the agency, but is given his first female target with special instructions. One day due to excessive abuse Vinko runs in mined forest where he finds his kind of persons, peace and respect. He gains a self-confidence, which is disturbing for rural bad boys.

image:image.image:title: In the Wind
image:image.image:caption: Desperate grass root director Lan Hai and his friend Ouyang decided to produce a mockumentary. Jiang Xiao, a graduating student who is deeply influenced by the Chinese mainstream education system, decided to record the entire production process of Lan's mockumentary as his final project before graduation. In order to present a splendid film, some extreme means were implemented by Lan Hai during the production. However, Lan Hai felt guilty as the leading actress (MIN) died during the production. The whole process was recorded by Jiang Xiao. He strongly condemned Lan Hai’s extreme way of film production. In fact, there was an ugly evil deep within Jiang Xiao, which was behind the mask of morality.

image:image.image:caption: Cockatoos catatonic follows the cathartic journey of Pedro, a young man who is struggling with a painful past. Pedro wants to be free and create a new present.

image:image.image:title: Monsoons Over the Moon part 2
image:image.image:caption:
Monsoons over the Moon is told from the perspective of those most oppressed by the dictatorial system that has shut down the internet, making the written word exponentially more important.
The narrative follows a young lady from the streets whose violent boyfriend has disappeared and his rivals are using her to look for him. She feels afraid and imprisoned by her circumstances until one of her friends gives her a book which catapults her to open her mind to the understanding that she need not be afraid of what is to come because the power lies within her.

Trailer for the short film Vivien.Love.
Plot: The shy Läufer gets to know the selfconfident Vivien and her best friend and exboyfriend Manus, with whom he soon happens to find himself in a Ménage á Trois. When Vivien gets pregnant the happy ending of this story depends on one question. Can Läufer overcome his conception of a monogamous relationship and love two people at the same time? The answer: No.
Vivien.Love. is a colourful splattertragedy, ft. dark humor, gender crash and several litres of fake blood.
