image:image.image:title: Ambu
image:image.image:caption: The story revolves around a 6 year old balloon seller girl(Ambu) forced to sell balloons against her dreams and desires to go inside a funfair and enjoy like the other normal children. Irony of Ambu is that she sells colourful balloons to the children though in her vision the balloons and the world is black n white. One fine day her destiny takes her inside and she is able to enjoy the fun.Ambu forgets her world and becomes the normal child as she enters her dream world and enjoys the rides and the atmosphere for which she desires all her life but again she goes into her Black n White world of selling the colourful balloons. It is a story of a childs fulfillment of dreams and desires for a limited time being in which the child goes to such a world where it belongs truly.But finally she has to back to her own world of selling balloons to feed her parents.

image:image.image:title: Little stone lion
image:image.image:caption: Once upon a time, Little Stone Lion sat with his parents in front of the door, watching over the temple. He wish to become a temple guardian someday, strong and fierce like his parents so he can expel monsters and demons. But Little Stone Lion was too tiny. Evil spirits weren't afraid of him. One quiet evening, a hungry stray cat sneaked into the temple and began to munch on the offerings on the altar table. Little Stone Lion witness her mischeif. He decided to chase her away to prove his great ability in being a temple guardian.

image:image.image:title: Day Zero: Behind the Frame
image:image.image:caption:
"Day Zero: Behind the Frame" takes us through an intimate journey into life on set of the second season of "Day Zero" the Series, an independent web TV production that won over 40 film awards over a span of just a few years, rising to the top of the indie scene with long-format episodes rivaling Hollywood television, not just in length, but in style and presentation. It is a poster example of Utah's growing filmmaking industry that lays the foundation and groundwork as a renown pioneer for passion projects. This behind-the-scenes look into the show makes the case as the first long-running television production without a budget, that pushes the envelope to what is possible, rendering a once ambitious and daunting project replete with scheduling conflicts and delays, to become a completed product of twenty half-hour episodes with all the bells and whistles that entertain and provoke thought and insight into a post-apocalyptic disaster scenario.
Watch Day Zero the Series on Amazon Prime / Video! Season 1: https://www.amazon.com/gp/video/detail/B01LZ561TR Season 2: https://www.amazon.com/gp/video/detail/B01LW9DIJ5
Watch Day Zero the Series at Indieflix via subscription: https://www.indieflix.com/browse/distributor/185839
Or free with ads weekly Friday nights at 9pm EST on Tuff TV (currently Saturdays and Sundays at 830pm EST) over-the-air or by streaming here: http://www.tufftv.com/tuff-tv-live/
Edited and Produced by Cal Nguyen Music by Day Zero composer Phil Stokes (c) 2016 Fofanugget Productions. All Rights Reserved

image:image.image:title: Avala
image:image.image:caption:
Avala
(logline)
Is such experience false, where the spaces begin to diminish, reduce and separate?
(synopsis)
Twenty years ago, Mr. Dedi?, a professional Cellist with his career on the rise suddenly decided to stop playing the Cello, and withdrew from the world.
After leaving the Philharmonic orchestra, without anything, only his cello, various psychiatric institutions became his home, until he finally arrived at a sanatorium at the top of the mountain named Avala.
In this displaced and forgotten psychiatric asylum, also known as Open Day Hospital, he is waiting for a return to the real world.
The only staff in the forgotten hospital, marked out for demolition, is the head nurse Sonja, who is also a housekeeper and a therapist. Mr. Dedi? is her only remaining patient.
Days are going slowly, like in every hospital. Mainly, Mr. Dedi? is fighting his own demons. When he cannot sleep, he dreams of and imagines war crimes for which he is being told never happened. He feels sick remorse, since his music could not prevent all those atrocities.
After one experience with Sonja, during a summer storm, and the discovery of an abandoned mine named Hollow Rock, he comes across a café hosting a beauty contest. He unpacks his dusty cello and climbs aboard the Open Top tourist bus, traveling through Belgrade. He is playing the Boccherini concert...
(Personal story, told from passion, only with the help of friends. Filmed in 12 days, with a budget of 128 € and with a broken lens camera, and surveyor tripod.)

image:image.image:title: Let Them Eat Cake
image:image.image:caption: LET THEM EAT CAKE is about an American Christian missionary in war-torn Iraq who thinks he relates to the experiences of a persecuted Iraqi Christian. He is surprised to find the Iraqi afraid to come to America because of what he’s heard on cable news.

image:image.image:title: Abandoned Berlin
image:image.image:caption:
Abandoned buildings and places awaken a curious fascination in us. Going deep into the hidden Berlin, a Berlin that seems to have forgotten part of its recent history, we visited abandoned buildings and places of the German city.
Ciarán Fahey, a curious Irishman will tell the hidden history of these magical places, despised by some while causing a fascinating attraction to others. We reflect on the existence and nature of these spaces frozen in time and wonder about their uncertain future.

image:image.image:title: DOMINGOS

image:image.image:title: MY LIFE WORKED OUT Trailer
image:image.image:caption: MY LIFE WORKED OUT, is a two-hander, comedy web series surrounding the lives of JESS and AMY, two women in their late 20s who are best friends despite their polar opposite personalities. We follow their attempt to get their lives together as they sign up for the latest phase and craze to hit the LA gym scene...CLASS PASS. These are short (3-5 mins), comedy sketches in the vein of INSIDE AMY SCHUMER meets BROAD CITY. Each episode is set around a different over the top and ridiculous exercise class attended by Jess and Amy who embark on the endless pursuit of getting their lives to "work out" but just falling short...

image:image.image:title: ARTIFICIAL RESPIRATION
image:image.image:caption:
A Film About Human Behavior in Difficult Circumstances.
Mount Damavand, also known as the roof of Iran, is 5671 high. This mount tempts almost all the professional climbers. To reach Damavand’s summit is considered as an honourable achievement for them. Although, many fail to accomplish this mission, some even lose their lives on the way. This movie follows a climbing team as they try to reach the summit of mount Damavand and face with some adventures and perils on their way. The movie also focuses on the complicated relations of the team members with each other.

image:image.image:title: The Knit Doll
image:image.image:caption: Fariba Masoumi, from the village of Shulam, the town of Fooman, the province of Gillan, with 90% physical disability since her birth, has been continuing life lying down for 27 years now. This disabled artist like all people, and perhaps even better than most, has gained an intriguing view of life and it`s continuation.

image:image.image:title: The Girl in the Photo

His popularity in the local news media grows with his body count, so the pressure is on to keep the police and the public interested. On the heels of his latest kill, Dylan has a new unsuspecting victim right where he wants her: his passenger's seat.

image:image.image:title: How To Fall in Love
image:image.image:caption:
How To Fall in Love was created for the #JamesBayFilmProject. Filmmakers from around the world were invited to submit a 1-2 minute trailer for the opportunity to have their trailer commissioned into a 10-15 minute narrative short film. James was looking for creative filmmakers to develop narrative short films that were inspired by the themes, characters and emotions of his album Chaos And The Calm. This short film was inspired by the song "If You Ever Want to Be In Love" off the album. Well... we didn't win but we wanted to release the film anyways so we had a new soundtrack down and we will be submitting to various festivals that would be a good fit for this film.
I liked the idea of a past, of someone who missed their chance but is willing to risk everything to bring them back. Someone who is willing to find the person they used to be and show them that they can be loved again.

image:image.image:title: WHITE STEPS
image:image.image:caption: WHITE STEPS was filmed in Rwanda and Burundi during August 2014. The movie was not made to show the poverty and the hardships encountered in African countries, something which is already known, neither was it made to convince its audience to help the people of Africa. On the contrary, we want to emphasize the extent to which the people of those countries have been influenced by the Western world, according to the testimonies of natives as well as the volunteers who were there to help. These are not just testimonies, but rather intimate confessions from the hearts of all these people who experience the harsh reality of their daily lives. They fearlessly open their hearts in front of the camera, enlightening the minds of all those who ignore the truth. And the truth is that we shouldn't be heroes in the eyes of little children because we offer them candies, or in the eyes of the older ones because we offer them a loaf of bread… Let’s offer them knowledge and education, so that they can solve their problems by themselves with no need of the “WHITE STEPS”… The movie is a retrospection of the genocide of 1994 through individual testimonies and points of view. It points out the everyday problems of this world with finding water, food, surviving and analyzes the importance of education through interviews… “People say that education is the greatest good But some of our brothers even lack this”

image:image.image:title: Billy and Charley

Many artifacts still figure in museum collections today. This film was produced at London College of Communication for the MA Animation course in partnership with the Cuming Museum.
Written, Directed and Edited by: Rafael Aflalo Sound Design: Guilherme Saldanha Original Soundtrack: Nico Paoliello

image:image.image:title: Golper Moddhe Golpo- Story in a Story
You Are Not Alone
image:image.image:caption: Story: In the year of 2058, Beijing becomes uninhabitable due to air pollution and sandstorms. People are forced to live underground. However they still wish they could go back to their homes above ground in the future, including the protagonist – a teenage schoolgirl. Although accompanied by a robotic teddy bear, she still feels lonely and misses her sister, a reporter working above ground broadcasting the progress of Beijing's environment restoration . However, she can’t find a way to reach the ground. One day, an intelligent sports car sees them and agrees to help them to go to the ground. The teddy bear does not trust the car and tries to stop the girl, but she insists. Finally, they both get in the car and start their journey. Their journey is tough. The gates to the ground are heavily guarded by soldiers. The car bravely jumps through the gates by driving across a ramp. Automated police cars, soldiers and tanks begin to chase them and drive them into a corner. In the end, both the car and the teddy bear sacrifice themselves to let the girl get into the elevator to the ground. After losing her friends, the girl, sad and scared, finally reaches the ground. However, after stepping out of the elevator, she only finds herself standing in the ruin of Beijing city amidst the heavy smog and huge sandstorms She also finds her sister, lying dead in front of an old green screen and scattered video cameras. Everything she believes proves to be a lie. “Dear sister, you are not alone,” says the girl, holding the skeleton hand of her dead sister. A ferocious sandstorm is approaching and they disappear in utter darkness.

image:image.image:title: Someone Commands
image:image.image:caption: Logline: A teenager walks on the street and gets influenced by the commands of his virtue. The film portrays a conflict between a person and his own soul, a person's wish to be unveiled but the virtue that coerces to wear a mask. Synopsis: The teen's virtue instigates him to opens up his shirt, with a naked body he is walking wearing a tie that symbolises his royalty. He asks a passerby for the time and gets ignored without help. He is on the haunts of dilemma. The compartments of his psyche protests and commands him to accomplish unnatural activities. He then asks if there's a cigarette shop nearby and still gets ignored. Having no money to pay to the shopkeeper after burning a cigarette he opens up his pant and gives it to the shopkeeper to pay his debt. Being naked he understands the futility of human existence to wear a tie and belong to this civilised society. The person metaphorically gets assassinated by his own cravings, yearns and addiction.

image:image.image:title: THREE THE MOVIE trailer
image:image.image:caption: The number three is everything in this movie. Three and its multiples. Archaic, spiritual, transcendent numbers. Three, Six, Nine. Carriers of wisdom that lead us to the heart of theological monotheisms. Three, the Christian Trinity. Six, the points of the Star of David, The Jewish Star. Nine, the face of God in Sufi tradition, according to Islamic culture. Three stories are intertwined in a land, Friuli, which extends along a triple border. The stories of Irene, a Carnian, Christian girl; Pavel, Ukrainian and Jewish; Mehdi, Iranian and Muslim. Udine. A beautiful city, but one that is perceived as cold and inhospitable by emigrants. Pavel and Mehdi are illegal immigrants, who share an apartment - and concerns about social matters - in the “ghetto” of Via Roma. In love with Pavel, Irene tries to help them, but her surge of solidarity goes perhaps too far, and she regrets it... Mehdi lives obsessed with an ancient guilt: his fragile soul is attracted to Evil... “Above” them, the incarnation of metaphysical realities that rule the existence of men, three antagonists who raise the total number of characters to six. There is an old blind man, able to see beyond the phenomenal reality: an incarnation of Purgatory, the suffering of men waiting for a change of status. Monsignor Angelo is Paradise, the spiritual father of Irene, which advises, rebukes, protects ... A mysterious, provocative, sensual, poisonous woman is Evil, Hell incarnate. A triad of other figures raises the number of characters to nine: the novice Edo, who takes responsability for dealing with Pavel’s situation; Omar, a false friend who tries to corrupt the integrity of Mehdi; the Angel of the North, a figure originated in the Koranic tradition: it can be seen, sometimes behind the characters. Then, ten, a little girl... Predestination and moral choice. Two alternatives? Subjection to freedom of Good or Evil. What will the protagonists choose? This low-budget independent film, starting with the reconstruction of the micro (?) Universe of illegal immigrants in the Northeast of Italy, it opens up philosophical, visionary, surreal dimensions. To speak of equality in diversity. To search for the Same in the Other. This is poetic disenchantment.

image:image.image:title: The Eyes Wide Shut Masks
image:image.image:caption:
Rialto, Venice. In a short but remarkable workshop, in 1985 Franco Cecamore has created two original masks for the Venice Carnival. Twelve years later, a man with white coloured men's clothing, came to that shop: the man was Jan Harlan, executive producer of one of the last movies directed by Stanley Kubrick. He visited "Il Canovaccio" in order to buy several masks. One of them would be used by Kubrick in his last masterpiece "Eyes Wide Shut" for the character of Dr. Bill Harford, played by Tom Cruise. This documentary is the incredible and unknown story behind the creation of the most important masks of "Eyes Wide Shut." The artisans of this typical Italian product say that the origin of the art makes it a unique product. Original documents, photographs and the description of the meeting with the Kubrick's production make this the story we tell in our film.
Rialto, Venezia. In una piccola ma bellissima bottega, nel 1985 Franco Ceccamore creò due maschere originali per il Carnevale di Venezia. Dodici anni dopo, un signore con un vestito bianco, entrò nel suo negozio: era Jan Harlan, produttore esecutivo degli ultimi film diretti da Stanley Kubrick. Visitò "Il Canovaccio", per acquistare alcune maschere. Una di queste sarebbe poi stata utilizzata da Kubrick, nel suo ultimo capolavoro Eyes Wide Shut, per il personaggio del dottor Bill Harford, interpretato da Tom Cruise. Questo documentario è l'incredibile e sconosciuta storia dietro la creazione delle più importanti maschere di Eyes Wide Shut. Gli artigiani di questo tipico prodotto italiano raccontano, nel documentario, l'origine di quell'arte manifatturiera che ha reso le maschere di Venezia come un prodotto unico, inimitabile e famoso in tutto il mondo. Documenti originali, fotografie e la descrizione dell'incontro con la produzione di Kubrick ... questa è la storia che raccontiamo nel nostro film.
Produzione http://www.formacinema.it/
Storia della lavorazione del film http://www.formacinema.it/prima-pagina/37-fp-rokstories/256-le-maschere-di-eyes-wide-shut

image:image.image:title: Sound of Silence
image:image.image:caption: This project explores how technology, especially smartphones, has affected our lives.This animated short film is a love story about a blind date.The main character is a boy names Peter. He is waiting for his date in a restaurant. The girl’s name is Jane, she is addicted to her smartphone. In the end Peter meet another girl. This animation combined 2D character with 3D environment. I build environment in Maya first then render out background pictures and draw animation in Toon Boom Harmony. Then composited in Adobe After Effects and add sound effect in Adobe Premiere.

The fears arise in the wake of an increase in atrocities against Indian women. It finds its way into her dreams and continues to trouble her. The film is a dream sequence with a fair share of suspense, intrigue, build-up and a climax.

image:image.image:title: Wrestling in Yida
image:image.image:caption:
Wrestling; a sport, entertainment, and for some, a way of life.
We all know at some level what it's like to fight for something, to unflinchingly wrestle with all our hearts. Maybe internally, maybe outwardly, regardless we know what it's like to fight, to wrestle, to choose day after day to say yes to that which would be easier to say no. The people of the Yida Refugee Camp in South Sudan have a uniquely vicious fight. A fight they wrestle and defeat daily with courageous love and optimism, a fight to survive and choose love over hate.
© Samaritan's Purse. 2016
http://photo.samaritanspurse.org/wrestling-for-life

image:image.image:title: Spartiti - Austerità
image:image.image:caption:
SPARTITI: "Austerità" is the first single and video from their debut album and the song that gives the title to the entire album. -------------------------------------------------- -----------
Austerità is the first single and video from the debut album of SPARTITI, the duo formed by Jukka Reverberi of Giardini di Mirò and Max Collini of Offlaga Disco Pax. The video was made by director Filippo Biagianti and emphasizes with a sumptuous black and white the haunting evocative capacity of the song. The lyrics outline the views of a child colliding with the pre consumistic era. The problems and difficulties of the adults are not, today as in 1973, very far. Two kids, a park, a shabby toy. Down the street, waiting for them, the sound of a guitar that comes directly into the heart, telling us what could have been and what would never be.
AUSTERITÀ synopsis:
A boy and a girl chase relentlessly while a small, old toy car is at the center of contention. The race continues on the street, in the park, on a carousel. Imagination runs wild, be a gunslinger for a moment, just before returning home. The toy car left behind, forgotten on the wall, along with the memory of another carefree afternoon spent to wander around. The problems and difficulties of the grownups are – hypothetically – elsewhere.
* Subject, editing and direction: Filippo Biagianti * Artist: Spartiti * Track title: Austerità * Label: Woodworm Label * Distribution: Audioglobe * Album: Austerità * Track Authors: Music: Jukka Reverberi Text: Massimiliano Collini * Music publishing: Ala Bianca
The two young protagonists of the video are Sofia Biagianti and Federico Mainardi
info: facebook.com/Spartiti woodworm-music.com antennamusicfactory.com (booking) bigtimeweb.it (press office)

image:image.image:title: Kaotika
image:image.image:caption: There are elements like sun and water which sustain life. All living things are in need of these two. They capture the sun and water in a zone called ‘Kaotika’. People are born and live in a place. This place could be not only his/her house or shelter but also the city s/he lives in. Kaotika calls cities and rooms a zone. This zone is where people are together. Each and every new-born man and woman fall in this zone. This zone is where rotten generations grow. And like a broken egg, every child leads his /her life within this place. All the generations which follow one another are rotten and just there to sustain life.

image:image.image:title: Kool A.D. - 'PROVE IT' (prod. Scoop DeVille)
SUBCONSCIOUS - Director’s Cut 2013
image:image.image:caption:
Written and directed by Chris Petropoulos, SUBCONSCIOUS is the one and only Greek found footage film (with a high concept, realistic feel and plot twist), which premiered in 2010 in Sheffield UK and was a highlight selection at Thessaloniki International Film Festival in 2010.
Fanis is a twenty-something boy who suffers from a particularly distressing nightmare that always seems to involve an intensely creepy shrine of unknown origin. He firmly believes that unraveling the mystery behind the dream will effectively dismantle these horrifying visions, and promptly sets out on a quest to secure what’s left of his sanity. This spooky adventure includes a strange girl Fanis meets on the internet, a long car ride across the Greek countryside, and a secluded house in the middle of nowhere. Needless to say, something extremely dreadful befalls poor Fanis and his skinny blonde companion during this questionable excursion into the foreboding countryside.

image:image.image:title: The Forgotten Kingdom? Chronicle of The North...
image:image.image:caption: Naa Gbewa a prince and Calvary man, who came and established his empire in modern day Ghana, Burkina Faso and Togo. He was the first to introduce Chieftaincy as a system of government in this region, the first King of modern day Ghana. This documentary is about Naa Gbewa, about the roots of his empire, how it grew and finally fell apart. By educating the people about their common history the documentary is meant to promote peace and unity in northern Ghana and Ghana as a whole.

Produced by German actress and filmmaker Annabell Osoiro and directed by her Brazilian husband Felipe. This short film was shot on iPhone 6 in beautiful West Hollywood for zero budget.

image:image.image:title: Solitary
image:image.image:caption:
***Official Selection - 2016 Short Film Corner, Festival du Cannes 2016*** ***Official Selection - 2016 Portobello Film Festival***
Written by Kieren Hughes Directed by Mark Logan Starring - Lucy-Jane Quinlan, Chiarina Woodall, Serael Asphall, Jessica Mann, Nicolas Karpenko & JB Brask
Where life ends,the nightmare begins. ‘Solitary’ is an expressionistic horror film concerning the strange fate of its central character, Victoria; a vicious 19 year old hoodlum, who has developed an unhealthy addiction to extreme violence. Following one particular night on the streets of London, during which she leads her two teenage acquaintances Charlene and Sam into an unspeakable act of horror, Victoria now finds herself alone, hiding out in a squalid flat, with nowhere left to run, no way out.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Biji Biji Kobane
image:image.image:caption: 25 giugno 2015. Cinque del mattino, Kobane viene attaccata da quattro autobombe, in seguito i Jihadisti dell'Isis entrano in città e scatenano la guerra. Alla ricerca di un amico ferito, con dei ragazzi Curdi, in uno di quei giorni che Kobane ricorderà come il più cruento dalla fine del conflitto del gennaio di quest'anno. Finalista al Mobile Film Festival di MoBgraphia Cultura Visual (Brasile). Official selection "Punti di Vista" al ASFF Film Festival Roma Museo MAXXI (Italia).

image:image.image:title: Kashim
image:image.image:caption: A girl and her cat walk around in a near future version of Athens,Greece, looking for food.

image:image.image:title: Bouddi
image:image.image:caption:
Bouddi, is a Bengali word by which sister-in-laws are lovingly referred to. The era of rich culture, which was evident in daily lives of many of Calcutta households, was a background for many a few romantics.
Set in 1960 near Calcutta, Bouddi is a poignant tale of Paromita and Sukanto, who's love and innocent banter are stricken by much seriousness. Something in-between is not letting them talk. A tired and gruff Sukanto returns home waiting to unwind and de-stress from a long day, only to be pestered by his loving anxious wife who has been awaiting his return. But in vain does her love and melodious voice coax him and his hurtful demeanor. Something is Not allowing one's love to soothe the others pain. Paromita’s playfulness sings only to fail in coloring Sukanto’s much morbid temper.
The indifference is hurting and the moments are unbearable, until the untimely visit of Joydeep, to whom Sukanto is a mentor at work and whom he revers as an elder brother. And unknowingly he brings eternity down to their doorstep and the lovers unite once again.

image:image.image:title: LIFT
image:image.image:caption: A young woman rides the elevator home. It suddenly becomes the gateway for a series of dark supernatural events.

image:image.image:title: Quetzal
image:image.image:caption:
It’s about a Native American girl whose village is under attack.
She runs to the temple of the god Quetzal to ask for help. But the god doesn’t respond…

image:image.image:title: Suicide Nation
image:image.image:caption:
The nuclear power plant has broken down because of the earthquake.
After that, northern part of our country was forbidden to enter because of radioactive pollution.
And then, people moved to the West.
In the west, murder, robbery, rape, corruption, many incident happen day and night.
There is no longer what our country used to be…
Finally, the Government announced “The Decree of Suicide Recommendation.”
It means, the Government tolerates us killing ourselves.
Human exclusion has begun in our country…

image:image.image:title: "The End" Episode 1 - A Lonely World
image:image.image:caption:
Taylor is alone in the zombie apocalypse until a mysterious ex-soldier saves her life. The two go in search for more survivors...and answers. What they find instead will make them question everything they think they know.
Watch the full series at https://www.youtube.com/user/theendwebseries1

image:image.image:title: Amy
image:image.image:caption: Amy is a young girl with a psychotic obsession for bubble wrap. When a film crew begins documenting her life, things take a turn for the worse as their involvement brings up old demons.

image:image.image:title: Cry me a river
image:image.image:caption:
A feminist story of one family, two countries, three generations, and four women.
During the Lantern Festival, in Shaanxi, China, Lin and her mother-in-law go to the temple to burn incense and pray, and then they go to the market to buy some food on the way. After the cooking done, they take a train to bring the meal to Lin’s husband Tianli's working place. However, Tianli’s mistress Niu and himself appear at the same time, which make Lin feel wronged suddenly.
In Malaysia, 3000 kilometers outside of Shaanxi, Lin's daughter Pingping disputes with Chang, Pingping has a dubious relationship with Chang’s husband, and finally Chang accuses severely because Pingping intervenes into Chang's family as the mistress.

image:image.image:title: Rhapsody
image:image.image:caption:
Urbanite’s life is busy with miserably long working hours. Sometimes when you look at the old photo on your office desk, all your happy high school memories come back and give you nostalgia: play and laughter in classroom; having corridor chases; escaping punishment from teachers; and enjoying musical concerts in the assessable hall and so on.
The music video produced incredible memories by merging live-action video and special visual effects in a 360 degrees virtual reality environment. A staff room with frozen moment, zero gravity at the laboratory and the upside-down classroom. Through the technology of virtual reality to allow audience experience it.

image:image.image:title: Marijuana Law Reform Rally
image:image.image:caption: A sea of green signs filled the rotunda as people came to discuss the legalization of Marijuana. In Minnesota there is a significant inequality of arrests related to Marijuana possession that primarily affects minorities. Multiple organizations, as well as individuals. are teaming together in order to create change for the communities most affected by the unfair Marijuana policies.

image:image.image:title: Colossal Costs
image:image.image:caption: Every year, students leave high school with a gleam in their eye, excited to begin the rest of their lives, but most are unaware of the tremendous amount of debt that lies ahead of them. Our current educational system has left American students in 1.2 trillion dollars of tuition debt. Higher education has become a necessity in our job market today, but what will happen if the average student continues to leave college $30,000 in the red? In the U.S., Minnesota has been rated the 4th highest state for tuition debt; Colossal Costs explores this common issue among young adults in the Twin Cities. By interviewing recent college graduates, this short documentary gives perspective to the problem at hand, and sheds light on what our country needs to do to progress to a more sustainable economic future.

image:image.image:title: The Lost Trace
image:image.image:caption: Project Signing Out main idea about documenting traditional signboards in Singapore actually started out as an observation with regards to its intricacy and heritage properties. This traditional signboards are losing their popularity amongst younger business owners. Contemporary choice of business name replaces real business owner's name in our modern society. Signboard crafters in Singapore are assumed to have retired from their trade as producing such intricate signboards is time consuming and tedious. Project 'Signing Out' wants to archive and document local business owners, established in the 1960s (or businesses which were handed down during that period) that still proudly display their signboard as well as any other information such as belief, purpose promise and value etched into the board; how their business last till now. With such advance technology in our current state, it is heart-warming to be able to observe that there are still some groups who still keep old traditions alive. We mainly will target Chinese business owners such as traditional medicine hall, grocery store, coffee shop, clan association and others like bicycle shop or shop selling rattan products.

image:image.image:title: A DEATHTRIP IN BERLIN (Trailer)
image:image.image:caption: All this unlucky guy wanted was to make a no-budget film. But everything went wrong. Actors quit and now there isn’t even a camera. He finds an envelope in his postbox which contains a letter and a black pill. The anonymous sender writes that the addressee left the black pill at his place and then wishes him goodbye forever. Our unlucky guy needs some drinks. As he is leaving for the liquor store he contemplates the black pill sitting on the table. In a split second he swallows it down. He finally leaves the house, but what is now happening? Could it be that this will be his last night on earth? What about these fragments and visions that seem to be connected in some way to his failed film project?

image:image.image:title: The Little Pink Dragon IAFT 1st short film 3d Animation Project
image:image.image:caption:
I own the video. If shared, please credit my name or website http://www.bemmygail.com
This is my very first 3d animated short film created as a student in IAFT (International Academy of Film and Television).
The story is about a hungry little pink dragon named Pickle who's lost in the forest. Find out how she could get home and eat!
I want this story to be as simple as possible, because I want people to simply see the beauty of life in a thousand little things. I know it still needs a lot of improvements, but it's a start! I hope this simple story could bring lasting joy to everyone. :3
Softwares used: Autodesk Maya 2015/2014 Adobe After Effects CC Adobe Premiere Pro CC Adobe Photoshop CC Adobe Illustrator CC Protools 10 Garageband MBP 2014 13"
Special thanks to everyone that helped me!
God (All Glory belongs to Him, can't be who I am without Him) Family - Mother and Father, and entire Clan (huge support and love :3 mwa mwahhh) My sister Abigail Zeke for helping me with music!!! My Brother Drew for being a huge inspiration! Friends all over the world! My funny, annoying but cute classmates :P All my mentors! The past present and future :) Sir Jonathan Tejano (Thanks for introducing me to 3d, such a new world) Sir Philip Muana (So ready to answer my questions! Thanks sir!) Sir John Milton Branton (Thanks for helping me refine my story, truly appreciated) Sir James D'Lonsod (Sound is 50%of film indeed! Thank you sir!)
It's true indeed how joyful a man can be by doing what he loves!
Like, follow, subscribe: http://www.facebook.com/bemmygail http://www.twitter.com/bemmygail http://www.instagram.com/digitalartistbem https://www.youtube.com/user/digitalartistbem http://dribbble.com/digitalartistbem http://digitalartistbem.deviantart.com

image:image.image:title: Fishi

Fishi is the story about a happy go lucky fish who simply wants to draw and have fun, but his life changed when he discovered something amazing that started his great adventure of fun, friendship, and the good that always conquers evil, and turned this simple little fish into an unlikely hero!

image:image.image:title: We Are All Alone In This Together
existence + actuality

image:image.image:title: Birds With Human Heads
image:image.image:caption: Basking in the wildlife of a handmade universe, a girl receives her first stick and poke tattoo from her best friend before being stolen away by a bird dragon.

image:image.image:title: The Hopscotch Marine
image:image.image:caption: The Hopscotch Marine. A short film. Gist: A soldier comes home from active duty to reunite with a friend and talk about the stress of losing his mom while enlisted. Company: This film was produced by Diao Undre as an international collaboration to promote unity. Combining the creative efforts from Los Angeles, Canada, and Italy, we are proud to offer The Hopscotch Marine, adapted from the monologues of Echoes by Vaughn McBride and filmed entirely with smartphones for your consideration.

image:image.image:title: Jayy Queezy - Rider
image:image.image:caption: Jayy Queezy drops video to his new single rider. Rider is a track about a relationship that he has had on and off for the past few years. This song is guranteed to get viewers in their feelings or in a calm mood because of the soothing chorus, verses and beat. The video is the icing on the cake showing off the beautiful Downtown Chicago area.

image:image.image:title: McClintock
image:image.image:caption: When Jason awakes from a bad dream he can't help but to hear a strange name everywhere he goes. His journey to find the truth will lead him down a rabbit hole.

image:image.image:title: GOLD PLATED BLOOD
image:image.image:caption: Tow groups of young people from east Africa in tow different direction trying to cross the Sahara desert just to make it to Europe or the USA. the one group captured by ISIS and slaughtered by cruelty one guy survive because he agreed to convert to Islam. the other group continues their journey but they left a tiered female behind with her best friend, unfortunate, local nomads came trying to rape her, her friend fought them but he got killed on the spot, she pretends as dead and they left her. the guy who agreed to convert, at night when the terrorists fall asleep he runs away from the terrorists on his way suddenly he found a dead body and a girl. both of them the girl from Eritrea and the guy from Ethiopia they trying to get out of the hell and the terrorists follow them............? this is an Immigrant day to day story the rest in the film.

image:image.image:title: Flame
image:image.image:caption: A Muslim waitress in her 20s works hard to finish her night shift. While a young Jewish customer smiles gently to her, she starts observing him curiously. She imagines him touching a mole on her back and whispers in her ear, "I love that mole”. When he left she finds a napkin on his table written on it “I love that mole".

image:image.image:title: ABSENT
image:image.image:caption:
ABSENT is a family Drama that revolves around Angel Washington a successful accountant, (Segilola Ogidan) and her talented seven-year-old son, Joshua, (Jaden Ayodele) who is reluctantly thrust into the single-parent world when her ex partner Marcus (Kayode Akinyemi) abruptly becomes an absent father after their break up.
Her constant efforts to reconnect father and son become futile, therefore leaving her in a perpetual state of bitterness and anger, consequently losing her job, family home and having numerous run in's with the law.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: IT STILL HURTS
image:image.image:caption:
Two teenagers facing incarceration confront their troubled past and uncertain future.
AIDEN (Kane Ogieva) 19, a troubled young man from South London is waiting to stand trial on a murder charge. Whilst waiting his verdict in the dense court cell alongside his guiltless best friend BRIAN (Jermaine Cope), he reminisces his dark childhood memories that he experienced at the hands of his abusive father.
The film relives some of the untold stories of our community. An emotional tale of Brotherhood, Violent crime, Child Abuse and how the nightmares of the past can come back to haunt one's future
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: I'll Never Leave You
image:image.image:caption:
A young woman ends a verbally abusive marriage to a concert violinist. Remarries and becomes the adoptive mother of her nephew.
Do our loved ones ever leave us?

image:image.image:title: The Body Politic
image:image.image:caption:
You rely on them every day. To eat. To drive. To work. To live. So, what happens when your hands grow tired of your commands and plot for freedom?
Translated from Clive Barker's short story.
THE BODY POLITIC: Charlie has been feeling odd lately. His hands haven't been feeling right, but on the contrary - they feel like they could take over the world. Plotting night after night, they have devised a plan to free themselves from that accursed body and live life on their own terms. The only issue is Charlie's awareness of the situation - he knows something isn't quite right with his hands. Hopefully, he finds out before the revolution begins...

image:image.image:title: Godzilla 2020: "S.O.S. Japan!!! All Monsters Attack!!!"
image:image.image:caption: My proposed Godzilla® 2020 sequel "S.O.S. Japan!!! All Monsters Attack!!!" joins all Godzilla® movies into one story as scientists soon regret tampering with Mount Fuji's time and space gate.

image:image.image:title: The [Games] Master
image:image.image:caption:
An expose of the life lived by Barryn Vaughn, the "gamesmaster."

image:image.image:title: FAUX SOLO
image:image.image:caption:
Empty space, a human body, and eight articles of clothing. Faux solo explores the dialogue and collaboration between the body, sound, clothing, and the space. Each article of clothing dictates the next move into the unknown space; sound amplifies the impact of the colliding costumes and contrasts to the space surrounding it. In the end, the thread of the film, the human body is left on its own and continues as a remnant of all that has accumulated.
Inspired by the voyeuristic and fantastical feeling of Prada and Nike commercials, shots and images are imbued with a feeling of desire, allure and the impulse for more. The body is on view yet it is also the tool for manipulating the clothing and environment - the subjective/objective, personal/public is continually emphasized and revealed.
Special thanks to Lululemon Lab for costuming, Sound designer Stefan Seslija, Makeup Artist Jess Hawkins, Director Nancy Lee, Director of Photography Sepehr Samimi and the commissioning support of FORM Festivals for making this film possible.

image:image.image:title: Red Diamond - trailer

A desperate struggle for survival begins as the creature takes up an evolutionary race against machines. The story is focused on a moral dilemma between natural beauty and material value. Beginning with the history of the evolution of life on Earth it finally culminates in the present – the artificial genetic and molecular modifications.
Animation by Adam ??d?o Music and sound design: Piotr Micha? Madej Producer: Animated Film Studio; Academy of Fine Arts in Cracow, Poland ? 2016

image:image.image:title: Lake Toba
image:image.image:caption: Samosir Island (Sumatra, Indinesia) is located in the middle of Toba lake, the largest volcanic lake in the world. The biggest known super volcanic eruption on Earth in the last 25 million years caused a global volcanic winter, killed most humans living at that time (69,000-77,000 years ago), and possibly affected the genetic make up of the human world-wide population. Samosir island is a home for Toba Batak people and the place where all the Batak come from originally. Unusual traditions and contemporary beliefs still coexist here.

image:image.image:title: STANDPOINT (Trailer)
image:image.image:caption: Immutability according to vision is mainly hypothetical, not real.Everything in this mundane world is relative, brings the view that our judgements and ideals are conditioned by social, historical and personal factors, that relativity also determined through loci. Different loci bring different realizations. Eternal claustrophobic can not reify sunshine living in a compartment, not undervaluing yet missing the perception of another living in an Eden like atmosphere. Abnormal thing in one certain locus, is normal in different locus. Normality and abnormality are beyond question.

image:image.image:title: Elena
image:image.image:caption:
I created a short documentary about a Minneapolis musician and aerialist called, Elena. Elena has been a musician since she was child and became an aerialist at a very young age as well.
For months I photographed Elena during her performances and from that I created a short documentary explaining her artistic practices.
In March 2015 Elena and I created a collaboration project called, Sappho. "Sappho," is one of the earliest known Greek poets born on the island of Lesbos. Sappho was admired during the antiquity era, but the bulk of her poetry has been lost, however her reputation has survived through fragments of her work that was left behind. With Sappho in mind, we created an all female art collaboration including live music, documentaries, live painting, and print art.
For four Sundays in March 2015 we held a live art event where we showcased women in art in Minnesota. During each event we would screen five of my own short documentaries. The final documentary screened was Elena and after an open discussion about the films, Elena and her band would perform. During the entire event, an invited artist would be painting as well as selling her latest pieces of work.
This event brought different communities in Minneapolis together and created new networks for Minnesota's women in art. It was an opportunity for expression and creativity in a non judging environment. I plan to host more events like this in the future.

image:image.image:title: I AM DYSLEXIC - Short Student Animated Film - TRAILER
image:image.image:caption:
I AM DYSLEXIC - Short Student Animated Film - TRAILER
A young dyslexic child falls into a world made entirely out of books. Alone in the environment his is forced to climb a mountain representing the education system.
The animated short film I AM DYSLEXIC expresses what it feels like to have a learning difference in our current school system. Those with learning differences should be proud of who they are and should never be made to feel alone. The film uses strong metaphors to portray these emotions, as we follow a little boy in his journey to climb a mountain in a world made of books.
I AM DYSLEXIC is an student animated short directed, produced and written by Mads Johan Øgaard and Katie Wyman. We are both Dyslexic and have both experienced different ways in which the school system tries to deal with dyslexic students, the good and the bad. We have made this film in the hopes of giving individuals who experience a learning differences something to relate to. Something to say; "Yes, this is a tough journey, but you're not alone and you can overcome the struggle!". This is content that many of us did not have growing up. Hence why we want as many people to see this film as possible, in the hopes it will give someone the courage to keep going.
This is our first short film, it was made with no budget. We managed a team of over 60 other students, most of which also have from dyslexia, dyscalculia, dyspraxia, asperger's syndrome or similar learning differences. We want people to be proud and know they are not alone. We believe our current school system doesn't know how to deal with these learning differences, and that many students don't get the proper support they should have. We have experienced being looked down on for our different way of learning. We believe it is very important to show the world what this is and that it is possible to create beautiful things when you have a learning difference.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Internal Outskirts

In the historic core of reconstruction/restructuring, the aristocratic past coexists with those inhabitants that emigrated to the capital in search of the “Lima dream”.

image:image.image:title: It´s in your Eyes
image:image.image:caption: There are things that make us hesitate, moments in our lives that scare us. For guidance in such instances, we look to the people closest to us. But sometimes they aren’t there. We speak to them, but only in questions. What happens when we realize our own inner thoughts are the only answers we have?

image:image.image:title: Screenwritter

image:image.image:title: Dangdut is My Music (2016)
image:image.image:caption:
As a big country, actually Indonesia just have two things as solution of life. Those are soccer and DANGDUT MUSIC!
This film describes a reality life in suburb Jakarta who almost all of residents really love dangdut music. They have favorite song, special dancing, humble community, and also routine agenda! "Dangdut is My Music" is representative of Indonesia people who really love soccer and dangdut music seriously. This is an unique phenomenon to identify the identity issues in this country.

image:image.image:title: The Jawara (2016)
image:image.image:caption:
In The Sundanesse terminology, Jawara is power, mystic, fighting skill, and criminal. In other situation, he is solution for some people.
This film tells about Jawara with Endeng Hartana or Bang Tanduk as character. He was educated by his father as Jawara. He is security in traditonal market. In other time, he helps everybody with his mystic skill.
In this film, Bang Tanduk shows hisself as minority but he uses his skill to injects spirit to some people

image:image.image:title: ARDENCY

image:image.image:title: DEFLATED

He has less than 24 hours left before he leaves to live out his dreams of playing pro basketball for a living. While many are happy for his success others are envious of the bright future Mann has ahead of him. Under the protection of his ex-basketball star turned drug dealer brother Duck, Mann has been able to avoid most confrontations. He must decide between both clocks without knowing his choice will change the way he sees life.
"The tick tack of the clock won't stop, even if we can't hear it anymore"- Anonymous.

image:image.image:title: CIGNO

And in the rusted deck, in the beat of the hammer, in the surfacing net we glimpse the dignity and the beauty of the Swan.

image:image.image:title: Harvest Moon Ritual (2016)
image:image.image:caption: Kasepuhan Cisungsang is one of five indigenous groups in Banten Kidul who maintain their ancestral culture consistenly. Kasepuhan Cisungsang’s residents live in foot of Halimun Mountain, District Lebak, Province Banten. Its population reaches 2.300 and majority of them are Moslem. This film shows Harvest Moon Ritual in Kasepuhan Cisungsang called Seren Taun.

image:image.image:title: I Still Remember You
image:image.image:caption:
I Still Remember You - from forthcoming Hats Off Gentlemen It's Adequate album 'When The Kill Code Fails'.
This is a song about an artificial intelligence character who believes he is conscious, failing to come to terms with the fact that the person he thought was his wife is a false memory made from stock photography images.
Album (Beastie's Rock Show's Prog Album of the Year 2015 and recommended by prog legend Steve Hackett) available from all major retailers, and directly as a download or physical album from http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/hatsoffgentl...
Also available from lots of dodgy download places but please don't get it from there - they are probably full of viruses.

image:image.image:caption:
This is an instrumental track from our artificial intelligence / science fiction themed album When The Kill Code Fails. If you like it any sharing much appreciated.
Music and video by Malcolm Galloway
The entire album is available for free streaming and purchase on CDBaby at http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/hatsoffgentl...
If you like our music, please join our mailing list at www.hatsoffgentlemen.com or www.reverbnation.com/itsadequate and get access to some exclusive free downloads
Also connect with us at www.facebook.com/itsadequate and www.twitter.com/itsadequate
Hats Off Gentlemen It’s Adequate is a proggy, funky, defiant and sometimes poignant London, UK based rock band. We’d be extremely grateful if you’d consider having a listen to our new album – When The Killcode Fails [Glass Castle Recordings GC4154 barcode 889211970209].
When The Kill Code Fails, Hats Off Gentlemen It's Adequate's second album, is a science-fiction/artificial intelligence themed concept album. It tells the story of an artificial intelligence construct attempting to come to terms with finding out it isn’t real. It is musically diverse with progressive rock, classic rock, electronica, metal and minimalist influences.
More detailed information about the album than anyone could plausibly be expected to want to read can be about the album is available at http://hatsoffgentlemen.com/kill_code/
