image:image.image:title: 'CHILDREN OF THE STREETS' (DOCU-DRAMA)
image:image.image:caption:
The short film "Children of the streets" brings together a vivid description of what life on the streets is like for the dejected and desolate children who have been denied of love, care, and a decent childhood.
The story tells the tale of two major characters "Halima" and "Aliyu", Halima who lost her mother at a young age of sixteen and recourses to giving her body to survive the coldness of the streets, and Aliyu on the other hand grew up with his own experiences as a child beggar. What becomes the fate of these two?
Not leaving out orphaned Little Samuel who was chased out of the house he had assumed to be home, into the streets, at a very tender age. What becomes the fate of Samuel too?
When children are mistreated, denied of love and care and exposed at a tender age to life threatening circumstances, they grow up with the life impoverished life pattern that has been imprinted on them. Who then is to blame?
A Peregrine production in Collaboration with Moc White Images.
Executive Producer: Chinonye J. Chidolue Producer: Moc Madu (Moc White Images) Director: Wole Ajetomobi
Story: Elemide Benjamin (winner of the 2015 Peregrine Reads short story competition).
Screenplay: Chinonye J. Chidolue.
www.peregrinereads.org

image:image.image:title: the AMERICAN dream
image:image.image:caption:
For too long America has failed to acknowledge the outrageous and seemingly intractable rates of poor maternal health and deaths of mothers in childbirth. The United States has the highest maternal mortality rate of any industrialized country in the world. More than two women die every day in the US from pregnancy-related causes. And while the vast majority of countries have reduced their maternal mortality ratios, for the past 25 years the numbers of women lost during pregnancy, birth or postpartum have increased dramatically in the US.
African-American women in the US are at especially high risk; they are nearly 4 times more likely to die of pregnancy-related complications compared to European American. Women of color are less likely to go into pregnancy in good health because of a lack of access to primary health care services. They are also less likely to have access to adequate maternal health care services. Black women are by far the largest demographic to suffer these outcomes, it has been this way for decades and yet they are seldom able to make their voices heard.
Its time for change. Through the documentary “the AMERICAN dream” the women tell their own stories: they know what is wrong, they share their hopes, they share their fears, and they share about their American dream, related to maternal health in the US. Perhaps it is time to listen.

image:image.image:title: Agnus Dei
image:image.image:caption: AGNUS DEI (A short synopsis) A young man Peter, who is around thirties, lives a desperate life with his mother Maria and her husband Stojan in one village of Serbia. Peter is born in Kosova from a forbidden love between his mother Maria and the young Albanian man, but for this he is not aware Is the period of time when the relations between Serbs and Albanians are inimical, exactly is the time of the beginning of war. Peter is forced by his mother and the others to go to the war. He intends to escape the war and goes to the West. He is mobilized forcefully in one paramilitary unit in Kosova’s war. In one action prepared as a revenge, he kills his father Dini whom he never had the chance to meet. Being not able to bear the arbitrary crimes, Peter, deserts from the army. He takes Dini’s daughter Maria and together they escape to the mountains. During their dangerous trip they are followed from both sides of enemies, Serbs and Albanians. Peter and Maria fell in love. They reach to come back in Peter’s home in Serbia. As soon as they returnee home, Peter realizes that he had killed his biologic father and he had fall in love with his sister. Not being able to stand this spiritual condition he commits a suicide.

image:image.image:title: case history (trailer)
image:image.image:caption: The patient has visions. No one of the family has had psychological disorders. The patient has never been ill, hospitalized for the first time. Life conditions satisfied: works in kolhoz, likes to drink. Visual hallucinations most often appear at night, less often at day. He sees God, Christ, Virgin Mary, the angels. On the other hand, he also has gruesome visions: the devil and gorgons appear too. Wild animal threaten him, the patient hears voices, clogs his ears. Temporary gaps appear in his memory even after brief conscience disorders. Some memories can be fake. Presented not as memory information loss as in regression of mind, but as unavailability to use the maintained memory information. There also is a hypochondriacal delirium idea, causing patient's sureness of suffering from strangest illnesses. The delirium idea is gradually becoming a sturdy system. Ultimately, due to the sensation errors, delirium ideas, also sickly affections different actions take place: acts of penitence leading to self-injuries and suicide, fits of fury, assaults, murders, accusations, complaints, litigation, establishment of religious sects, etc.

image:image.image:title: WHITE STEPS
image:image.image:caption: WHITE STEPS was filmed in Rwanda and Burundi during August 2014. The movie was not made to show the poverty and the hardships encountered in African countries, something which is already known, neither was it made to convince its audience to help the people of Africa. On the contrary, we want to emphasize the extent to which the people of those countries have been influenced by the Western world, according to the testimonies of natives as well as the volunteers who were there to help. These are not just testimonies, but rather intimate confessions from the hearts of all these people who experience the harsh reality of their daily lives. They fearlessly open their hearts in front of the camera, enlightening the minds of all those who ignore the truth. And the truth is that we shouldn't be heroes in the eyes of little children because we offer them candies, or in the eyes of the older ones because we offer them a loaf of bread… Let’s offer them knowledge and education, so that they can solve their problems by themselves with no need of the “WHITE STEPS”… The movie is a retrospection of the genocide of 1994 through individual testimonies and points of view. It points out the everyday problems of this world with finding water, food, surviving and analyzes the importance of education through interviews… “People say that education is the greatest good But some of our brothers even lack this”

image:image.image:title: Gilgamesh
image:image.image:caption:
This is a short animated film based on The Epic Of Gilgamesh, made as my graduation film at CSM. The original story is the oldest written story known to us, it dates back to third millennium BC, when Sumerians were developing the first civilisation in Mesopotamia. It tells the story of a half king, half god, who sets off on his journey in search of immortality.
Two different technique are used through out, one is Plasticine, manipulated frame by frame under the camera. The other is using Glycerine and ink. It is all done by hand and there is no computer-generated imagery as the challenge was to explore how the possibilities and limitations that come with a traditional technique effects the process, the artist and the audience.

image:image.image:title: Living The Room // Dance for Film Preview
image:image.image:caption: This film is a collection of personal and inherently human stories. It begins with an empty 103-year-old house. Six tidy rooms are distinctly empty except for their echoes of life. When the camera settles in the living room the first chapter unfolds; a sextet, a quartet, a trio, two duets, and two solos take place in the living room, bedroom, kitchen, dining room, bathroom, and foyer to bestir some stories of this house and its people. Humans as individuals often get stuck in routine without realization – just as each of the women in this film continue on with their cyclical processes. Sometimes outside forces and relationships can push / pull a person to new places and experiences, but the home, as a place of comfort, ownership, and things, often perpetuates routine. As such, during the film all sense of chronology takes a surreal effect: day and night are switched and order-less, dances will often happen in the background of other pieces, dancers to be in two places at once, and phrases and props are often recurring causing a disconnect to time. Perhaps all of the dances are occurring simultaneously. Perhaps the story is an endless loop.

image:image.image:title: Saudade Es Extranjero
image:image.image:caption:
In Spanish, the word Extranjero can be used interchangeably as ‘foreigner’ or ‘abroad’. For Camilo Sanchez this poetically resembles his feelings of isolation, perplexity and anticipation during his travels as an educational migrant. In Portuguese, the word Saudade can be described as sentiment for a home dearly missed. Held together, these words reflect Camilo’s multivocal experience of having to adapt to two new languages as he studied, as they gradually merged together into one.
Saudade Es Extranjero (Nostalgia is Abroad) is a reflexive exploration into the relationship between travel-based study and the impact of adapting to new languages along the way. A blend of interview, multilingual inter-titles and observational footage, this short documentary follows Camilo, a graduate from Valledupar, Columbia.
Camilo’s educational journey began when he left Columbia for Britain to learn fluent English, before leaving once more to Rio de Janeiro University to begin his masters. Camilo left speaking Spanish and through his travel has learned English and Portuguese fluently in just over a year. In the film, Camilo shares the experience of new languages and their cultures. With the predominant theme of language, the short documentary is divided with a sequence of inter-title monologues, in a form inspired by 1960s Third Cinema films by Fernando Solanas and Octavio Getino. Following the multivocality of Camilo both in person and in interview, the inter-title monologues jump between each language in hope the viewer can experience this as well. The documentary explores diasporic topics such as stereotypes, changing identities and living in a globalised world.

image:image.image:title: The English Lesson
image:image.image:caption: Set ten years in the future, Virgil, an English Language Steward (not teacher) works in a school which achieves 100 hundred per cent success rate. Dressed in a red hooded outfit which suggests his low rank, Virgil has been employed to assist the efficient auto-prof: a computerised English instructor. The machine unleashes utilitarian English classes pitched way below its students’ levels in order to guarantee passes and maintain the school’s reputation. Virgil becomes taken by a student, Marie, who somehow manages to stir him from the drudgery of his apathetic classroom role. He fails one of the student’s test in his class and is ordered by his superiors to amend the score if he wishes to keep his position, taking into account the dwindling jobs market. He is bullied, harassed and intimated into complying with a system that is decayed, corrupted and abusive towards its employees.

image:image.image:title: 93* NOTOUT

He has undergone a pacemaker implantation so his doctor restricted him not to ride bicycle. But he tries to ride bicycle and fails. He got scolding from his son. His son asked neighbour to watch him. But he kept his desire and waiting for his chance to ride bicycle. Also he has another desire to buy a book titled “KADUVULLAI THEDI” ( SEARCHING OF GOD). That book is costly so he doesn’t want spend so much for that book but he loves the book very much. Then one day he decides to buy that book but there is no stock in that shop. So his two desires not fulfilled and feeling sad. If the (G)old man two desires fulfilled or not that is the remaining story of the film.

image:image.image:title: Galore - Hanging Around

Their first-ever music video covers the single "Hanging Around" (from their Living Room Rehearsal Tapes EP) which takes us on a wild ride, and we can safely say that Galore aren't just "hanging around"... they're here to stay!

image:image.image:title: Mulheres em Série - Episódio 5 e Episódio 6
image:image.image:caption: Mulheres em Série: nova série traz mulheres ‘fora dos padrões’ como protagonistas Negras, lésbicas, gordas e transgêneros são personagens ainda raras nas obras audiovisuais mais consumidas atualmente e sua representação é quase inexistente no principal produto do tipo no Brasil: as novelas. Quando aparecem, são tratadas de maneira caricata e jocosa, o que acaba reforçando estereótipos e preconceitos que a nossa sociedade insiste em cultivar. Na contramão dessa tradição, Mulheres em Série traz, já em seu primeiro episódio, a força das mulheres comuns, os dramas reais e os inúmeros preconceitos que essas protagonistas sentem na pele, como milhares de brasileiras todos os dias. Letícia, por exemplo, a mulher transgênero que sonha em ser mãe, interpretada por uma atriz negra e também transgênero, representa os desafios desse grupo ainda marginalizado em nossa sociedade: segundo pesquisa da Transgender Europe, o Brasil é o país que mais mata transexuais no mundo.

image:image.image:title: The Autonomous Era
image:image.image:caption:
Hong Kong has turned over a new leaf since people were awakened by the Umbrella Movement in 2014. The director tries to re-narrate the stories happening in 2010 through a new perspective inspired by Umbrella Movement.
In 2010, together with some friends, Lok actively participated in social movements using online radio broadcast as a medium to spread their ideas. 4 years have passed, Lok is now an organizer of various social movements. With a new identity and more experience, Lok recalls the old days when he participated in the Umbrella Movement.
“The imaginary doesn’t reflect reality. It’s the reality of the reflection.” (Jean-Luc Godard, La Chinoise) Director worked for NGO. With his experience, The Autonomous Era is a cinematic “thesis” analyzing the organizational problem, which deeply affects Hong Kong social movements in these years, from a perspective of a social movement organizer.

Forgetting about circumstances, the outside world and even a painful history, Jacob and Sophia temporarily escape reality. Brought back to a lustful state, the two try and hang on while old but real feelings seep into their oasis and compromise their fragile relationship.

Desperate and without anything to drink, the two “skedaddlers” concoct a dangerous plan to seize the well from its Confederate captors.

image:image.image:title: Round 5
image:image.image:caption: Thai boxing is not just the Thai national sport, but it represents Thai cultural heritage. Most people have the perception that Thai boxing is violent, gambling, and painful especially for kid boxers. This leads to the question “Why do they decide to be a Thai boxer?”, “Why do their parents support them?”, “Are they poor?”, and “Do they have low education?” No one know the answer, except them. Boss is a 13 year old boy from poor’s family who travelled from north east of Thailand to the central city, Bangkok. He was invited from his uncle to start the life on the boxing ring. His flight name is Singsiam Sitcharnsing which means the lion of Siam country (the old of Thailand name) from Sitcharnsing gy. A lot of obstacles are waiting for him, but he never gives up and keeps moving forward. Even though his parents afraid on his painful, but they still support him. Why? Boss has a great dream!!!…

image:image.image:title: Junkie Heaven
image:image.image:caption: Doyle Burkett is an Iraqi war vet who is suffering from PTSD and he also happens to be a junkie willing to do anything to get his fix. After he wakes from a night of using, Doyle is greeted by Alexander, a spiritual being who gives Doyle the choice to turn the tide of an ancient war. Now Doyle must steal an ancient artifact that will tip the scales of good versus evil or walk with Alexander into the afterlife.

image:image.image:title: B-Tweets
image:image.image:caption:
B-Tweets is a short story of two book lovers who date on the pages of their favorite books and how fate directs their love.
While the world is leaning more towards technology, this movie is an attempt to increase the book readers in the society. The story revolves around two book-lovers who date on the pages of their favorite books anonymously. The film not only attempts to bring back the reading habits of the yore to present, it also touches upon the necessities of technology to fetch us what we are looking for.
Meet Gauri and Rounak, book lovers of different kind, as they chart out their story through their favorite books through the magic of words that touch the soul.
Love comes in all forms. Shapes. Sizes. Faces. Sometimes, love comes gift wrapped in a new dress or an old song or a familiar fragrance. Sometimes, love finds its way through words. Inhale the scent of the yellowing pages, exhale the wisdom of their sayings and in-between, simply fall in love with love. Because, sometimes you can fall in love with souls instead of faces. Because, sometimes all love needs is words. Because sometimes, in love even 140 characters are enough!
Why B-Tweets ? B-Tweets is a title that emerged from the essence of the story. We all know about e-mail that comes through electronic mail. B-Tweet is the shortened version of Book Tweet, that acts as a platform for the climax.
What are the main features of the film? The idea is one of the main features of the film – exploring the potential of books. On a lighter note, love and books go hand in hand. In addition to this, the team is a belt of ambitious youngsters with an urge to create creative content.
Why ‘Books’? Because, they hold the potential of being our best friends. Words are not just words, they are a medium to convey something. A book reading habit, if cultivated renders great results in overall development of human beings.

image:image.image:title: Reverie (Kashish)
image:image.image:caption: "We are not human beings on a spiritual journey, but spiritual beings on a human journey.” Dev is a moderately successful assistant director. Aarti is a high-flying advertising professional. They meet at a secluded beach, quite by coincidence, five years after they had a bitter split. The narrative shifts back and forth between the two former lovers’ happier times and the present time. As the conversation intensifies, dormant feelings rise to the surface and deep wounds are revisited… Kashish is an intense, passionate love story between two very different characters who find their true selves over a single conversation.

image:image.image:title: NO PAIN
image:image.image:caption: It´s a music video, from the spanish band Mürfila. This video was shot in August 2015 in USA, a real road movie set in several American states: from Virginia Beach to the West Coast. It´s an iconic journey of 8000 kilometers that crosses the most emblematic places of this country: the Grand Canyon, Monument Valley, the Park of the Sequoias, or cities like Los Angeles, Las Vegas or Seattle ... NO PAIN is a tribute to everything that fascinates the American world: its deserts, its parks, neon cities, remote villages, endless highways, motels ... And could not miss the film references, as the film True Romance, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, Drive, Natural Born Killers ... There are also musical references, as the bridge that Kurt Cobain used to kill his time as a teenager in Aberdeen, now full of painted people worldwide. Bridge talking Nirvana song "Something in the Way". NO PAIN is a journey, a roadtrip all the way, a cocktail of emotions, love and freedom.

The ability to see the paranormal world is what sets Jeremiah apart from those around him. So he begins his journey continually seeking spiritual help as a weapon to fight the battle against evil.

image:image.image:title: Breath of Heaven Short (Music) Film
image:image.image:caption:
As I began the arrangement of "Breath of Heaven" I wanted to share a story from a moment of my life. While filming in Santorini, Greece I recreated a chapter in my journey where my mother was born and raised in Santorini, Greece. Each note of the music is a word of a vivid story being reborn and told again in a poetic and musical expression. A journey of shattered dreams, new dreams, rediscovering a new chapter in life with God's hopes and promises.
Thank you to everyone who made this possible and has been part of this creative journey.
May you be inspired! ~Sealed with a Melody Thespina

image:image.image:title: A' mes amours
image:image.image:caption: This film originated from my heart as a way to encounter myself. I needed a place where I could listen to myself. No need to say this wasn’t the best project to be presented to any producer, so I made my choice: fixed DSLR camera and two Nikon lenses from the seventies. I always shoot in order to realize who am I: here hence the camera must be fixed as I need contemplation and separation. I spent many years identifying myself in everything and now I want to breathe more deeply. The paucity of the means in my availability has been transformed from limit to identity of this film: having just a few things to take care of, forced me to open my eyes wider and to look for the best view angle in relation to space, light and history. Paucity has also been an asset so far as this is film about our ability to look at things simply and about the importance of our point of view on life; our point of view can turn life good or bad, regardless of what’s actually going on. In the end, this film is a note of this stage of my journey. This film is a hug to my past, my present and to all the love around me.

image:image.image:title: BLACK
image:image.image:caption: EN/ Short fashion film is about Michaela Capkova’s collection BLACK., which is based on typical czech fabric "kanafas", which was used on curtains, tablecloths, duvets, blankets etc. in historical czech cottages and more typically for women's skirts. Author of the fashion collection Michaela Capková (MIM), using this material to make men's collection, which is inspired by men's working clothes from early 20th century and the life of craftsmen as well. These clothes were captured by German midwar photographer August Sander. It is known that Sander's photos are Yamamoto's inspiration. The main idea of this collection is therefore connection of work clothes, the typical czech fabric kanafas (and its use in di ferent contexts) and the preservation of the authenticity in connection to the Yamamoto's approach. In collection author uses leather and new technical material, too. Michaela would like to make present casual menswear from typical work clothes. FASHION DESIGN: michaelacapkova.com VIDEO: Martin Cenkl MUSIC: Martin Cenkl PHOTO: Tereza Ondrušková MODEL: Vít?zslav Šichta? 2015

image:image.image:title: Nourhane, a child's dream
image:image.image:caption: Nourhane was a singer and actress in the 1940s, 50s, and 60s. She put a sudden end to her career and retreated away from the stage in the mid-60s. From that point on, she never spoke about her past, nor did she sing. Her grand-daughter goes into the world of filmmaking and at the age of 21 discovers her grandmother's past. From that point on, she is on a quest to find out as much as possible about her grandmother's career and life, and particularly about why her grandmother left a career at its height. Layers and layers of stories emerge through interviews, voice-overs, drawings, and animated sequences in a film centered around passion, and love.

image:image.image:title: Melpomene Music Video
image:image.image:caption:
Melpomene illustrates God's redemptive declaration. Forced to leave behind the dreams of her youth, Melpomene embarked into uncharted lands.
Just when you realize that this journey is beyond your strength, you find yourself walking into the light of truth that lights a path onto the road to freedom allowing redemption to take place. The only road that leads HOME.
Each of us has a story to write. Don't let the pages of your story collect dust. Be a brave voice, be obedient and faithful to your calling, even when it doesn't make sense. When you see your world falling apart, at the end of a prayer is a new beginning. The birth of a dream. The beginning of a miracle. The fulfillment of a promise. The beginning of things falling into place as you are being rescued from the shadows that have kept your God given dreams, destiny and purpose in bondage.
Prayer gives us the power to carry on. It may not change circumstances, but it changes us and gives us the strength to move forward. I wonder if Isaiah was speaking about Tamar, Rahab, Ruth or Bathsheba when he was writing the book of Isaiah 54:4-8 ages ago.
Nothing is ever wasted. God's grace can redeem and restore what was once lost.

image:image.image:title: WALK IN INTERVIEW
image:image.image:caption:
Aaditya Rane is a hard working and kind hearted middle class boy. He has been preparing for an Interview very passionalty which is sheduled at 11am next day. His objective is to crack the interview at any cost. While making his way through daily routines and busy city life when almost he is about to reach at the interview, something unexpected happens . Aditya spots an innocent little girl in the middle of road near a temple begging for help. Aditya observes that no one is willing to help her...
Will aditya help the little girl or give priority to his interview ?
Walk in Interview is a short film which shows how busy our lives get in a day to day life and why it is important to be kind always .

image:image.image:title: Long live the art!

image:image.image:title: Leopard Do Not Bite
image:image.image:caption: Gomari, a village girl slips out of a sermon at the temple and into the thick jungle to frolic with her lover but they both fall prey to a leopard. People in the nearby village listen to the monk for advice, except the hunter who lives in the jungle. The hunter provides the village with meat even though he is a vegetarian. It is the month of Vesak and the people from the nearby village plan to observe the precepts on Vesak full moon day. The hunter knows what happened to Gomari and entreats the Monk to cancel his scheduled program but the monk refuses and leads such matters to fate. The hunter, who never kills except as food for people, is forced to contemplate acting pre-emptively and kill the leopard even though it goes against his principles.

image:image.image:title: Narayana Saw Me
image:image.image:caption: ‘Narayana Saw me’ is titled, stimulated by the real name of ‘Pranaya Raja’ Dr.Srinath. i.e., ‘Narayan Swamy’ which is the name of the character too in this film whose best friend is his Radio & his Umbrella. This film depicts how a 70 year old man leads his life when he doesn’t get attention from his friends or family and how he recollects his childhood when he meets a kid. After a wonderfull bonding & time spent together, Kid goes missing. Narayana Swamy looks for his innocence & the missing kid. Where did the Kid disappear! Climax says it all.

image:image.image:title: FADING Official Trailer
image:image.image:caption: On April 18, 1945, the photographer Robert Capa took several pictures of the American Division in a house in Leipzig during the liberation from the Nazis. The series was published in Life Magazine and became famously known as the "Last Man to Die". From Capa’s point of view and shot on the original site with origninal sounds, this film reconstructs the last minutes of U.S. soldier Raymond J. Bowman's life just before he was shot and subsequently photographed by Capa.

image:image.image:title: Empty Tables. A Tribute To Frank Sinatra
image:image.image:caption: That was the last song Johnny Mercer wrote. He was a close friend of Sinatra and, of course, he wrote it for him. The lyrics are devastating: One man at the end of a career of success feels alone and he only miss a talk, a dinner with a woman. But he is talking to empty tables, there is nobody there to listen to him. The singer in the video, Jordi Rabascall, is a follower of Sinatra since his beginning as an electronic musician. I thought the best way to do a video of Empty Tables it was transforming Jordi in a ghost. But we need an old Mercer, an old Sinatra, an old Jordi. So we ask to the amazing jazz piano player Pere Ferré to join us in this adventure. So he is the Mercer-Sinatra looking for his own soul, a soul made when he was a young musician blind for Las Vegas lights...

image:image.image:title: The Bat Faced Boy
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: MIN t - Goodbye To The Lullaby
image:image.image:caption: Shy and introvert girl must face inner city dangers, her very own fears and anxieties. To conquer them, she must embrace dark side of her personality and let it take control.

image:image.image:title: The Winged One
image:image.image:caption:

An Armenian Student Short Film released in 2016. Based on a short story by Gabriel García Márquez. IMDb - imdb.com/title/tt5699460/

image:image.image:title: G.C KI ISSI TISSI
image:image.image:caption: The film is set in a small town situated in Haryana, India. Gheesa Chand has been living his ordinary daily routine life . But sudden changes occur when an alteration of government policy impacts his life and makes it difficult for him to survive. Added to this, is Gheesa’s cunning uncle, who has hired two goons to help him murder his oblivious nephew. A comment on various social issues, Gheesa handles the situation with humour and music.

image:image.image:title: SITA
image:image.image:caption: According to Indian mythologies, women are considered to be the center of immense energy and power. At the same time women have been a target of social evils and objects of oppression. Sita is a provocative short film, revolving around the issue of rape in the modern world. The protagonist is about to be attacked by three men for rape and what she does, depicts a deep universal meaning and significance. Sita is inspired by Ramayana, where mother Sita is believed to be born out of the Earth and after a life of displeasure and suffering, she chose to merge with the Earth. The laxman rekha drawn by her brother -in- law was to protect her from any evil. Despite that she was taken away by Ravana, the villian in the story. Sita is a representative for all women out there who have the blessing of nature to procreate, the power to give birth to a new entity in the world. A mother's womb is a symbol of universal power that a woman possesses. The crime against women such as rape is a disrespect of this universal energy which human beings are bound to protect and preserve.

image:image.image:title: Reward for catching the wanted murderer
image:image.image:caption: A murderer had to steal and murder for survival. One day he went to a bakery for stealing bread. At the moment he was stealing some bread, the baker saw him and gave him a piece of bread. This kindness of the baker had a big influence on the murderer and he decided to surrender to police.

image:image.image:title: Rigor Mortis
image:image.image:caption: 'Rigor Mortis' is a straight story portrayed in a twisted manner. With degeneration of morals and values, the present day Indian society no longer remains a 'home sweet home' for the women. Avimanyu has a strange psychology.His romantic dreams are hijacked by nightmares of losing his ladylove. But destiny has something else in store for him.

image:image.image:title: INTOLERANCE
image:image.image:caption: Story of a side actor who plays a negative rolls in mythological TV serials. He is a intolerable guy. One day he gets the supernatural power and he misuses it. The reactions he gets against his intolerable behaviour from different personalities like asst. director, girl child and from young girl is the soul of the script.

image:image.image:title: Cuando el naranjo despierte
image:image.image:caption: SPANISH: En un pequeño pueblo ubicado a 200km al norte de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires los inviernos son duros y la pobreza arrecia. Allí, los niños abandonan la escuela y se presentan a trabajar en los campos de naranjos, recolectando la fruta bajo las órdenes de un insensible capataz que los explota. Uno de ellos es Ángel, de 14 años, quien, junto a sus hermanos menores, se ve obligado a aportar al sustento de su familia, que está al borde de la desintegración. Ángel mantiene una relación tensa con su padre que no concibe ningún otro futuro para sus hijos más allá del campo de naranjos. Mientras, su madre guarda silencio. En este pueblo, apartado del mundo, los chicos pierden su infancia y el futuro se desvanece en el aire. Pero un día Ángel decide escapar de esta realidad asfixiante y huye a la ciudad detrás de su gran sueño: ser jugador de fútbol. ENGLISH: In a Small Town far from the City of Buenos Aires, Children working in a field of orange. Childhood in a labor camp plunged into poverty as a daily emergency and a father who doesn’t see beyond this field, these are the reasons to think where are the dreams, where is the right to dream of a child. Angel escape to the the city follow his dream, become a player soccer...

image:image.image:title: Insolation
image:image.image:caption: When the world is in the dark all year long, the only sunny day is an important event. This day is tomorrow. Thousands of people gather on the beach, waiting to live this day together…

image:image.image:title: Relationship Status : Complicated
image:image.image:caption: Michael has asked Anita to help him study but he has other hings on his mind. Meanwhile Anita is trying to figure out her current relationship.

image:image.image:title: Life's a Drag
image:image.image:caption: Drag Queen Ruben and his sister live together. Ruben tries to keep life fun but life can be a bit of a drag

image:image.image:title: Nós/Us
image:image.image:caption: Focused on the delicacy and difficulties of falling in love with someone of the same gender, we follow Eleanor when her life turns into a different direction as she meets Julia, an innocent girl who wakes every day happy to be living another day.

image:image.image:title: Where Are We going?

image:image.image:title: Fixated
image:image.image:caption: Fixated is a Story about a Stamp Collector.... He is Fixated..... Watch this film to know how far he can go to get a rare stamp for his collection.

image:image.image:title: Not Meant to Understand
image:image.image:caption: "Not Meant To Understand", a short film by Anjani Pandey, is a slice of life about a couple, married for more than forty years. They have enjoyed a strong physical relationship, as well as many financial successful ventures, always generously working to help their community. Suddenly, the wife is struck by the reality that she herself is too old to ever have a child. She questions the decision which she and her husband made years ago to be child free. They are faced with a past decision that now threatens the very essence of their relationship.

image:image.image:title: KALICHAAT OFFICIAL TRAILER
image:image.image:caption:
Kalichaat, the hard black rock, symbolically represents the sum total of infinite hurdles a farmer in India face in hopes of making his and his family's life better. It also translates into a labyrinth of complex government procedures and a system promoting hopelessness among the provider of society – The Farmer.
The story revolves around Sitaram, a farmer like many other in central India, with less than limited means. Trying hard to meet ends and provide for his family the basics of life. The problem, repeatedly failing monsoon, the lifeline of Indian farmers, making his land yield nothing but weed despite him doing all he can. His family of 5, including his wife, two sons, and a daughter suffers along.
Sitaram's efforts to quench the thirst of his land lead him try and dig a well in his land. The hard sound of mattock hitting the dreadful black rock – Kalichaat – is nothing but a disaster, as cracking Kalichaat and reaching water beneath will require means beyond his approach. But to match adversities with his will, he approaches the local bank specifically established to meet the needs of farmers, only to realize that getting help there is even complex than breaking Kalichaat.
In this state of despair, the showering water coming out of a tubewell drilling at his village makes him wonder why can't he have one at his land. A hope for him, perceived a gamble by many, including his wife. Again the seemingly never ending tryst with authorities and loan sharks, religious gurus, while keeping his family hopeful for a better future, begins.
Pledging the very land he wanted water for, tubewell drilling starts. One after another, attempts fail, land shrinks and hopes die. What's left is a question on our conscience as a society and as a system, as to why we let the actual breadwinner die in pursuit of a better life.

image:image.image:title: H..
image:image.image:caption: H.. is a short film which deals about sleep hallucination

image:image.image:title: TNP - Mountain
image:image.image:caption: This music video explores the use of Public domain footage and old video formats to achieve the feeling of Stream of Consciousness. The Television as a reflex of our inner thoughts.

image:image.image:title: Reflection Teaser 2
image:image.image:caption:
The story shot in a completely different way revolves around the life of an innocent young girl who lives with her brother & their grandfather, a simple glassmaker, in their small home. Caught between a transition of T.V culture and tradition the young girl is drawn toward the charms of an older boy. Their lives are plunged into the ethos of a grim world by a gruesome and unfortunate incident and like a ripple it plays itself to the finish until only two remain as mere spectators to the bad dream..
Director Biography

image:image.image:title: Acacia
image:image.image:caption:
12 Years after the fall of the Resistance and the occupying Nocturi, the Empire now dominate Earth. Culling every human on site. All resistant Nocturi who deny the Empire are destroyed and made martyrs. Lt Rein Ryder and Acacia Dorn's every attempt at reforming cells of Resistance are destroyed by the Empire, leaving the Resistance powerless.
All hope is lost, until now...
In silence and in the shadows, the new Government and Military forms. Led by General Lance Hurley, Air to the Royal Australian Army and leader of the greatest military revolution in the history of Earth. The Resistance are led with a devastating power, embracing the human and Nocturi alliance to win the 1000 year war, forming a never before seen world peace and harmony. Lance Hurley will take the throne of planet Earths first and only world leader.
The film Acacia has been created female heavy and will push the boundaries of the all to familiar never ending battle for dominance, power and leadership in trying times when leadership is needed. In this particular time in history the woman take the stage and lead with true conviction, they are 'The Fire Leaders of the Resistance’. No empathy, no excuses, no problems. Their cause, total eradication of the Nocturi species and anyone obstructing this ideal. These woman are Heroines, they are both feared and loved by the people. When Acacia, Rein and Kamera are around, you better not be.
Introducing more characters on the way old and new. Kerion and his new love interest - Lt. Hope Marshal. Brigadier Harry Stone and his love Interest - Lt. Rein Ryder. And Drake - Leader of the alliance's Nocturi element.

image:image.image:title: Natural Gifts
image:image.image:caption: Joe Ives of the Port Gamble S'Klallam Tribe shares a story that his Grandmother shared with him. With the help of their Spirit Guardians the Raven and the Bear, two men go fishing for Salmon and finally share a meal

Pipe Dream-(A fanciful hope)
Movie revolves around a young boy. showing his whole one day where he talks meet another person and he is in love with All of the end of the day.it's seems to be a delusion. A pleasant Pipe Dream Just as no one can be forced into belief, So no one can be forced into unbelief. - Sigmund freud

According to Indian mythologies, women are considered to be the center of immense energy and power. At the same time women have been a target of social evils and objects of oppression. Sita is a provocative short film, revolving around the issue of rape in the modern world. The protagonist is about to be attacked by three men for rape and what she does, depicts a deep universal meaning and significance. Sita is inspired by Ramayana, where mother Sita is believed to be born out of the Earth and after a life of displeasure and suffering, she chose to merge with the Earth. The laxman rekha drawn by her brother -in- law was to protect her from any evil. Despite that she was taken away by Ravana, the villian in the story. Sita is a representative for all women out there who have the blessing of nature to procreate, the power to give birth to a new entity in the world. A mother's womb is a symbol of universal power that a woman possesses. The crime against women such as rape is a disrespect of this universal energy which human beings are bound to protect and preserve.

image:image.image:title: CAPRICIILE FORTUNEI (The Whims of Fortune) a short story of Roman Empire legionary in Dacia
image:image.image:caption:
Feel free to watch and distribute it! http://cinema-documentar.ro/, http://novapolaris.ro/ .Cu sprijinul Asociatiei Culturale pentru Istorie Vie - Alba Iulia. Sinopsis: "In drumul sau spre Apulum, un soldat roman din legiunile cantonate in Dacia, isi disputa viata dupa mofturile schimbatoarei zeite a norocului, Fortuna." Dialogurile sunt in limba latina. -o critica a filmului in limba engleza, de catre Rob Cain: http://www.ancientromerefocused.org/2...” http://livehistoryfans.com/roman-cons... “Capriciile Fortunei” este cel mai recent film realizat de Asociatia Nova Polaris, Sibiu. Un scurt-metraj istoric, de fictiune, cu actiunea plasata in antichitatea romana de pe cuprinsul fostei provincii Dacia. Am incercat prin acest film-pilot, la o scara mai mica, sa demonstram ca filmul istoric romanesc ne este posibil. Pe viitor, cu un suport financiar adecvat, cu sprijinul trupelor de reenactori din Romania si al autoritatilor administrative locale sau muzeale, speram sa putem realiza si un film de lungmetraj istoric, cu mijloace si inspiratie moderna, pe care publicul indragostit de faimoasele conflicte “daco-romane” sa il indrageasca. Depinde de noi, cei implicati in mediul cinematografic sau istoric si de deschiderea afisata de cei cu posibilitati, ca acest film sa existe in urmatorii ani si sa nu ramana doar un vis…
With the support of The Cultural Association for Living History (Alba Iulia -Romania) Select 4k quality for best youtube viewing experience. Synopsis " On his way Apulum, a soldier of the Roman legions displaced in Dacia is struggling for his life after the fads of capricious Fortune, the goddess of luck." Latin language dialogues.
CAST Longinus - NICU ARDELEANU Mela - CIPRIAN DOBRA Severus - MARIUS ARDELEANU written & directed by OCTAVIAN REPEDE camera: cam 1 (crane, steady, slider) COSMIN NICA, TUDOR PORUMB cam 2 OCTAVIAN REPEDE cam 3 OLIMPIA TODEA video edit: OCTAVIAN REPEDE sound&boom operator: TUDOR PORUMB voice FX: CAMIKU visual FX : LAUREN?IU CURTIC?PEAN Historical reenactment coordonator: TUDOR RO?U Latin translator: CRISTIAN GHI?? Music: "Long Winter" by Pitx (C.C.) "Space_Intro" by Karstenholymoly (C.C) Special thanks: IRINA VLAD, ALEXANDRU REPEDE
În mitologia roman?, Fortuna (greac? -- echivalent Tyche) era personificarea norocului, in religia romana. Ea putea aduce fie noroc sau ghinion. Apulum a fost un castru în provincia roman? Dacia într sec.II ?i 4 d.Hr., situat ast?zi in centrul orasului Alba-Iulia, Romania. Este cel mai mare castru roman situat în România, ocupând 37,5 hectare (93 acri) (750 x 500 m2).
Fortuna (Latin: Fort?na, equivalent to the Greek goddess Tyche) was the goddess of fortune and personification of luck in Roman religion. She might bring good or bad luck. Apulum was a fort in the Roman province of Dacia in the 2nd and 4th centuries AD, located in today's Alba-Iulia, Romania.It is the largest castrum located in Romania, occupying 37.5 hectares (93 acres) (750 x 500 m2).

image:image.image:caption: an ancient alien love story.

image:image.image:title: PAHAL AWARD WINNER SHORT FILM
image:image.image:caption: Story of a new film maker’s struggle to bring forth his creations in front of the world. Taking a cue from the practical world of film making where producers look for formula based stories which guarantees them an assured return on investment. The story is about a director named Abhirup Mitra whose initiative to make movies on good stories does not find any producers. Frustrated by his efforts going wasted, Abhirup destroys most of his writings. Sometimes later a reporter named Satarupa discovers Abhirup’s stories in a cover diary which is found in a book store. This reporter brings forth the talent of Abhirup in front of the world.

image:image.image:title: The Day After Ganpati Visarjan
image:image.image:caption: As we look back at the beginning of the tradition of celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi, we learn that the first idols for this day were made from the wet clay from the local rivers and lakes. The day after Chaturthi celebrations, these idols were immersed in the same lake. Now, times have changed and so have the styles of preparation. Local clubs and communities started hosting mass pujas to commemorate Ganesh festival. Today, since there is competitive nature amongst all these local clubs to make the best of the idols and win awards, the old concept of clay idols started vanishing. The artisans of the recent times who make Ganesh idols use Plaster of Paris and other toxic bright Colors, which are very harmful and make the waters toxic and in consumable for a long time.

image:image.image:title: At Risk
image:image.image:caption: The story is based on the present social happenings which revolves around two teenagers who bunk the class and expend their time in the park. They decides to go to their friend's home where the girl acts nonchalant but actually she is aroused.

image:image.image:title: At Risk
image:image.image:caption: The story is based on the present social happenings which revolves around two teenagers who bunk the class and expend their time in the park. They decides to go to their friend's home where the girl acts nonchalant but actually she is aroused.

image:image.image:title: The Eternal Flame of Truth
image:image.image:caption:
This film depicts the belief that if we choose to accept the truth within- the introspection, we do face the light of the truth and begin to understand and grow (develop ourselves). We also have a choice of not doing so, in that scenario we choose to go back into darkness and could possibly end up living a life of ignorance. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
All that matters in this life, on this planet that we share with other living beings- is the constant burning of the eternal flame of truth. And, where can one discover this ever-glowing flame of Truth? Within us, within all living beings! We are all connected by the precious thread of life. Life that manifests itself, in the compassion and kindness that we feel for one and all. To love oneself first and foremost, and then share it with the rest of the world. One of the ways to keep this flame of truth not lose it's glow is by respecting all living beings and to accept them for their individuality- for respect given is respect earned. Love, respect and accept one and all the way they are for everything that is in nature is natural. We are all love and respect worthy. If we want to discover and keep in touch with the inner flame of truth, keep it glowing forever then we would have to learn to love without prejudices, be more 'giving' and believe in the power of Love.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Abhinav Vats Schamber. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Self created film. Music courtesy- Belief/Silent Partner.

image:image.image:title: Semper Est Sperare
image:image.image:caption: A comparative portrayal of the hardships and realities of living with a mental illness on both sides of the pond. Real stories, of real people, who happen to suffer with a mental illness. This film explores the stigma, discrimination, prejudice and trivialisation faced by those who carry such a label. There is always hope that as more people share the brutal realities of coping with a mental illness, that those living in fear or without hope may find the help or treatment they so desperately need, and that finally, public opinion of mental health will sway from the stereotypical and the reductive, towards the empathetic and the supportive, it really is time this changed.

image:image.image:title: THERAFTER
image:image.image:caption: March 11th 2011, the biggest earthquake in 1,000 years hit Japan. Earthquake, Tsunami, Nuclear Power Plant, the chaos of information - Japan had to deal with all those that they have never experienced before. Journalist Daisuke Tsuda visited disaster area more than 40 times, spreading the information by his unique way, using twitter, USTREAM, various social media networks. People who lost their families, lost their lifelines, their houses, everything was drawn by Tsunami. Lots of problems are found during interviewing people who are all dealing with these difficult issues. This documentary was shot in 2012, 11 month after the quake, visiting same people again, driving up north from Tokyo to Aomori. Then Tsuda founds... The real Japan in 2012 through one journalist eyes.gathering the little voices from the ordinary people. This is the 2015 Re-editing version

image:image.image:title: Everything Will Be Okay
image:image.image:caption: Drama/Thriller "Everything Will Be Okay" follows the story of 17-year-old, Eve Goldman, who is living in rural Georgia with her abusive father. Ten years ago, her mother left after an argument with Eve's dad and never came back. After Eve reaches the limit of her father's abuse, there is a conflict and she ends up running from the police. Fearing the worst she escapes from her town to find the place her mother always wrote about in her journal, Cloudland Canyon. Along the way she learns how to live life from the people she meets...until reality catches up.

image:image.image:title: Something's Wrong with Norman Tulley
image:image.image:caption: Norman Tulley is a man who never really grew up; still living with his mother, he spends his days full of anxiety and worry over imagined symptoms of disease. After getting an earful from a fed up physician, he must decide if he will change his ways or seek out medical help when the symptoms all return.

image:image.image:title: Happy Thighs
image:image.image:caption: Happy Thighs is an animated documentary about womyn’s bodies and the things we keep hidden because they do not conform to mainstream expectations. A stream of female identifying voices tell stories about their bodies and themselves, which, through crude humor and serious meditations, reveal a larger truth about the female experience.

image:image.image:title: ...FIRE AASA JAYE
image:image.image:caption: Cervical cancer is a major killing disease in India. But breast cancer has overtaken cervical cancer as the most common and deadly killing disease of the new era. One among 28 women in India is likely to develop breast cancer during her life span. Presently, breast cancer is more common in young generation and 50% of the cases are in the age group of 25 to 50 years. There would be 1, 55,000 new cases of breast cancer at the end of 2015. About 76,000 women in India are supposed to die due this fatal disease. A fashion designer of Kolkata was affected by breast cancer. Started fighting against this disease and found out some reason why breast cancer seems irresistible in the rural areas of India. How she comes back? Did she win the battle finally? - S

image:image.image:title: Straight From The Pole
image:image.image:caption: Straight From The Pole is a fun, light-hearted short film. It tells the story of Santa Claus, who's become an alcoholic, as he tries to escape from a rehab center for vampires, witches and leprechauns which he's been committed to!

image:image.image:title: THE THRONE

A story of a Prince's greed and desire to satisfy His thirst for power at the expense of His people. The movie is an experimental movie made 100% using the chroma key technology and animation by Jibril Mailafia.

image:image.image:title: Relationshit

image:image.image:title: Carousel Hill
image:image.image:caption: Harold recollects a trip he once took to Carousel Hill. Not much happens until everything happens. This miniature epic is about friendships, tourist traps, the inevitable and cruel passage of time, and pears.

image:image.image:title: I Servi Del Silenzio - The Slave Of Silence
image:image.image:caption: Victor and his team of secret agents have arrested an important mafia man in Barcelona and interrogates him with unorthodox methods. Through the use of a particular graphic technique (like a comic in motion), The Slave Of Silence reveals all the ambiguity of violence and the ethic of honor. The short film by noir mood, directed and painted by Francesco Fracchioni and scored by the winner of the "Los Angeles Music Award" Stefano Gargiulo, is inspired by the book I Servi Del Silenzio written by Marino Fracchioni and introduces us to the first events of the novel. To complete this short, Francesco Fracchioni needed almost a year of work.

image:image.image:title: Turn The Light On
image:image.image:caption: What happens when you turn your light of?

image:image.image:title: Obsessed
image:image.image:caption: A short film about a highly obsessive girl who becomes fixated with solving a rubik’s cube after being teased by her Inner Demon.

image:image.image:title: Shotgun Mythos Pilot
image:image.image:caption: Cynical private investigator Joss Washburn has seen the worst that humanity has to offer, and thinks that nothing can surprise him. But a simple missing persons case changes all of that, as Joss finds himself in the middle of a struggle that has gone on for millennia.

image:image.image:title: These Walls We Bulid
image:image.image:caption: I made this video back in 2014 to contribute to breaking of the stigma associated with the post-traumatic stress following child abuse and maybe help those struggling with it to know that there is hope out there. Not many people know about this matter, but it does exist, and we all have to do our share in ending it. In my animation, you follow a young boy who grew up in a violent home and how this lead him to isolate himself from the world around him, not being able to trust anyone. In the end, he manages to break through the walls he built.

image:image.image:title: David Barnes
image:image.image:caption: A patient snaps and finally reveals to his therapist how he deals with the thoughts in his head, leaving her in shock.

image:image.image:title: The Pony No One Could Ride

image:image.image:title: A Movie Set
image:image.image:caption: A reporter with great ambitions is constantly assigned to cover small local stories that are nothing more than silly events disguised as news for ratings sake. His professional goal to cover big news like wars gets further away from him when his producer assigns him to report on a student feature film that cast a faded movie star from the eighties trying a comeback. This might be the last chance for the movie star to restart his career, because his wild life style during the eighties impacted his memory and casting possibilities. As the reporter watches the making off video and interviews everyone on the set, his frustration with the self-involved film students can't be surpassed by any new assignment until his producer calls again.

image:image.image:title: Deep in the Heart of Texting
Entropy: The Executioner Judge
image:image.image:caption: José despierta en un mundo posterior a la tierra pero anterior al cielo, infierno o purgatorio sin haber muerto. Allí un Juez decide el destino final de cada individuo. El proceso de sentencia es lento y conlleva varios pasos burocráticos. En su vida pasada José sufre de un paro cardíaco lo cual lo lleva a un desmayo. Llegando al final se descubre que la sentencia que era para José le corresponde a la misma persona pero de un universo paralelo. Dicha persona es un científico astrónomo el cual se suicida en busca de respuestas sobre la ciencia. Finalmente José abre los ojos.

image:image.image:title: Love The Original Way
image:image.image:caption: With all the love and lust in the air, we owe a majority of credibility to online dating apps. So many couples have formulated a relationship and now even marriages have concluded from online dating as well. With that being said, Keldamuzik produced her first short film called “Love The Original Way”, directed by Hassan Leo of Elmore films. The 15 minute short film displays a young college graduate by the name of Sissy who surrounds herself by her two gossiping girlfriends friends Milan and Laudi who encourage her to try a dating app. Both characters demonstrate how young women today face troubles of finding the love of their life. Sissy as a college graduate has had problems with drug and alcohol addiction and keeping a current job, therefore she turned to online dating and rehab at the same time to put her life into perspective. Once she found out that the same guy she has been conversing with on the dating app, sits adjacent from her in alcohol rehab, they fell in love instantly.

image:image.image:title: PRIMARY COLORS - (HD Short Film)

Navigating a volatile world of cultural differences and angst, Kasdan endures an emotional odyssey from his lonely loft to the shrine of the sun in search of an elusive place called home.

image:image.image:title: ME - The movie
image:image.image:caption: "ME" is a film that portrays one of the major negative realities that many families have to tolerate ... The alcoholism of the man of the house. Gabriel is a family man, a great man, has a beautiful wife, a movie star kid, a perfect family ... until his first drink cup makes him an unrecognizable man, cold, reckoner and killer. After losing everything he built, today your life is full of lies. Every day, after waking up, Gabriel practicing their activities, over and over, living alone in her big house in the company of only the pictures of his wife and son. Your exercise routine, drugs and booze, makes him live outside of reality. But everything he does has a purpose. Something he keeps within it and what motivates you to continue to the end. image:image.image:title: Ghost Walk: The Farm
image:image.image:caption: The award-winning film "Ghost Walk: The Farm"; based on Actual Events. Also known internally as 'haunted honeymoon'. A young couple is stranded in an old farm-house they've been loaned for their honeymoon. Distribution from Continuum Motion Pictures & MCTV. Starring John Chiara, and introducing Leya Siri. Best Short Film - Horror Trophy, Indie Gathering International Film Festival (2012) 12 Festival "Official Selections" through January 2016. Latest: International Filmmaker Festival of World Cinema, London, UK; where it is also nominated for 3 film awards. Opening night screening at Cedar Lee Theatre, Cleveland, Ohio. Directed and edited by Steve Olander. Also nominated for "Best Cinematography". Notable reviews: "CHECK OUT THIS TRAILER!!! IF U LIKE THIS PROMO DAMN U ARE GOING TO GO CRAZY FOR THE SUSPENSE & THE ENDING THAT GHOST WALK HAS CONJURED UP IN THIS TERROR-IFIC SCREEN SCREAM TALE! I saw it complete--& I barely lived thru the increase in blood pressure that it gave me!" - John Carpenter, Film Historian "The Farm is brilliant scary!" - Joe Quintanilla, Producer/Celebrity Liaison "Pretty damn good!" - Gruesome Hertzog Podcast "A roller coaster ride into the depths of hell." - Candy O'Donnell Radio Show " I LOVED THE SETTING I LOVED THE OLD FARM HOUSE~ HERE IN WISCONSIN WE HAVE TONS OF OLD FARM HOUSES AND AS I WATCHED I COULD ALMOST SMELL THE ATMOSPHERE FROM THE OLD WOOD IN THE BARN TO THE RAIN " - Lynn Doornbosch

image:image.image:title: Kenopsia
image:image.image:caption:
A student finds himself trapped in the halls of his high school and terrorized by someone eerily familiar.
Kenopsia was filmed by the Desert Christian High School Digital Media Production class as a final project for the 2015-2016 school year. The film was shot on a Canon T5i and an iPhone 6s Plus. While most of the film was shot with the Canon 18-135mm kit lens, the dreamy, soft-focus shots were captured with a Lensbaby Spark. Sound was captured with a Røde VideoMic Pro and a Zoom H4n. The film was edited on DaVinci Resolve 12 and Adobe Premier CC, with all of the color correction and effects editing done on DaVinci Resolve 12.
This 3 minute cut was originally created for the My Røde Reel 2016 film competition.

image:image.image:title: Living with Lyme Disease
image:image.image:caption: Trailer: This documentary is the compelling story of people affected by Lyme disease in Ireland. Lyme disease, also known as Lyme borreliosis, is an infectious disease caused by bacteria of the Borrelia type. Lyme disease is a bacterial infection typically transmitted through the bite of an infected tick. It is one of the fastest growing infectious diseases in the world.

image:image.image:title: Relentless
image:image.image:caption: A career criminal named Steven Mitchell infiltrates the city police department and takes advantage of his authority to only report back to his syndicate bosses with the departments information and strategies against city crime. As Mitchell tries to not give up his cover, his long time crime fighter partner Detective Torres begins to second guess Steven's true integrity to the law.

image:image.image:title: Yala, the forbidden harangue
image:image.image:caption:
The 60s… The generational rebellion began to spread throughout the world.
In Mendoza, the thinker Mario Rodriguez Cobos (known as SILO) is dedicated to form study groups.
In 1965, a group of young people (none of them older than 30 years), led by Silo, travel to the province of Jujuy, northern Argentina, to make a withdrawal of self-knowledge in the Arenal. They are arrested by the military dictatorship.
Then the group is installed on a wild and isolated area. A place known as Yala. They perform work with care centers, levels of consciousness, overcoming suffering, meaninglessness, and many others, in the context of the pursuit of awakening.
On July 20, 1969, Silo tries to give a speech in Yala, to lift the continent out of its lethargy and lead the process of spiritual revolution was coming. The Catholic Church, the de facto government and the military forces prevented the act. Since then, the fact is known as "The Forbidden Arenga".
Today, different groups of Siloists approach Yala to remember and commemorate that forbidden harangue.

image:image.image:title: Le Constructeur de Malheur
image:image.image:caption: The 3D­animated short "Le constructeur de Malheur" shows the life of a french inventor in the beginning of the 20th century. He'd like to fullfill his personal dream of flying but he fails again and again.

image:image.image:title: Coffee Table
image:image.image:caption: Thomas is a furniture designer who has a problem. He has no ideas. Nothing. He’s been bound by seemingly necessary restrictions for his entire working life and is finding them, restricting. To be successful he may have to do nothing.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: For my people
image:image.image:caption: "PA MI GENTE" é o primeiro videoclipe solo do rapper colombiano Alomia MC que, após rodar por toda a América Latina, encontrou nas ruas da Baixada Santista uma oportunidade de mostrar seu trabalho. Neste videoclipe com artes de docudrama, acompanhamos a constante busca do músico por um lugar em que possa sentir-se parte de um todo, enxergando em cada trabalhador que encontra pelas ruas um pouco de si mesmo. Essa música é uma homenagem à esses heróis cotidianos.

image:image.image:title: Late Night Lot

image:image.image:title: AD ASTRA
image:image.image:caption: Scott (Scout) Ryker (Brett Severin) is an average teenager, eager to do anything other than what he is supposed to do. He had no plans for his future, and frankly, didn't care. After his U.S. History teacher assigns him a summer project, his entire universe changes. Follow Scout's journey, told by Scout himself, as he discovers his destiny lies in the stars, and what that means for you.

image:image.image:title: The Man Who Flew with The Fish
image:image.image:caption: From the invention of musical instruments until the creation of an artisanal publisher, the Caiçaras Editions, "The Man Who Flew with The Fish" tells the story of Marcio Barreto on his daily artistic tangle. A journey of cultural action and environmental discussion following the plural mind of its creator in a constant reflection about our origins. / De la invención de instrumentos musicales para la creación de una editoria artesanal, Las Ediciones Caiçaras, "El hombre que voló con los peces" cuenta la historia de Marcio Barreto en su enmarañado artistico. Un viaje de la acción cultural y la discusión medioambiental, siguiendo la mente plural de su creador, en una reflexión constante sobre nuestros orígenes.

image:image.image:title: PIERPAOLO-TRAILER
image:image.image:caption:
PierPaolo tells us about Pier Paolo Pasolini’s childhood and youth years, through the main characters of his life: his father Carlo Alberto, with whom he has a difficult love-hatred relationship; his mother, he’ll be very close with until his final days, they even lived together in the same house; his younger brother Guido, who joins the partisans during World War II and ends up murdered under strange circumstances; the delicate romantic and friendship relationship with two women: violinist Pina Kalz, a war refugee, and schoolteacher María, who went steady with him; and his deep infatuation with a peasant boy named Toni, he will keep this friendship throughout his life.
PierPaolo also takes us through the places that so marked his life (Belluno, Casarsa della Delizia, Scandiano, Conegliano, Sacile, Parma, Idria, Bologna, Versutta…) as since birth, Pasolini, became nomadic due to the moving from city to city, because his father was an army officer and every few months was appointed to new barracks. During those days his fascination for trains started, in the long waiting hours at the station and his love for the region of Friuli, where his mother belonged, that brought the discovery of an archaic and peasant word that boosted his creativity.
PierPaolo guides us inevitably to the scandal that will mark his whole life (Ramuscello) and his escape to Rome along with his mother in pursuit of better times…

image:image.image:title: Rough Adjustments
image:image.image:caption: A teenage girl faces her fear of seeing her horse for the first time after a riding accident that haunts her dreams. When starting to overcome her fear, she meets her future love interest.

image:image.image:title: APRIL "HIV MOVIE"
image:image.image:caption: April (Charlotte Roi), is a young girl who is excited about her engagement with Daniel (Lamin Tamba), their planned wedding quickly turned into heartbreak and deep depression after she found out that she is HIV Positive. Her fears of losing Daniel as well as the social stigma surrounding HIV/AIDS sufferers, made her extremely worried.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Girls on Tour
image:image.image:caption: Four girls. One hotel room. A whole lot of blood. Girls on Tour is a short comedy about the undeniable power of sisterhood squared up against the inevitable trauma of menstruation. It's girls as you've never seen them before.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: In Between (Home and a New Journey)
image:image.image:caption: A short film that invokes the feeling during travel when leaving the familiarity of home and going to a new destination.

image:image.image:title: In Between (Home and a New Journey)
image:image.image:caption: A short film that invokes the feeling during travel when leaving the familiarity of home and going to a new destination.

image:image.image:caption: A girl wakes up in a forest. Someone is coming for her. Appearances are deceptive - if only the Hunter and the Hunted were all that they seemed.

image:image.image:title: The Figment
image:image.image:caption: Story about a mother who creates a world within a world for her daughter to stay sane. Based on true story in Austria.

image:image.image:title: Kids in Brick Houses
image:image.image:caption: A case of home-squatting escalates into an unusual co-habitation situation.

image:image.image:title: ORANGE (PORTAKAL)
image:image.image:caption: Gizem is a desperate woman who tries to hold the life because she cannot have a baby. Therefore, her husband Muammer becomes estranged to her day by day. One day, Gizem's girlfriend who sings at the pubs, asks her to take a stage for one night in her place. Gizem reluctantly does accept her request however, Gizem's life gradually ruins and turns upside down after having made this decision.

image:image.image:caption: This short film is based on our Societies women in the world are treated like Piece of meat . We the Males Become Dogs when we see a women walking alone on the roads.

image:image.image:title: "Eternal" Teaser for the Short Film:
image:image.image:caption: Teaser for "Eternal", an Official Selection of the IndieWise Film Festival, about a distraught man who is saved from suicide by 'divine intervention'. Starring Keith McMahon. Written and directed by Ben Fiore.

image:image.image:title: Flip horizontal / Espejo horizontal
image:image.image:caption: Flora and Lauti see everything inverted, as through a mirror. They live in completely different worlds to ours. The force generated by the proximity between them can change us. When they touch eachother... they can travel to other dimensions.

image:image.image:title: Dead Town Episode 2 - This Must Be The Place
image:image.image:caption: Evening is drawing in and John is no closer to finding his daughter. Seeking Shelter they take refuge in the home of Brittain, a 17 year old agoraphobic traveller that has never left his house. However, after a motivational speech from 80s Dave, everything changes but will Brittain’s new found sense of adventure end in disaster?
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Our Place in the Wasteland
image:image.image:caption: The last two humans in a post-apocalyptic wasteland struggle to survive with only each other for support. The air is turning toxic and they have lost the ability to speak. In the harsh environment they exist in, they go through cycles of strength and weakness, awareness and delirium, acceptance and rejection.

image:image.image:title: Tipo tranquilo parties
image:image.image:caption: Tipo Tranquilo parties came up with the initiative of three friends (Gabriel, Erick and Alejandro) were looking for something different in the electronic scene in Guatemala. They account of several factors affecting the deejays and the true music lovers, for that reason they started this movement to perform various parties at different locations were given. Inviting friends hidden way, without much publicity, you can only be reached via a map.

image:image.image:title: Dead Town Episode 1 - Road to Nowhere
image:image.image:caption:
John eats mayonnaise for a living. At least he did until his boss turned into a zombie then tried to eat him. Now all he wants to do is find his daughter Emily and keep her safe. But in zombie infested Runcorn, even simple tasks like crossing the street or finding batteries for your vintage Sony Walkman have become a matter of life or death.
Armed with a mayonnaise stirring paddle and porno mags for armour; John, along with his retro best friend, 80s Dave and his apocalypse obsessed brother, Butty begin the search for his daughter.
Or they would if their car didn’t keep breaking down!
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

image:image.image:title: Last Exit to Ricklesburgh: Episode One
image:image.image:caption: The first episode of the BAFTA nominated series. When Chaff and Adrian rent a house in the little-known town of Ricklesburgh, they begin to discover that nothing is as it seems and the people that live there are anything but normal. A great philosopher once wrote, sometimes it’s necessary to go a long distance out of the way in order to come back a short distance correctly. Obviously this great philosopher had never been to Ricklesburgh.
image:image.image:geo_location: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

Produced and Created by Vito Brancato

image:image.image:title: LIBERTY
image:image.image:caption:
Liberty (Experimental film) poetically incorrect.
I present a poetic and unusual film, inspired by the famous poem LIBERTY of Paul Eluard. (Au rendez-vous allemand 1945).
" I like to talk like undressing, not to show off, as do the exhibitionists, but to stop hiding "
Marie-Cécile GUEGUEN (2015)

image:image.image:title: Cafe Gangster - Episode #1 "Five Dollars and a Snickers Bar"
image:image.image:caption: Karl’s hot streak during the weekly poker game comes to a violent end when Father Frankie takes out his frustration with a .38. Tension builds when Mick the Cop unexpectedly stops in for a cup of coffee and into the murder scene. Luckily Carmine has a “system” for dismembering a corpse, but during the car ride to the burial spot, a heated argument leads to sloppy disposal of the body parts.

image:image.image:title: ONESELF
image:image.image:caption: ONE is a guy who lives alone in his house that once belonged to his parents. ONE gets used to enjoy his loneliness, until he falls in love with “SHE”. Although he really loves living with SHE, he tries to come back to his loneliness because ONE feels he´s better alone than with SHE. When loosing SHE, ONE becomes aware that he needs SHE and tries to bring her back to him.

image:image.image:title: CAFE GANGSTER preview trailer
image:image.image:caption: From writer-director Vito Brancato… Mobsters, bikers, sex, drugs, guns and murder…a dark (very dark) comedy webseries. A crew of local gangsters use a coffee shop in Chicago’s Little Italy as a front for their criminal activities. Meanwhile, a bungling, sex addicted FBI agent stumbles upon their plan to smuggle Sicilian heroin in bags of espresso beans.

image:image.image:title: Where Is My Mothre's House
image:image.image:caption: Old and the elderly people that in nursing homes have been abandoned by their children and they suffer from lack of their love. They look forward to seeing their families, to fix their eyes to the uncertain future. Despite the good conditions sanatorium like to leave and return to the bosom of their families. Madam Keshvar help to Fereshte who is blind woman. she take her to the Spinning looms every day. They unfasten skein of yarn and do it over and over. It seems that this futile repeat is much hope for their survival.

image:image.image:title: Ahmed Mabolia
image:image.image:caption: Trailer of a Documentary. During that hard economic situation that we live in, A career of a carpenter is on its way to disappear . Ahmed Mabolia is a struggler Egyptian carpenter who preserves the old way for doing the job inherited from his father, also he has a desire and ability to teach the job to others. Also the film shows the humanity side of Ahmed Mabolia who takes care of his children after his wife's death .

image:image.image:title: Like Starting Over
image:image.image:caption: Like Starting Over is the story of former athlete MMA and Pro Wrestler Aaron Reese who is forced to retire and moves back to his old home town now he is a single Father of 3 pre teen children and gets a job at his old school, now the fight for life begins, its a story of faith love and redemption.

image:image.image:title: Old Folks
image:image.image:caption:
Short animation movie.
Robert and Suzanne are an old couple, who lives in New York and just don't get along. One day Suzanne insult Robert and he takes a trip down memory lane, back to Greenwich village in the 60's, when Robert was a folk singer, and Suzanne was a photographer. Through the music they both remember why they fell in love at first place.

image:image.image:title: I want ToBe Afsaneh
image:image.image:caption: Afsaneh is forced to marry at the age of thirteen because of her mother’s behavior that she discriminated between Afsaneh and her brothers. After three years of life with her husband, she becomes owner a boy. Due to the traditional thoughts and severity of his husband and his famliy she is separated from his husband. She is busy and passes her life in sewing. she has to supply the equipment that needed to work in installments way and this led to her acquaintance with her second husband . After getting married she realizes his addiction and despite having a girl she is separated from him. She has to sell his kidney to provide a shelter for her daughter and herself. After eight years living there , in order to repair the house she has to get some loans from an investor and therefore loses her house. Now she lives with her daughter Sahar in the dilapidated house. She works for a living in a store socks. She tells about her pains and problems that have never been solved for 40 years. Is her trying to keep her to be Afsaneh or eventually she breaks up under the burdens sitting on her shoulders?

image:image.image:title: In the cardboard box
