image:image.image:title: ACHENA [ THE UNKNOWN]
image:image.image:caption: Story of a doctor who returns to his hometown after his regional seminar about Wendigo Psychosis. His two cousins and his best friend being aware of the situation plays a prank by telling him an original folk story of the locality and building a story which sounds like Wendigo, knowing that it's his area of interest. The prank goes well, but a few abrupt incidents happen as well! Even though he will be aware of one or two of those incidents but later presumes may be in dark he got it all wrong! Until next evening when he gets a vision of the ghost from the folk tale! Was he hallucinating because the story got into his nerves or indeed the Folk tale came into life?

image:image.image:title: One Day With a Tattoo Artist
image:image.image:caption: Short documentary about the italian tattoo artist Simona Ercole, a dedicated and creative person who really loves what she does. This is a personal project which gave me the chance to measure myself with my favourite genre of video. Check out my blog post for more informations: michelangelotorres.net/2015/08/21/one-day-with-a-tattoo-artist-my-first-short-documentary/ Cameras: Panasonic GH4, Panasonic LX100 Lenses: Voigtlander Nokton 25mm f0.95, Olympus Zuiko 12mm f2.0 Editing: Final Cut Pro X Grading: DaVinci Resolve Lite, Filmconvert Music: Tracey Chattaway - Holding On (traceychattaway.com/) courtesy of themusicbed (musicbed.com/) Simona's web page: it-it.facebook.com/smountattoofan

image:image.image:title: Dasein Official Trailer
image:image.image:caption: ‘Dasein’ is a postmodern, meta-narrative avant-garde feature film. It tells the story of a young painter Aniket Chatterjee, who commits suicide by taking sleeping pills. When he slowly approaches towards death, standing at the boundary of life and death, what comes to his mind, what he realises, this film is all about that. It is a voyage from one’s consciousness to sub consciousness and at times the boundary becomes blurring. The film deals with issues such as person hood, mortality and the paradox of living in relationship with other humans while being ultimately alone with one self. The story revels that morality does not inherently exist, and that any established moral values are abstractly contrived. It explores the roots of eternal human desire and despair. The crisis of existence and human values in today’s material world has been portrayed in the film. Finally it is all about one’s search for his inner self, the absolute truth and his salvation.

image:image.image:title: Nie Wywoluj Wilka z Lasu
image:image.image:caption: Having orchestrated a nationwide scheme, a group of criminals finally get their comeuppance in the form of a man disguised as a Wolf.

image:image.image:title: Nexus - the 5th of us
image:image.image:caption: In some notes left to him by his father, a young warden of creatures with supernatural powers finds information about a Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse, who can either stop or initiate the apocalypse. A dark and bloody path leads him to his destined place.

image:image.image:title: Bioethic vision
image:image.image:caption: Bioethic Vision is a concrete image search, on video, on the sound; a search that led me to observe nature, take it and record it without fear of confusing me, but comparing them and recognizing in it, my identity as a man. Each panel is minimal and speaks through the vital and healthy being symbology, excluding deliberately to treat his greatest weakness: the material selfishness that in this age exceeds all limits.

image:image.image:title: QISSBAH: What is not a story? Trailer
image:image.image:caption: Qissbah - A mythical place where people go to listen to stories and attain Moksha (Nirvana). A place from where no one has ever returned. Masoom Gautam Lekhi, a scriptwriter, is troubled by a dysfunctional marriage. His father had left his mother and him in search of Qissbah, never to return again. He wants to write a script on Qissbah and through that, find out what might have happened to his father, and if this place exists for real. This quest will take him on a journey that will lead to shattering yet enlightening ambiguities; which blur the lines between reality and fiction. The psyche of children from broken families, marriage, fidelity, egotism, career, Krishna, Buddha and the importance of storytelling are explored through the story of Masoom and his search for this mythical place called Qissbah.

image:image.image:title: VERSUS

image:image.image:title: Scenes Of Bohemian Life
image:image.image:caption: Based on Henry Murger's novel "Scenes Of Bohemian Life" ("Scenes de la vie de boheme"). ) The film's plot is probably more known to the lovers of opera, rather than to the lovers of literature. Puccini's La Boheme is loosely based on the novel by Henri Murger. Konstantin Seliverstov takes action of his film from Paris of the 19th century to St. Petersburg of the 21st, while retaining the French names of the protagonists. Directed in such a way, that it emphasizes that there is Bohemian state and national borders. A bohemian life - a fun, light-hearted, romantic, sad, and sometimes, alas, is tragic. The musical accompaniment to the film matches this spectrum of moods. You'll hear great music by Rossini, Scarlatti, Mendelssohn, Straus.

image:image.image:title: How I became you
image:image.image:caption: A short film about self-censorship, imposed behavioral norms, opinions and attitudes which ultimately lead to the crucifixion of one’s personality. The film begins with the retrospective memory of the earliest days of author’s childhood, and continues toward the present day, showing the process of changing and forging one’s personality. The process includes the influence of the parents and surrounding, as well as the mass-media. Through a series of short flash-backs, the author reflects upon socially-imposed restrictions and rules, she encounters in her everyday life. In the end, one question stays opened- is anyone strong enough to endure the weight of chains?

image:image.image:title: The Black Goo
image:image.image:caption: Industrial Revolution made humans able to advance further into the 21st century. Technological progress came with one more effect, industrial pollution. The factories became full scale industries and manufacturing units and the issue of industrial pollution started to take on more importance. This issue is related to all of us, to the whole humanity and there is a huge need to fight against environmental degradation. Industrial pollution takes on many faces and it's the same for the most of the countries. It contaminates many sources of drinking water, releases unwanted toxins into the air and reduces the quality of soil all over the world. The Black Goo, a futuristic and apocalyptic short documentary drama reveals the issue and shows the dire consequences of unreasonable and excessive use of environmental resources. The Film was shot in the Georgian industrial town of Rustavi. To deepen the mood and heighten the impact of the film’s nearly extinctive look and to provide stronger emotional connection with the surrounding subjects, the director chose black and white colours and dark ambient music. The film is experimental as the director combines and holds the roles of screenwriter, executive producer, editor and music composer.

image:image.image:title: The Trial
image:image.image:caption: The protagonist, Josef K., a bank clerk, is arrested under an unjustified charge. But the arrest is symbolic - the hero is not imprisoned and is free to live his life. At first it seems that if Josef just pretends as if nothing has happened, the charge will just go away of its own accord. However, he is gradually sucked in by the trail, which becomes more and more bizarre as it progresses. All his attempts to break free and prove his innocence are futile, as his trail is not being conducted by any normal civil court. Josef K. is holding his own trail over himself. This movie is an adaptation of Franz Kafka's "The Trial".

image:image.image:title: Forget Shorter Showers
image:image.image:caption:
Would any sane person think dumpster diving would have stopped Hitler, or that composting would have ended slavery or brought about the eight-hour workday; or that chopping wood and carrying water would have gotten people out of Tsarist prisons; or that dancing around a fire would have helped put in place the Voting Rights Act of 1957 or the Civil Rights Act of 1964?
Then why now, with all the world at stake, do so many people retreat into these entirely personal “solutions”? Why are these solutions not sufficient? But most importantly, what can be done instead to actually stop the murder of the planet?

image:image.image:title: Sunset Rock
image:image.image:caption:
Jasey Rae - a Midwest native and NIU Communications student with a passion for online fandom - travels to Los Angeles to research famous YouTube personality known only as Lincoln for her thesis project on social media. The relationship between fan and creator soon becomes a complicated entanglement as the pair begin developing both a new web series and a romantic bond that causes each to examine the way they project themselves online and imagine one another.
All is not as it seems, and as the two spend more and more time together, documenting the cities famous landmarks for their YouTube channel, Jasey and Lincoln begin to unravel secrets about who the other truly is.
Set in Los Angele’s emerging YouTube Community, Sunset Rock is a romantic coming-of-age story, dealing issues of celebrity worship, first love, and disillusionment -- reminiscent of films like Once, Frances Ha, and Like Crazy. It stars Andrew Nowak of Lincoln, Nebraska and Megan Baim of Crested Butte, Colorado, and is written/directed by Marc Wilkinson of Chicago, Illinois.

image:image.image:title: Siberia - Trailer
image:image.image:caption: When Sputnik II was sent into space with a dog, named Laika on board, it was a major leap for science. Laika’s unfortunate death in space was lauded as a worthy sacrifice for the sake of the betterment of humankind’s forays into space. But that’s the human point of view. Imagine yourself as Laika – unable to understand where you’re going, what you’re doing and not even knowing if there is a way back or will you only be left circling the orbit; around the earth and the world you know but just not in it. Imagine being isolated and alone and senselessly being controlled by forces that you don’t comprehend. And even if you had the force of reason, are you ever anything more than collateral damage? Or an achievement someone can tick off his or her list? Is your only purpose to serve as an example and a sacrifice? The story of Siberia draws from and is dedicated to the story of Laika, sent into space in the Sputnik II. The film follows its central character, Reena, trapped a seemingly familiar scenario of a woman who believes that as she sits in her house, alone, she is accompanied by the looming presence of a large rat. This fear traps her in the confines of her own home and she goes through periods of panic, intense calm and rushes of adrenaline. But the question remains, how far has she really come and has her self-propelled exile really mattered?

image:image.image:title: Dr. Face
image:image.image:caption:
*OFFICIAL SELECTION- The 2016 Calgary Comic & Entertainment Expo*
A film noir superhero satire, 'Dr. Face' follows the story of Glen Spacey, a detective who develops the power of superface. The power granted him enhanced perception, super strength and the ability to obsorb knowledge through him face, allowing him to clean up the mean streets of Calgary. With his main adversary gaining control of the city, a marriage left crumbling and the stress of the job effecting his performance, can he save the city?
Filmed entirely in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, with a budget of just $200, was written and produced by Spencer Streichert and Directed by Ryan Drescher. With a cast of University of Calgary drama students, professional film actors and 50 extras bringing the script to life, and a crew of award wining filmmakers and SAIT film and video production students collaborated to bring 8 minutes of comedic gold.

image:image.image:title: SAANKAL MOVIE OFFICIAL TRAILER #01
image:image.image:caption: In the middle of the Thar Desert of Rajasthan there was a village surrounded by its own rituals, Taboos & social obligations. There, any dilution in the blood due to inter-cast marriages resulted in violence. Boys were allowed to get girls from other community as there brides but their own community girls were aging. Worried by this, the leaders decided something weird. As per them, aging single girls were forced to marry boys of their children's age. Their belief was this way daughters of their community won't go outside & the boys will not be able to get girls from outside of their community, but kids like Kesar (11 Yrs) & young girls like Abeera (26 Years) became victims of this malpractice. The ill effects of this tradition have been conveyed through this film "Saankal" (Shackle).

image:image.image:title: Kulong (Shut-In)
image:image.image:caption: Teresa, and her newly-wed husband Kiko, decides to start their life together with her uncle, who gave Kiko a job and a place for them to live. During their stay, Teresa notices strange actuations from her uncle which leads to arguments between her and Kiko. The heightening tension builds up when Kiko finds out about the uncle’s true motives.

image:image.image:title: Lives in me
image:image.image:caption: A small clock that loses his father at a very young age, misplace an object with a very great sentimental value. In the search for it, find a connection with his father.

image:image.image:title: GRIFFIN
image:image.image:caption: “Griffin” is a socially-relevant, coming of age story set in Del Ray; the soulful heartbeat of the city of Alexandria, Virginia. It follows four friends through their journey from adolescence to adulthood and the hurdles they must overcome along the way. Written as a narrative, you see how this realistic portrayal of life in Del Ray unfolds from the perspective of Griffin - one of the four best friends. He reflects on the challenges he and his friends face in their community, their coping mechanisms, and the consequences and triumphs of their actions along the way. Jeff, Tim, Sean, and Griffin learn the importance of loyalty and friendship. As they unknowingly become father figures to each other, the question quickly becomes can they overcome the boundaries of a town that’s pushing them down before it’s too late?

image:image.image:title: Singapore Paranormal Myth
image:image.image:caption:
Have you ever wonder if life existed beyond us? Do you believe in ghost? Are they always around us?
This documentary of the Singapore Paranormal Myth will reveal the answer as a team of experts from Singapore Paranormal Investigators (SPI) went down to Pasir Ris Suicide Tower to investigate and communicate with the other kind.

image:image.image:title: WO-men (the discomfort in inequality)
image:image.image:caption: WO-men" is the story here depicts the current scenario of today's modern society, where humanity is not valued. Nowadays, a male chauvinist can proudly do whatever he wants, without thinking that it may hurt others sentiments. But when things go other way round, and how that person behaves when the same situation happens with him,is something which is eye opening. The bottom line is, think before you hurt somebody, Because karma always follows you.

image:image.image:title: THE REWARD - LA RECOMPENSA
image:image.image:caption:
Francisco is escorted by Sergeant Martinez and a group of soldiers in search of a marijuana plantation. Francisco has promised to show them the way in exchange for a monetary reward, but apparently, it is complicated to remember the exact location. By finding the field by another group of soldiers who accompanied them, Francisco ask for a part of the reward ... But things are not always as one would like.
SINOPSIS (ESPAÑOL) Francisco es acompañado por el Sargento Martínez y un grupo de militares en busca de un plantío de marihuana. Francisco les ha prometido mostrarles el camino a cambio de una recompensa económica, pero al parecer se le complica recordar el lugar exacto. Al ser encontrado el plantío por otra tropa de militares que los acompaña, Francisco le pide al Sargento Martínez que le sea entregada una parte de la recompensa… Pero las cosas no siempre resultan como uno quisiera.

image:image.image:title: Dane Granger

Upon her return she must face the Grace Harper (Linda Schrader), the girl that got away and her past that won't go away. Dane Granger is a tale of loss, love, and madness. A self-destructive 25 year old is thrown into a misadventure that will result in her absolute insanity or a path to redemption. Dane is a twisted tale of addiction to toxicity and loving to the point of madness. Dane Granger features some amazing Midwest talent such as James Liberty as the Faceless Man, JoAnna Lloyd as Matty Harper, and Brandon Saylor as Walt Smith. Written by Stephanie Hensley and directed by Stephanie Hensley and Bryan Jolliffe Dane Granger is a ride that many of us have taken... Loving too hard and feeling too much. Love is the disease-Madness is the symptom.

CARRY ON (lyrics)
Written, composed and performed by Chad Fontaine Violin is played by Lisa Bates!!!
They won't employ me, they would much rather destroy me, well, the truth is I am better on my own. They tell me I am deranged from bumming change and riding trains well, the truth is life is better on the road.
Carry on, carry on, travel that old dusty road before that road is overgrown! Carry on, carry on, travel that old dusty road before you’re old and dead and gone!

Carry on, carry on, travel that old dusty road before that road is overgrown! Carry on, carry on, travel that old dusty road before you’re old and dead and gone!

image:image.image:title: Here Even So
image:image.image:caption: A semi-biographical, experimental short film about a woman who has just recently lost the man that she loved dearly. The filmmaker, Eli Hayes, who lost his father to esophageal cancer back in 2012 dedicates this film to his mother, who knows grief all too well. Here Even So, a silent, non-narrative film, concentrates on the internal, emotional state of a widow in the aftermath of losing her husband, and the stages of grief - progressing from fear of loneliness to eventual hope. All of the artwork in this short is art that was left behind by Eli's father, as he was a professor of art history at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee prior to his passing. The film is shot in the Hayes residence, the location where the director's parents were married back in 1988 (five years before Eli's birth in 1993).

image:image.image:title: Rakut Si Telu (Kinship System in tone composition)
image:image.image:caption: Five years living with volcanic ash from Sinabung Volcano have made lot of displaced people; youth and elder people lost their identity because affected by the community who lives nearby them who doesn’t affected by the Sinabung eruption but have forgotten their life philosophy, Karonesse philosophy; Rakut Sitelu (Kinship System). As a young artist, this condition has made Brevin Tarigan and his friends try to deliver their concern through ancient sounds and song. Brevin and his friends made Dokan Village that has become an iconic cultural village as a place to ask and listen from the old people. And in this village, Brevin Tarigan and his friends establish their concern by reminding Karo people who have already forgotten their philosophy of life because of Sinabung Eruption through ancient sound and songs that has been modified in to modern styles.

image:image.image:title: Partners
image:image.image:caption: Partners follows the lives of two, Rural North Carolina, uniformed police Officers in a small southern town; Officer John Walker and Officer Mandy Kain. Both middle aged and veterans of the department; the story, told in five separate segments, will focus more on how the two officers handle both the job and their personal lives. The story will touch on the problems police officers face in today's society; however, it will not be the typical police action drama portrayed in larger scale films or television series. The story is very character driven and deals more with the personal side of each character and the friends and co-workers which surround them.

image:image.image:title: Shadow Mountain PART ONE
image:image.image:caption:
Dive deep into a dark mystery that hangs like a shadow over a small town at the base of the Olympic Mountains in Washington State. Introducing Shadow Mountain -
Logline - A teenage boy uncovers his mysterious past when he moves to a small town where his strange dreams seem to come to life and haunt him.
Description - Cody dreams about a strange but beautiful girl, meanwhile his family moves to a small town that holds secrets about their mysterious past. His dreams have a dark side that cast a shadow that seems to be bleeding into a horrible reality that he can't escape.
"Shadow Mountain" is the first web series from myself, indie filmmaker Ryan A. Herring. I feel I represent the new indie show runner/filmmaker that is emerging from the fringes of the industry and finding audiences online. I created the series, I wrote, shot, produced, edited, VFX, set-costume design, you name it - I did it, for this show.
Starring real life mother and son Alison Weathers and Caleb Weathers, myself as the missing Father, and my own ten year old daughter in her first ever acting role as the little sister. Also Starring the talents of Rachelle Henry, a young actress quickly on the rise, as the mysterious girl in Cody's dreams.

image:image.image:title: The Olympians PILOT
image:image.image:caption:
The Olympians is a new historical fiction series set in the 1870's, in a wild and untouched corner of the country - the Olympic Peninsula in Washington Territory.
Jacob Miller ventures alone into a new port town and gets mixed up with bad people. Chuka is a young Klallam man who is sent out alone into the mountains to seek guidance from the Great Spirit.
This is a low budget pilot created as a proof of concept for the series "The Olympians", which is an hour long historical fiction show based on the history of the Olympic Peninsula in Washington State, written and created by Ryan A.Herring.
For more info contact ryanherringdirector@gmail.com. Thanks for watching, please share and subscribe!

image:image.image:title: We Are Torn
image:image.image:caption:
On the two sides of the coin comes with the same the natural scorns that occur whenever one eats a single bowl of cereal. However, we are all one, we are all many, but we will never be anyone else's enigma.
Created in the Education for the Arts Lab at Vicksburg High School.
The scrolling body text is a mixture of various different sources. It's a mix of my own thoughts, a bible verse, the opening line to Stanley Kubrick's 'A Clockwork Orange', and lyrics to Marilyn Manson's song, 'Target Audience'.
I do not own the rights to any of these sources. The rights go to each respective owner.
Tell me your thoughts. :)
Created by - Logan Workman Starring - Nathaniel Chiu
For those curious, here's the body text in its entirety.:
"And I see all the young believers, your target audience. Am I sorry to be alive, putting my face in the beehive? But I’m just a pitiful anonymous. Well. Why should I have to be written into being? What wrong? Thank you, it really does mean a lot. This means nothing. Get out of my room. The internal twines that are thrown to be. But I’m sorry Shakespeare was your scapegoat. My father’s prison beating. Get the lies out before they find your struggle to keep in the excuses. Even in the glories of chicanery will not make you happy. There was me, that is the hierarchy, and my three Droogs. You should be ashamed of yourself. Be sober minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour. ‘1 Peter 5:8’ I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry I’m sorry"

image:image.image:title: Tutwiler
image:image.image:caption: A selection of Big Apple Film Festival & Winner of Best Screenplay & Best Actress at Atlanta Independent Film Festival -Inspired by true events occurring inside Alabama's only women's prison, Tutwiler sheds light on the inhumane treatment & sexual abuse of the inmates. The women are subjected to perform sexual acts in order to receive necessities such as clothes, food, & toiletries. An orphanage was started, taking in all of the unwanted children that are born inside the prison, that are products of rape by the guards. Tutwiler hopes to make enough noise and raise enough awareness that a change is made!

image:image.image:title: Jack Boyz Teaser Trailer
image:image.image:caption: Set in a present day urban environment, "Jack Boyz" is the gritty tale of an ambitious crew of stick-up men with a flawless record. Led by the wise and meticulous minded Salim, the gang follows a strict week-long regimen of cleansing and synergy before each heist. By adhering to Salim's personally crafted approach to crime, the unit develops a signature level of execution and harmony unparalleled in street crime. But when one member of the team breaks discipline and violates a key principle, he jeopardizes his team's reputation and unwittingly aids in the kidnapping of a vital lifeline; his own lover. With the Jack Boyz' integrity now in question and an innocent life in his hands, Salim must decide whether to bow out and preserve his own livelihood or prove that his exercises of discipline and harmony were not in vain.

image:image.image:title: God Among Men | 2016 Short Film
image:image.image:caption:
Grieving over the death of his beloved, one troubled boy faces the consequences of his actions through the malleability of his newfound life.
---
Can an all-mighty, omnipotent being draw a square circle, or create a boulder so heavy that even they cannot move? If not, are they truly omnipotent? One troubled young adult, drowning in his own madness as he grieves for his departed beloved, is faced with this challenge when he wakes up as a god the morning after committing a mass murder. With his newfound life, the boy must face the consequences of his actions through the impossibility of his existence and the illusions that dwell within it. Directed, edited, produced, and written by Forrest DePoy, God Among Men serves as a proof-of-concept short film that was shot on a shoe-string budget and created over the course of half a year as part of a self-introduced challenge set by the amateur director to break into filmmaking with little to no experience.
Director: Forrest DePoy Composer: VAULT | enterthevault.net Production Company: Dirtyfox Productions Format: Digital
WEB: dirtyfoxproductions.com FACEBOOK: facebook.com/dirtyfoxproductions TWITTER: twitter.com/dirtyfoxpro

image:image.image:caption: Forced into Silence explores what it means to be a male who has been abused by a partner/spouse, sexually assaulted or raped and an adult man who was sexually abused. Featuring interviews with author, therapist and expert on boys, men and masculinity Andrew Smiler, Ph.D., speaker and CEO of Male Survivor Christopher Anderson, relationship coach, writer, speaker and presenter Jasmin Newman, as well as two former victims of domestic violence Forced into Silence is reveals the unique challenges of men who have been victimized.

image:image.image:title: SYNC - Official Trailer
image:image.image:caption:
SYNC tells the story of Ryan, an ex-Marine is abducted by a secret organization, but he escapes with an A.I. chip implant in his head. Ryan is trying to find out what happened to him and how to get the chip implant removed, but he is being hunted by the organization that put the implant in his head. He has to find his way home, but what he doesn’t know is that the organization that abducted him has a different plan in mind.
SYNC was directed by Craig Thiessen as part of his high school thesis. The film was also completed with almost no budget.

image:image.image:title: Ronan Chronicles
image:image.image:caption: Imagine a world where writers are original and journalists expose the real. Now imagine a world where writers are pawns, outlets for worlds that already exist. Now meet an author who thinks he is writing original content and a journalist who believes she is exposing the truth. The universe is big, where anything is possible. What if we told you every story you read, wrote, experienced, is a retelling of an event somewhere, out there in the universe. Meet the Ronan Chronicles, where we will show you everything is possible, because everything has already happened.

image:image.image:title: Empire Vampire
image:image.image:caption:
EMPIRE VAMPIRE is a short musical film about epic change, starring The Goodnight Darlings, featuring performers from Cirque Du Soleil, The Orlando Ballet, and a cast of dancers, actors, magicians, & circus performers from across the globe. Directed by Sundance Film Festival Alumnus Roger Ingraham & Choreographed by Isis Masoud & Dancers, this film takes the Vampire genre to a whole other level.

image:image.image:title: TechSquad
image:image.image:caption: When the Department of Homeland Security needed a high-tech task force to fight modern day crime, they teamed up one hero cop with one tech savvy cop to form - TechSquad.

image:image.image:title: Game Over Short Action/Thriller
image:image.image:caption: A Game of Poker quickly becomes a Game of Survival, for some classy, unknowing folks.

image:image.image:title: What Lies Beyond... Trailer
image:image.image:caption:
WHAT LIES BEYOND... The Beginning A Film By Jarrod A Knowles A JAKVision Production
IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2921178/?...
Story-line: While on an ecology research trip, 8 diverse college students and a witty chaperone must decide whether to fight for their lives OR fight to escape, when suddenly all hell breaks loose. Some have a hidden agenda and connections with their past, while others are bold enough to do the unthinkable. This results in a dramatic, fast-paced, extremely humorous but bloody thrill ride, which ultimately leads to the revelation of a twist(s) so sick, you shall never recover.

image:image.image:title: Flying High
image:image.image:caption: An aimless space stoner attempts to reconcile his friendship with a cop by taking him on an otherworldly adventure to get high one last time.
